description:
I ordered from this Blue Barn Gourmet location via Postmates, so I cannot comment on the dining experience in-store. My order (The Tostada salad) came in an adorable, massively sized to-go box, and was packed to the brim with salad, which I was very impressed with. Although I was starving and devoured the whole thing, the salad is definitely large enough to be split over two meals. The Tostada consists of romaine, chicory chop, toasted corn, black beans, cherry tomatoes, jicama, scallions, herbs, pumpkin seeds, tortilla strips, white cheddar & chipotle-agave vinaigrette, and cost $13.75.

The romaine was not super crunchy, did not taste incredibly fresh, and the ingredients seemed a little wilted, but I will give Blue Barn the benefit of the doubt and chalk it up to being smushed at the bottom of a delivery bag for 45 minutes. The chipotle-agave vinaigrette was incredibly flavorful, complements the salad perfectly, and really gives the salad a "southwestern" profile. Perhaps if I ordered and dined in-store, the ingredients would taste fresher and look more alive. I would not recommend ordering their salads via third-party delivery apps.

Blue Barn is a little more expensive compared to its competitors, which I am not sure is warranted. While Blue Barn Gourmet delivers an awesome salad, I would recommend Split (and even sweetgreen) before recommending Blue Barn. Nonetheless, you cannot go wrong with any of the salads here.
author: Claire L.

description:
I am still dreaming of Blue Barn. I visited SF for work and ate here 4/5 days that I was in the area.

The salads are freaking bomb dot com. I was obsessed with the spring salad. I added steak, medium rare and fell in love with every bite. The salad has everything you can imagine and it keeps you full all day. I think the salads are intended to be shared but I ate the whole thing every time because I didn't have a fridge in my room and because the salad was that good.
author: Shelley C.

description:
I've always wanted to try the food at Blue Barn because it's always packed to the brim with people... which means the food and the service must be excellent! Right?
Big mistake on my part!

This location on Chestnut Street is tiny and badly designed to accommodate eating there... I would order to go.

I ordered a simple, but pricey, fried chicken sandwich and fries with an iced tea. About 30 minutes had gone by and I still was waiting for my food! I thought something is definitely not right, since people that had come in after me were receiving their food orders. I finally enquired about my order and the woman who appeared to be running the show located my food and dumped it on the table... no apologies... nada!!

Some advice: Warm, friendly customer service makes up for any mishaps in the kitchen. Also if you're the manager and are having a hectic, busy day fulfilling food orders, it's always a good idea to be upfront and inform the customer at the time of placing the order that there maybe a longer than usual wait of say 20 mins or more.

Long wait + dismissive customer service + inflated prices = Blue Barn Gourmet 

NO THANKS!  Blue Barn
author: Brian H.

description: I LOVE this place. Albeit a bit pricey, the tostada with chicken is amazing and light and the flavors are just incredible. Food is always very fresh and service is great. Highly recommend!!
author: Kelsey E.

description:
Absolutely in love with this place. Yes, the salads are expensive. But I thought it was worth it- the portions are huge! My tuna salad kept me full from an early lunch until a late dinner.

They have a great selection of a lot of different types of salads, and even a build your own option, though it was a little overwhelming to choose ingredients while standing at the counter so I opted for one of their ready-made options. My to-go salad came in an adorable box that looked like Chinese takeout, so obviously photo-worthy. The salad had a generous scoop of tuna tartare, tons of greens, and enough mix-ins that I didn't even need the lemon miso dressing for flavor.

This is definitely a post workout type of spot. I love the vibe and all of the healthy options. I will be back!
author: Courtney R.

description: Great salads! Cute and casual environment. Great for vegetarian/vegans. Salads come with a delish rosemary bread. The ingredients are high quality!! Also nice for kids. No wonder everything so delicious. Ingredients all come from their family farm in Sonoma
author: Lisa M.

description: Disappointing customer service.  Messed up multiple orders and greens were entirely wilted / stale.
author: Steven R.

description: This restaurant was recommended to me from my hiking instructor at my hotel. I said I was going to be in the area for work, I headed there early to avoid traffic and walked around the plaza. It was great timing because there was a farmers market there. I walked around and tried a few samples until I got hungry enough for a meal. I was excited when I saw Blue Barns' menu because it was all very health forward. I decided to get a quinoa bowl, adding salmon and avocado. You get to fill out your own card saying what kind of protein, base, and what vegetables you like to add. I believe I paid about $16 for my bowl, which isn't bad considering I ordered salmon and added avocado along with a few other extra vegetables. It took about 15 to 20 minutes to come out. There is indoor and outdoor seating and available parking in the parking lot outside of the Plaza. They serve you in a very cute Chinese takeout style box if you get your food to go. I ended up eating half of my meal outside and saved the other half for later. The portions are huge and if you get the quinoa bowl, you could probably make two meals out of it. Overall, I wish there was a Blue Barn closer to me because I really enjoyed the food here.
author: Addy G.

description:
I hate to dock this place because the staff are so friendly and helpful but the food is just not worth the price tag. This is a classic case of good branding that causes people to love a place because it's trendy to love it. 

Pros
- Good food portions
- Great hospitality
- Free Wifi
- Outdoor dining 

Cons
- Not flavorful 
- Ingredients aren't quality 
- Crowd
author: Marisa R.

description:
My fiancé and I arrived on Super Bowl Sunday and it was empty, which was fantastic as we were grabbing a late night bite before heading to the airport.

I ordered the Fattoush salad with chicken and he ordered the Arugula salad with chicken. At first, I thought it was slightly pricey for what it was but once I opened up my meal on the flight, I realized why. It was stacked! The Fattoush wasn't a true Mediterranean salad, but it was good nonetheless. Next time, I'll definitely be ordering more dressing than usual because I ran out half way through my salad.

Overall, this place is delicious and I would come back.
author: Jessica A.

description: Cute quaint little spot in the marine district with very large servings of fresh salads that will fill you up for the afternoon. Quick and friendly service, but a little pricey for a salad but it makes up for the freshness and large amount they serve you. Perfect stop to make after a little ng morning of sight seeing and shopping, just chill and people watch while devouring a large 2 person serving salad.
author: Varsenig K.

description: I have not been to this location. I would never go after seeing the dog in the dining area at the polk Street location. Disgusting
author: joe r.

description:
There are 2 Blue Barn locations very close to each other in the marina - this location on Chestnut St. is more of a pick-up/to go location, with a limited menu and seating options. If you're looking for a sit-down experience, be sure to check out the larger location on Steiner.

I love this Blue Barn because it has the core menu of salads/sandwiches and it's pretty quick to order your meal to go. 

It's pricey, but the salad portions are HUGE - it could easily be a meal split between 2 people. The ahi tuna salad is legit delicious. If you feel like indulging, their grilled cheese sandwiches are amazing as well.
author: Catherine S.

description:
This place has super cute interior design. They take your order in the front and then you find a place to sit.
I got the Tostada Salad which was super filling! It is actually a lot of food and you will definitely be satisfied at the end. Service was alright though.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I've heard coworkers talk about Blue Barn a few times, so I decided to check it out after working out in the area. It's a really tiny spot with self seating, so be prepared to wait for a table on the weekends. There is both indoor and outdoor seating, so it's nice to grab a table outside when the weather agrees. The salads are pricey, but I think the size justifies the price (they're HUGE) - especially for the Marina.

Tip - they take about 15-20 minutes to prepare your food so you can walk around the area for a bit while you wait!
author: Estelle C.

description: Amazing salad, but they really skimp on the vegetables other than the bed of greens it is served on. For $20 I'd expect more toppings on my salad. Pile of chicken, lots of kale, not much in between.
author: Anjali P.

description:
These are some Marina District price tag salads, but I don't pay for them so I'm not complaining. I just hope Blue Barn's providing their customers with some top notch greens straight from their backyard and chicken that run around like they have freedom but they really don't.

Pros:
+ Salads and sandwiches are huge and filling
+ Large takeout box is cute
+ Never had a salad I didn't like

Cons:
- Protein portions are mediocre

Recommendations:
+ Kale salad, add grilled salmon
+ Arugula salad, add steak
+ Fried chicken sandwich
+ Seared spicy tuna sandwich

I don't dress my salads, so it's safe to say the greens here are delicious all on their own. The protein portions are skimpy for what you pay (I've seen the menu). I usually run out of protein half way through. But the steak and grilled salmon are both tasty options. As for the sandwiches (they look like burgers), they're perfect in size but probably a bit too much if you're used to eating smaller portions and lighter meals. Loved both the fried chicken and tuna sandwiches!

Would I opt for Blue Barn for a salad? No, the cost can not be justified. Would I opt for a Blue Barn sandwich? Yessssss!
author: Fanny W.

description:
Don't get me wrong--Blue Barn is a spectacular place. The back seating area is precious with fairy lights, a barn-like setting, pretty wreaths and heat lamps. This Instagrammable salad spot has all the character in the world and its salads are simply gorgeous! It's the perfect spot to meet that old friend from college that you haven't seen in a long time while wearing your best Marina attire (I live in the neighborhood, so I feel like I can say this!). You can show up in your Lululemon or your skinny jeans, white converse and your English saddle Madewell tote. The attendants are as you would expect--generally helpful, but not overly hospitable. Well-groomed and outwardly patient. 

You will walk away having eaten a tasty salad and with another perfectly-edited photo for your Instagram feed!! 

Enjoy every bite of your $20 salad! Why do salads, like sandwiches, always taste better when someone else makes them! My favorite thing about Blue Barn: Spindrift sparkling water and mason jars to sip out of while munching on a salad with perfectly toasted quinoa!
author: Shelley V.

description: Consistently horrible yet we keep ordering because there's only so many salad places. $15 for some mixed greens and dressing, filled about 60% to the top. Thanks blue barn!
author: Andrew L.

description:
I love the Marina. It has a good vibe to go along with its many fantastic eateries, coffeeshops, and bars. Fortunately I was attending an event at Fort Mason, so it was the perfect opportunity to rendezvous with Nina Y. and catch up. We were deciding between eating a salad or Italian food. I wanted something more on the refreshing side, so Blue Barn it was.

From the moment you walk in, it's clear this is more of a to-go place, though I hear there's another Blue Barn location down the street that's less so. At any rate, I was able to snag some seats at the communal barstools while waiting for Nina. Ordering was pretty quick after that. I got their spicy tuna salad, which was massive! Ingredients include mixed greens, chicory chop, spicy ahi tuna, avocado, mango, snow peas, cucumber, scallions, sesame seeds, soba noodles & miso-ginger vinaigrette. WOW.

The salad was a bit pricey ($16.75) but you definitely get what you pay for. It's rare I'm unable to finish a salad because of how light it's supposed to be, but the to-go box was dauntingly large. An observation, not a complaint, of course. It also had a good amount of dressing, though I wish I had asked for more.

Good place to stop by if you're looking for a quick bite to eat or need something for the road. Though it can get pretty crowded, it seems like more people leave with their food than sit and eat, so there's a high probability you'll find somewhere to sit if you decide to dine in. At any rate, I would love to come here again and try other items on their menu!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Still terrible at answering the phone. For all intents and purposes, this location is closed for phone orders during lunch.
author: N G.

description: Nice little eatery in SF when you want a quick bite, but without feeling disgustingly full. The portion sizes are right, but the quality of ingredients is very fresh which is what makes the food taste good and get you back on your way. I decided to go the spicy BBQ chicken sandwich which was cooked very well. The bread was crispy, chicken done right and sauce provided the right kick.
author: Amir N.

description:
OK. I must say, I am NOT a salad person nor am I a Marina type of person. I rarely ate raw vegetables growing up, so salad is not in my repertoire of food and I usually don't venture out to this area of San Francisco. Blue Barn Gourmet though can probably convert those who do not like salad into salad eaters. Note, this Blue Barn Gourmet is not the one I went to, rather, there is a walk-in store right around the corner that has more of a "To-Go" kind of style and only serves salad. 

SALAD: Fattoush + Chicken. That champagne-sumac vinaigrette I tell you. There's something about it that makes it so tasty and it's the right amount they give you to perfectly season the whole thing. The nicoise olives add the perfect saltiness with the feta chese and then they put in the pita chips inside to give it that additional crunch that is not quite the same as the romaine. Somehow, all of that comes together in a salad that is actually filling, tasty, and makes me want to eat more. 

SERVICE: It isn't a sit-down full service kind of place, but the people were nice inside. 

Overall, Blue Barn Gourmet is one of those you only go once in a while to treat yourself to saying, "hey, I deserve a salad meant to be eaten by humans that tastes great". Although pricey, it's definitely good and a place if I was back in the neighborhood, I would consider going again.
author: Albert H.

description:
i got the spring salad with steak--super yum! i usually wish there were more greens and that was the case here. i just love greens. the steak was cooked perfectly as well. 

everything was super fresh, so no complaints there. the only thing i'd say is that it is fairly pricey. just know that going in. outdoor seating too, so that's nice. the whole restaurant was clean and tidy as well. 

i'll probably come again, just not super often.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Eyed Blue Barn while I walked down Chestnut and then became acutely aware of just how many people were walking around with cute take out boxes stamped with their name on it.

With that level of branding, this place must be good.

Came with a friend and shared two sandwiches, one popper grilled cheese and one masala chicken. The masala chicken won hands down in my opinion. It had an excellent curry flavor, but was not overwhelming. It was also stacked nice and high and served on a hearty slice of wheat which made for a very substantial bite. The popper on the other hand looked pretty small. It featured pepper jack cheese and goat cheese with a slice of bacon and some pepperoncini. The pepper jack definitely provided the nice little kick. But as a redeeming factor, the sandwich was delivered piping hot so the cheese was all nice and gooey - yum!

Space is limited to say the least inside Blue Barn but we were able to snag a couple stools on the bar. It was definitely cramped though so it's probably not the place to sit and draw out a lunch. 

My friend and I still did though and spent nearly an hour here eating and catching up on a bustling Sunday afternoon. So when we finally got up, within seconds, our neighbors scooted over and under their breath muttered "about time (they) left" to the people coming over to snag our seats - RUDE. Nothing against Blue Barn, but it was a little offputting.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
My daughter is a student at SFSU and loves to come here.  On a recent trip to the city to pick her up she wanted to take me here.  We both ordered sandwiches.  She has had several of the sandwiches, and of course has a core few favorites AKA The Sheep.  This day we ordered The Cheddar and The Clubber.  Split the sandwich between the two of us.  The Clubber was a little bit better of a choice, but both were good.  Would come here again, I would want to order a salad next time, they looked huge!

Parking really isn't a problem if you don't mid walking a few blocks.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Blue barn has three important ingredients going for it:
1. Great quality food 
2. Huge portions 
3. Wonderful atmosphere / space 

Went with the rooster while my wife chose the Caesar, wth added shrimp. Although The rooster is the fan favorite(You can't really go wrong with any combination of bacon chicken and guacamole), the Caesar is mighty impressive. Probably the most flavorful fresh tasting shrimp I've ever had.
author: Donald S.

description:
Great food and cool ambiance make this place a winner.  Its like Pottery Barn opened a cafe.

Turkey sandwich solid. Piled high on a toasted bun. Pesto, sun dried tomatoes.... Awesome. Ladies near me order salads that are in big white bowls that look beautiful.

Ambiance: menu on the window, reclaimed wood interior. A bit of a barn feel... its cozy and inviting. Self serve water with glass mason jar cups with handles on a roll away stainless steel cart. Napkins are housed in a wooden box with two metal horse shoes that serve as handles.

Wreaths and flower arrangements decorate the spot. Oddly enough the place smells a tad bit like the craft store, Michaels.

Service, food, cleanliness, value... its all here.
author: Stefan T.

description: I don't think I looked hard enough for a Sweetgreen in SF but every time I walk past this (or any other location) this place is packed -- definitely gives off the vibe of a post-workout lunch. The menu is very thoughtful, although I do think pricing is a little aggressive, having seen someone order a $22 takeout salad with add-ons. I myself had the chicken salad sandwich, which did taste great, but also did feel a little pricey.
author: Heidi L.

description:
This is the freshest, flavor on Point, mouthwatering delight spot for healthy eats. Salads for veggies and carnivores alike. 

The Buddha sandwich was so good I dreamed about it later. 

Marin kombucha on tap. Great wines. Amazing service. Adorable covered back patio with patio heaters - you will be happy you stopped into this spot.
author: Kate B.

description:
They say consistency is king. I'm a big believer in places that you can count on and deliver the same experience over and over. That's probably one of the hardest things to do in the service industry but, Blue Barn accomplishes this feat on a daily basis and I've never had a bad experience. 

Generally I'll make my own salad or order the "Rooster" sandwich because I've been eating them since this location opened and if it ain't broke, don't fix it. Yesterday I opted to make my own salad and it was a doozy. The chickory chop lettuces, cucumber, carrots, croutons, asparagus, mary's chicken...bomb. The miso ginger salad dressing is a must and always add avocado because it makes everything better. 

They have two locations in SF and I've been to both. Like I mentioned before...you're going to get the same great food at all their locations. It's got a great charm to it, a bit pricey for lunch but, all in all a great choice if you're willing to pay for a quality meal.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Had a delicious burrata grilled cheese. Simple and delicious. The pesto cream was flavorful but not overpowering and the mozzarella was perfectly fresh. The decor is adorable and hip. I heard someone say in reference to the place that they make the best overpriced salads you can get in the marina. I would argue that it wasn't an overpriced meal at all. In addition, I saw other people's salads going through and let me tell you, they are no joke! Large portion that would be multiple meals for me. And they also were serving fries that looked delish. I never made it that far, but I'd be willing to go back and try!
author: April W.

description: Good food, but really slow with the subtle arrogance that you come to expect from SF service
author: Andrew K.

description:
I have been overpaying for salads at fast casual establishments in expensive cities for almost six years now so I've become relatively numb to the poor economics associated with them but $18 (w/tax; pre-tip) for a kale caesar + chicken is flat out absurd. 

Food is good but doesn't justify it's price point at a seemingly casual spot. They also don't take Amex. If looking for a healthy, weeknight dinner for one, would avoid and check out the other options on Chestnut / Fillmore.
author: David J.

description: This place is like Pluto's with a cuter vibe. Order, serve yourself water/utensils, and they'll bring your food to you. You can pick something from the menu or design your own salad with up to 6 add-ins for about $13 with no meat. If you add meat, it'll set you back $20... Hello SF. They ask if you want your dressing on the side or tossed in. I made the mistake of picking tossed in and my friends were halfway through their salads before my order came out. As fresh and tasty as their ingredients may be, I can't justify paying $20 for a simple salad.
author: Tina H.

description:
Pros: delicious salad with very fresh vegetables and fruit, friendly staff, tasty Kombucha and pretty furniture. I would give t

Cons: got shrimp added to my salad and came out with 6 pieces of shrimp for $5.75 -- I would hope for at least 9 or 10 for $5.75.

Request from management, can you please start giving people a bit more shrimp, or lower the cost by $1.25 or so?
author: David C.

description:
Salad was decent, they give you a lot, but it was way overpriced. I ordered the spicy Chinese chicken salad with dressing on the side, to go. There wasn't enough dressing for the whole salad and the chicken didn't seem fresh (it was cut up in small cubes).

Overall, I think it's just way too pricey for what you end up getting.
author: Alexia S.

description:
I have always loved Blue Barn and I try to eat here when I visit the Marina district. However, there is always a line out the door and it is near impossible to find a seat... So maybe get takeout? 

Their salads are always very filling and they use extremely fresh ingredients. The last time I visited, I decided to not be as healthy and I ordered the Barn BLT. It was delicious and I was happy with my decision. I love a good sandwich. The bread was nicely toasted and all the ingredients went really well together! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. I also got a side of fries and the fries were delicious! They were crispy and nicely salted. 

I will definitely be back here. You can't go wrong with anything they offer on the menu! Just make sure to keep your eye out for a seat!
author: Lydia H.

description: I am so in love with this place! Although on the pricier side but in my opinion, it's worth it. The salad is big and they are generous with the toppings. I'm a sucker for a good salad and sandwich and this place knows how to do it right!
author: Lilly M.

description:
Hands down my favorite salad ever is their Beet salad. If you go to Blue Barn, you have to try this salad. So freaking delicious!!!

My only wish was that it could have been served in a proper plate / bowl while I was sitting there. I was a little miffed that I had to eat an $18 salad out of a box. That's just me.
author: Natalie W.

description:
I used to love this place, but I think the quality of their food has declined recently and the prices have gone up! The salads don't taste as fresh.

Portions are huge though, you can share a a salad between two. Limited seating and expect a 10-20+min wait for your food (whether you eat in, take it to go, or call in a pick up order). 

On my recent visit, I got the Tostada salad ($12.50) and added the chile-garlic gulf shrimp ($5.75). That's a $20 salad folks, and there were only 5 shrimps added to my salad. And the romaine tasted like its been in the fridge a couple of days, ick. Hesitant to come back again.
author: Ashley S.

description:
We've been dining at Blue Barn for over two years! They recently opened up another location, within the Marina, and it's beautiful inside! 

+ Great Food that's actually good for you
+ High Quality ingredients , lot's of vegan and vegi options! 
+ Love the atmosphere and simplicity 

- Customer Service. (they never answer their phones, snippy behavior) 
- They mess up their phone orders frequently. Granted we usually order $70+ of food but it's the attention to detail that needs perfection...
author: Clara D.

description:
I have made return trips to this place (more due to my cousin who REALLY loves it) but what can I say, they make some great stuff. 

So - if you are coming here for the first time just order these 2 items (I hope you brought someone with you).

Get one Kickin Chicken sandwich and also get the Sheep Grilled Cheese sandwich. Trust. 

After that, feel free to peruse through the rest of these reviews to refine your friggin palate 

Trust.
author: Atif K.

description: Oh wow these salads are so tasty.  I got the detox salad.  It's great, my only complaint is they are a little selfish with the veggies that are mixed in.  Otherwise it's a choice if you're in the mood for a salad.  I think they offer other items as well, like sandwiches.
author: Amber B.

description: Delicious fresh ingredients. I had the beet salad and the portion was huge. I was confused when I first entered about seating and where to order (I am in town visiting San Francisco and therefore not from around here) but was able to quickly figure it out. I would come back for a quick bite again.
author: Marissa D.

description: Fabulous salad place!!! Delicious, and you get a lot for a $12 to $15 salad. Well worth it. I enjoy their Caesar salad with romaine. So yummy
author: Walter P.

description:
I got a salad - I asked for extra dressing (cause I like soup) and extra croutons because who doesn't like extra croutons and guess which one I got...ding ding ding neither.


It's a mediocre overly priced salad.
author: Cristelle J.

description: Brought my God Daughter there. The place was killer. All you Carpet Bagging East Coast Free Loaders can take your asses Home ! Later !
author: Steven O.

description:
Salads here can run north of $20 each once proteins and premium toppings are added, but the ingredients are noticeably fresher and seasoned properly compared to Plutos!

Some of my favorite items here are the grilled king salmon, summer squash, and crispy quinoa! Their dressings are fresh and flavorful-- especially the ginger miso.

The small dining room/ordering area is almost always chaotic. Instead of a defined line, customers bunch up by the registers even if they are waiting for orders....

Grab an order card by the door, or choose from one of the pre-made options on the menu board! 

The staff is quite friendly and attentive, especially given the the crowds and stress! You can call ahead and significantly reduce stressful waiting.
author: Jackson L.

description: You'll have to be crazy to not love Blue Barn. The salads are on the pricey side for sure but they give you a good quantity. Also doesn't hurt that they serve wine
author: Celia L.

description:
Amazing food!  After 9 days visiting California, I was wondering when I would have a meal that blew me away.  I didn't  expect it to be from a sandwich shop, but this place was a real treat!  The four of us each got something different and we all LOVED our selections.  We ordered takeout, so I can't comment on ambiance or service, but I promise their sandwiches are some of the best out there!  
Great job, Blue Barn!
author: Rebecca L.

description:
- Amazing portions & selections. I felt like everything they served was so creatively thought out you honestly can't go wrong with anything. 

- The service is fast & prompt especially during lunch rush. It was really neat watching the front worker making all the different kinds of salads. 

- I enjoyed spotting some of the local farm names my job uses in their menu as well. Love supporting good clean eats. Definitely will come back!
author: Alayna S.

description:
HUGE SALAD PORTIONS! (seriously, please split this and if you can finish this bowl of salad on your own, I am amazed) 

You can create your own salad or choose from the selected ones on there menu. It is a bit on the pricey side but the quality is there. I ordered the Tostado salad which was a chipotle mexican style of salad. It was good and it had a slight kick to it. 

The steak sandwich (forgot the name of it) was the real winner here for me. Meat was tender and very flavorful. They were chunky slices and the spread they added to it complimented well. 

Pricey but worth it!
author: Alyssa M.

description:
Love the detox salad. I get dressing the side and add shrimp. I always split it in 2 - it's an extra charge but the salads are so big I can't eat a whole one in a sitting. 

Always order ahead.
author: Aisling O.

description:
Salad=horrible (and even if it was good still insanely overpriced)

Can of Diet Coke - $2.50

Service awful -5 stars. No wonder it was empty. My friend just said "never coming back" LOL same
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
1- sandwiches : 5/5.  The tuna sandwich was amazing! 
2- salads: 4.5/5.  Tried fattoush and was fine.  Previously tried Caesar salad and it was so good.  
3- falafel 1/5.  
4- steak was 5/5.  Can't believe how good, tender and tasty it was.  

5- atmosphere is nice, rustic and Amish-ish 5/5.  


Overall, coming back for sure for steak Caesar salad and to try other sandwiches.
author: Ahmad A.

description: Avoid the tuna. It's sort of an ice cream scoop of sticky, globby, raw, overspiced (and overpriced) tuna. The other salads are ok (the salmon or Chinese chicken are best), but I just can't get over the $20+ price tag for a SALAD. And it takes forever for orders to come out.
author: Celie H.

description:
We went there on a weekday for a light lunch. The place wasn't crowded but rather empty. It welcomed us with a guide of how to pick your own salad which was rather complex. On the right, you'd find a good choice of sandwiches and by good choice I mean real variety. By the cashier you can find pre-picked salad menu and a number of drinks (from healthy to sugary).

It looks like they recently renovated the interior as it does not match the photos anymore. It's bigger now with upscale decor. They have WiFi, but you need to ask for a password.

Our choice was grilled cheddar and masala sandwiches with a small tomato basil soup as a side.

Service was prompt as waitress brought our order in about 8 minutes.
The Cheddar sandwich was crisp and did not taste fat at all which is perfect. Masala was light and refreshing with bean sprouts as an unexpected but welcome touch. The soup was good: creamy, heavy with just right croutons but a bit too sour.

Overall this place offers a decent experience. With a price range of about $15-20 per person it's hardly an everyday choice, but definitely worths a visit once or twice a week.
author: Ilya K.

description:
Working in the Presidio is pretty great because I can check out all the great Marina restaurants during the weekdays, when the stereotypical 'Marina crowd' is at work elsewhere :) Nonetheless, Blue Barn (also dubbed 'Basic Barn') is a solid, healthy lunch spot.

My favorite thing to order is the Tostada salad. This salad is an amalgamation of romaine lettuce, chicory chop, toasted corn, black beans, cherry tomatoes, jicama, scallions, herbs, pumpkin seeds, tortilla strips, white cheddar & chipotle-agave vinaigrette. The salad itself tends to be around $13.00 (sans meat) but the produce is divine.

The staff is always very friendly and communicative. I often order salads to go and they always have everything prepped and ready as soon as I get there. Paying is a breeze, they are always friendly, all in all it's a consistently positive experience.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I'd much rather devour a burger with a side of fries than a salad with dressing on the side, but unfortunately, I'm not someone who could eat burgers and fries everyday without really seeing it in the mirror. With that said, I really enjoyed my spicy tuna salad from Blue Barn Gourmet. The sesame seeds and soba noodles give this salad the perfect amount of crunch and texture. Although they're on the pricier spectrum for salads, the portions are very generous and it comes with a small piece of bread. 

The interior is also quite cute-- designed to look like an actual barn. Seating is very limited, so be prepared to fend for a table. 

Minus one star for the cashier who looked like he's so over the job.
author: Tiffany U.

description: The sandwiches here are absolutely fantastic! Unlike Ike's, very tasty but also clean and healthy. Definitely stop by if you're looking for a quick bite!
author: Judy S.

description:
WHAT?!
First, it's rare that I'm completely lost when ordering due wanting to order 75% of their menu. I narrowed in on the turkey sandwich with truffle. I think it's called Truffle.
Perfect proportion, amazing quality and freshness, and oh...the textures and flavor. Yes, please. 
It's a small spot. Unless you are going on an off-hour, you may just be getting it to-go. It's a little slammed in the ordering area/door too.
author: Amy O.

description:
Really good salads that are a full meal. 

I usually get the kale Caesar and add steak. 

Heirloom salad is good when it's in season. 

Their sandwiches are excellent, though probably not what you're looking for when you're going to a place that specializes in salads. 

The Truffle is my favorite. I prefer it in sourdough instead of focaccia. 

The line and wait can be annoyingly long, so order ahead. You can go directly to the front with your CC if you did. Sometimes when they are busy they don't answer their phone though. 

It says it's on Steiner here on Yelp, but the entrance is on Chestnut. 

Edit: the blue barn location is salads only and to-go focused. The new location around the corner IS on Steiner. 

Never feel like I'm getting a steal on the price, but that has not yet detoured me.
author: Cecil C.

description: When in there to order a salad. There were six people standing behind the counter just talking to themselves while my food was sitting on the back counter for almost ten minutes before I had to interrupt their chatter and ask for my food. Also you could see the two cooks chatting away as well. So altogether 8 people standing around doing nothing but talking. As for the salad nothing but lettuce with very little toppings. This place disgusts me with their pricing, service and quality. I am better off going to Pluto's around the block, the pricing is better and so is the service and most importantly the food.
author: Miche P.

description: One bite in ...5 star burger!! It's right next door to susiecakes too! Price is right . Location is cute. Burger is amazing service is great.
author: Kelly A.

description: We stopped by here for a bite en route our 5+ hour bike ride across the Golden Gate Bridge and couldn't have been more pleased with their hearty sandwiches. The peppered turkey with truffle cream was delicious!
author: Dalila Z.

description:
I dream about the salads at blue barn. The portion size is huge and the ingredients are so fresh and delicious! My favorite salad here is the winter salad. It has mixed greens, arugula, dino kale, roasted brussel sprouts, blanched broccolis, roasted winter squash, pomegranate seeds, pine nuts, parmesan reggiano, drizzled with meyer lemon & balsamic vinaigrette. I can't tell you how good this salad is. You just have to try it for yourself. 

The service here is a little slow, but good food takes time and care to make them. I don't mind waiting a little bit because the wait is worth it. The staff here is also friendly and attentive. The place is a little small but cutely decorated with rustic and artisanal pieces.

If you're looking for a salad and sandwich place on Chestnut, look no further than Blue Barn!
author: Hana K.

description: I got the arugula salad with steak. The steak was made to order and very tender. The salad was a very generous portion.
author: A A.

description: Disappointed in this location for the customer service. Literally walked in and asked for a sandwich and the asian girl at the front who recently got a tattoo on her arm rudely said we dont have that here. Never going back here. Go to the steiner location
author: Kimberly B.

description: I think the best thing on the menu so far is the spicy tuna salad. I love that they give you an option to toss your salad lightly. Just the right amount of tuna too! They carry local kombucha, so definitely go try em out.
author: Toro C.

description:
Called for a pickup, the woman who answered gave a snotty "um hi how can I help you..." I then put in my order and she was impatient as I asked for dressing on the side. 

When I walked in to pick up, I asked if there was a counter or separate line to pay for the order. The cashier said she could help me, so the customers behind got immediately irritated (another note: if there was an app to rate the customers, they too would receive a 1 star for their fabulous familial spirit). I then was told to move to the left to pickup my order from the same snotty woman who answered the phone. She asked if I wanted a bag and I asked if there were handles on the to go boxes, she responded with a "duh." Sorry mate..I'm not a takeaway box expert. Won't be putting up with any more of your 'immaculate' service in the future.
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
I really dislike leaving negative reviews; I know running a restaurant is complicated and things don't always run smoothly.  But I looked for a way to contact the management of the Blue Barn privately and couldn't find any contact info anywhere. So this is my only forum.

Dear Blue Barn Managagement - My issue is not with your food, which is outstanding. It's with the staff and the staffing. 

I will not be going back to the Blue Barn, either the one on Chestnut or the one on Polk. The staff on Chestnut always seem to be having a bad day. I don't know if they're overworked or underpaid or both, but most of the time they are short with the customers and often times they are downright rude.

I tried to call in an order for pickup and they simply didn't answer the phone. For the better part of an hour at least. I would just have assumed it was a busy weekend, but then I checked the reviews here on Yelp and see it's a common complaint. If it's your practice to not accept pickup orders when it's busy, say that on your website. Don't leave your customer to figure out whether they've dialed the wrong number or if your phone is out of order.

Failing to get an answer at the Chestnut location I called the one on Polk. The phone was answered right away. I said I wanted to order for pickup and the man who answered said he'd be right with me. And then I was disconnected.

Keep in mind that as your customer, one who loves your food, my choice was not whether to walk over and place an order in person or to wait to order on a day when your staff wasn't overwhelmed. It was whether to keep banging my head on the same wall or find another restaurant that doesn't have the same issues.

I ordered from The Grove on Fillmore. Which also has outstanding food. And is busy. But at least answers the phone.

Problem solved.
author: Patsy K.

description:
Walking around Chestnut with one of my friends and trying to decide where to go for lunch...suddenly I see Blue Barn. I've heard great things about this restaurant but had never been before.... until now. 

I honestly don't know if I've ever had a better lunch in SF. My friend and I split the Tostado Salad and the Turkey Sando plus Pirate's Booty and Salt & Vinegar Chips. SUCH a great decision to split the salad and sandwich - best of both worlds. Seriously, both were amazing! The salad was MASSIVE! so crunchy, so fresh, so flavorful, I don't even know how else to describe it except freaking incredible! corn, black beans, tomatoes, pumpkin seeds, tortilla strips, white cheddar and more! The Turkey sandwich is not your ordinary turkey sandwich. It was very unique with goat cheese, sun dried tomato, watercress, kale-almond pesto on a ciabatta roll. Let me tell ya, it was large and in charge. My friend and I were SO full after this meal, we couldn't even finish the salad, which never happens.

The place is very cozy. We decided to sit outside since it was a beautiful day. The service was great, everyone was very friendly and I cannot even explain my excitement to go back and try something new (that is if i can get myself to branch out after that incredible meal).
author: Ilana B.

description: I can't believe I just paid $20 for a salad and it's only average. Lettuce is mostly stem. Dressing is kind of flavourless. Meh I'll go to a salad bar next time.
author: Jesse S.

description:
YUM! Even though I was only in San Fran for a week, I had to go to Blue Barn twice because it was so delicious the first time.

I got the Kale Caesar salad ($11.75) and it was amazing. I don't always love caesar salads as I often find the dressing to be too creamy; the dressing on their caesar salad, however, was light (and deliciously garlic-y). While it is a little expensive for a salad, the quality and quantity of the food make it totally worth it.

Additionally, I found the staff really helpful; the person at the register even let me try the dressing before I made my decision!

The actual place looks like it was designed by Chip and Joanna Gaines - so adorable! While the seating is pretty limited, because of the food, service, and decor, it is definitely worth a trip to Blue Barns.
author: Stephanie D.

description: There's nothing particularly amazing about this place, but it's decent in the sense that everything's fresh and probably won't give you the hot poops. Like the vast majority of restaurants that boast about their Niman Ranch beef, these folks think that buying the expensive stuff means you don't need to season it at all, and the results are pretty predictable. Most of the food is fairly bland and seems to be striving to appeal to the Matlock crowd, but if you have $20 in your pocket and you want a giant salad that will take you over 45 minutes to eat, it's definitely a better option than many places on Chestnut.
author: Nicholas J.

description:
Custom-made organic salad or burrata grilled cheese with pesto, tomato, and arugula? It's a tough choice at Blue Barn, but a pleasure every time.

Situated on Chestnut, Blue Barn has a neighborhood, rustic yet chic vibe to it. There's limited indoor and outdoor seating, making it a popular order to go spot. As you walk in, there are large chalkboard menus to the left with a variety of salads and sandwiches. If you're not satisfied with their options, you can choose six or more toppings from the extensive list and create your own delicious combination. I love how they focus on local and organic ingredients. It can be expensive (around $15 for a salad) but you know you're eating quality food. 

I've tried several of their salads, which were all great, but I usually end up customizing it so the build your own option is perfect. One of my new favorite salad destinations!
author: Shira W.

description: Amazing customer service. Delicious salads and sandwiches. Prices aren't cheap but portions are large and ingredients are really fresh.
author: Janie S.

description: A little pricey, but the food was excellent and the servers were very attentive.   Not the best place for kids even though there were a lot of kids there.   Not bad for being so new, and we'll definitely head back again to try other items.
author: Edgar C.

description: Small dining area, relatively expensive salads served in carton boxes that you order at the counter.  The tostada was much like the Mexicali salad in TJ's, but there was a satisfying crunch in every bite. While I loved my tostada salad, I felt that I could just go to TJ's and eat from a box, too.
author: Susan B.

description: I went to the Chestnut Street location and we split the Greens and Beets salad and the Provo sandwich. The flavors in the salad were so good! The mixed greens with goat cheese and the sweetness of the pecans were delicious. The salad portions are large and easily filled me up. The sandwich was gooey with the provolone cheese and tasted great with the turkey, tomato and avocado. I'm definitely coming back to try more salads!
author: Allie L.

description:
The woman at the cash register was SO incredibly rude to me. I was waiting in line, another guy cut in front of me, and I told her that I was actually next in line. At which point this woman told me that I wasn't paying attention and it was my fault someone else cut me in line. Who does that??? It was one of the worst service experiences I've ever had, anywhere in the world. I could not believe it. 

Too bad their salads are so good, otherwise I would never come here again.
author: Audrey S.

description: My wife and I dropped into Blue Barn on Chestnut today for the first time and ordered a salad with a cup of coffee and a chicken sandwich.  The nice person taking my order told me they don't have hot coffee but to please visit the surrounding coffee places and feel free to bring it back.  Nice!  We ended up waiting over 30 minutes for our food and I was quite annoyed.  After our food was finally served, Megan, the manager on duty, came over and handed me a total refund of our meal.  She apologized for the extreme wait and explained that their printer in the kitchen malfunctioned and our order came out late.  By the way, the food was excellent and we'll be back.
author: Joe K.

description:
Such a cute charming restaurant on Chestnut. My friend and I could not decide on where to eat along the street that day, and after meandering around for a bit-- decided on getting a hearty salad here at Blue Barn.

And hearty the salads were-- the portions are humongous.  I got the Spicy Tuna salad, which has mixed greens, chicory chop, spicy ahi tuna, avocado, mango, snow peas, cucumber, scallions, sesame seeds, soba noodles, all topped with a miso-ginger vinaigrette.  It was an absolutely delicious salad (5/5).  Tasty and filling!  The only qualm I have is that I feel like the salad was a bit overpriced (after tax about $18), so while I would not order here regularly, I would definitely be back once in a while to get another Spicy Tuna, or maybe try a different salad or sandwich.
author: Dien S.

description:
This place is perfect if you're dining with a mixed group of health conscious eaters and those who want something not as leafy. Which was the case when eating with my sibling (salad), bestie (soup), father (grilled cheese) and myself (all of the above). There's a menu item for anyone!

The arugula salad I had was fresh, tasty and filled with flavor. Our grilled cheese was on point! And the soup was dope. Everything was great. It's a bit pricey, but what else do you expect from this neighborhood?
author: Sarah G.

description:
Pretty much the definition of rustic. I really liked the vibe here - it's like you're in a barn that was redecorated by Martha Stewart. Lots of unfinished wood, flowers, and wreaths made of dried plants - tons of wreaths, all gorgeous: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-barn-gourmet-san-francisco?select=9J8BeZcj2ZoPl0avLL_f2g#UohpMiboIMxHG9bSgvWW-Q

THE WAIT: At 6:45pm on a Saturday, a small but quickly moving line. The 2 individual tables inside were taken, and we didn't want to be chilly sitting outside (but most of those tables were open). We snagged seats at the communal table, and the rest of the seats around us were claimed soon thereafter. There was always a lot of traffic and it was definitely busier but not crazy when we left. 

THE SERVICE: Friendly, and fast! After ordering, they said it would be 15 minutes but our food came out very quickly - probably 5 minutes!

THE COST: About $29 with tax for a salad and a sandwich.

* Rooster (chili-lime grilled chicken, niman bacon, white cheddar avocado, roma tomato & chipotle aioli on a ciabatta roll. $11) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-barn-gourmet-san-francisco?select=9J8BeZcj2ZoPl0avLL_f2g#l2JrUjCqEitxATTcrlwZtA
I wish there were more bacon! The ciabatta was amazing: hard crust, soft & airy on the inside, and it soaked up the flavors really well. The chicken was hearty, the cheese a little hard - more melty would've been nice.

* Beets & Greens w/ Steak (mixed greens, roasted beets, strawberries, grilled balsamic onion, herbs, candied pecans, garlic croutons, goat cheese & balsamic vinaigrette. $10.75) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-barn-gourmet-san-francisco?select=9J8BeZcj2ZoPl0avLL_f2g#iLpVr97JNaJ_Dfhcwe_n_A
The flavors were great together, but I felt like this salad was mostly greens. Every once in a while when I got a bite with the candied pecans or goat cheese, I'd be pleasantly surprised. The rosemary focaccia on the side had amazing flavor - a tiny bit on the old side though. The steak was great and I got it medium rare. Mental note: get the dressing on the side next time. Then you can pour it on yourself and mix it in as you go!

Salads: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-barn-gourmet-san-francisco?select=9J8BeZcj2ZoPl0avLL_f2g#9J8BeZcj2ZoPl0avLL_f2g
Sandos: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-barn-gourmet-san-francisco?select=9J8BeZcj2ZoPl0avLL_f2g#0DV91Xb-Mdc5IfawVwtt1A
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Great place to take a girl for sandwiches and salads. Pretty decent portions but a little pricy. 

Your date will love it though.
author: Matthew D.

description:
If you're looking for a great place to eat salad in the Marina.. go and hit up Blue Barn! It has a great aspect to it cause it reminds me of a barn.

Southwestern Salad is just so good.. ohh my mouth is just drooling from writing this. Plus I have to say that the portions are huge, but if you are going to take out from here you will just be surprised from getting the takeout box!

I totally recommend coming here with your empty stomachs haha..
author: Brittany L.

description:
I have a little concern about pretty much every little thing in this place.  The big picture is good -  healthy, fresh food, a lot of options, creative grilled-cheese sandwiches and nice decor. But it's the little things that kill this place:
1. the very little lobby/ line area
2. the very little menu board that's impossible to read when you are actually placing the order
3. the very little attention she was paying when I was placing the order (yes, DRESSING ON THE SIDE for the 4th time)
4. the little note of "OMG, can't believe you are asking me for things" in the tone and a huge "stare" accompanying the request for utensils.  She brought them, but also commented that typically we can get them inside (what's the point? not ever coming back to THIS service)
5. the very little flavor any of the food had... 

Am I coming back? is that a question? there is a "little" chance, if the rest of Chestnut street gets wiped out for some unknown disaster
author: Marianna K.

description: Delicious salads!! customer service is great too. I love the Chinese salad.
author: River D.

description: Salads and sandwiches are good but a little over priced. Not good enough for what you pay. However service is great and ambiance is even better!
author: Leslie K.

description: Love the Tostada salad! Awesome portions! Definitely come here if you haven't already!
author: Alexis G.

description: Love this sandwich place! This was my second visit and I got the Buddha Sandwich each time. The red pepper hummus is so good and the flavor profiles make the price totally worth it. It's a real hole in the wall place and a great stop if you are in SF.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Love love their sandwiches! Excited to come back next time and review their salads. Also before anything else, if you're a Blue Bottle fan, they sell their boxed coffee here! 

Today I got Rooster sandwich and Provo melt!
Rooster (as it sounds) is grilled chicken with melted white cheddar and avocado, and etc for $12.50.
It was good, not great though. Their chicken lacks a little seasoning. I was a little disappointed because I paid slightly more for a sandwich.

On the other hand, their provo melt for $11.75 was definitely worth getting. It's almost like turkey panini pressed but melts style. Their bread was tucked in greasy butter, and this might sound not appealing but God can tell you how good this rich buttery goodness this melt was! So definitely order this if you're feeling bready!

Small restaurant, can get pretty crowded during peak hours. Otherwise, its a really chill place for lunch!

Cheers!
author: Inge C.

description:
This place is a reason to live in the Marina on it´s own! I´m now back in Norway and I´m not sure how to live without this place. The food is consistently good. Yes it can be slow but I don´t care, it´s straight out the best salad place in the area. The sandwiches though are a separate reason on it´s own to visit. My favorite things: 

- Spicy Tuna Salad
- Kickin´chicken sandwich 
- Popper sandwich  

Blue Barn Chestnut I will miss you so much!
author: Hanna A.

description: People rave about Ike's, but this is really where the good sandwiches are out. The skirt steak and kickin chicken are both super tasty and very saucy (in a good way). Steak was cooked perfectly and bread was crisp and soft, very texturally pleasing. Friends loved the turkey pesto sandwich too! I'd definitely return, too bad they do not have more seating! The salads are also HUGE and also look very good! Great quality, fair prices.
author: Kimia M.

description:
Love love love this place.  Please please consider a location in the inner sunset or west portal area.  We have nowhere to get a nice salad on the West Side of San Francisco. 

The cobber is my favorite.
author: Pauline C.

description:
Very bad customer experience . Employees are very disrespectful and rude !! 

Ingredients are medium quality and price is very high. 

Only reason I go there is that it's close to my house.
author: Irina S.

description:
Worst customer experience in San Francisco!
Numerous times the personnel is very rude and disrespectful. Not to mention they always got my orders wrong. 

Last the place has decent food but highly overpriced.
author: Victor A.

description:
It really is a barn! Salads are amazing and I love the HUGE bowls-- get them lightly tossed with dressing. I tried the Spicy Tuna Salad ($15) and it was delicious. I would come back to try the whole menu really ...definitely eyeing the Cobber Salad next. 

Place is small with a couple tables outside, a couple small tables and a large communal table inside. It's get packed here during lunch time so get ready to fight elbow to elbow for a seat. 

Service is decent. The guy behind the register may or maybe have been having a case of Saturday mornings, but the other staff members were friendly.
author: Ellen W.

description:
Blue Barn is insane during the afternoon. 

It's generally always busy, but once mid day rolls around a - slew of Lululemon clad women descend upon this intimate space. If you're looking for a tranquil space to enjoy your bountiful salad -this is not it. 

I made my own salad today and while it was huge and tasty - it didn't necessarily wow me. Also if you are trying to be health conscious I recommend asking about their dressings. The sweet and sour dressing is pretty much sugar and garlic. 

The portions are massive here so unless you want leftovers - I recommend splitting a salad or sandwich. 

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
We had lunch on the small terrace, during a week day. It was such a nice spot with the sun shining and surprisingly not too packed! 
I was able to park my bike right in front of our table - which was nice.

We ordered at the counter the detox salad and spicy tuna salad. We were served in like 5-10 minutes. Big bowls! 

Both salads were very fresh with original mixes, served with a good piece of bread. It's nice you can add protein and extras if you want - the grilled shrimp looked amazing.

There's definitely more to eat in the tuna salad (not too spicy at all actually): like big chunks of avocado and mango. 

We were very full by the end of the meal. 
I recommend this place! I loved the concept and would love to try more salads or sandwiches which seemed yummy as well.
author: Leslie S.

description:
Please answer your phone!!!!! Or at least get a voicemail so that I know I'm calling the correct place. You're a good business and could be even better if this problem was resolved immediately. It shouldn't be too difficult, there has to be a better way for me to place a take-out order and give you guys more $$$$.

There have been about 10 separate instances where I've wanted to order take out from BB and have not been able to get through or leave a message on the generic voicemail system. In those cases I have gone to other restaurants or ordered delivery from another place. I live down the street and would probably eat BB once a day if I could place a take-out order and count on my food being ready when I got there instead of standing around for 30 minutes waiting for it to be made.

That said, the food is awesome, a bit pricey but well worth it. I will 100% continue to go to Blue Barn but until the phone issue is resolved will only go when I have 30 minutes to spare to wait for my order to be made. 

- Hangry in SF
author: Julian F.

description: We ordered the kickin chicken sandwich and the tostada salad. The sandwich was amazing- we loved it! The tostada salad was definitely good, but nothing special. Good atmosphere and decent prices! Not a ton of seating but quick service.
author: Susannah H.

description:
Love it here! Healthy, fresh food that can satisfy whatever mood you're in. The sandwiches are great (get the Buddha if you want something a bit different but still excellent). The salads are great too and super filling because of their ridiculously massive quantities. 

It can take a while to get food here as there's always a line, so definitely avoid it if you're in a rush.
author: Pooja R.

description: If you are not in the mood for a sit down formal lunch or dinner this is the place to go to in SF. The food is made to perfection, salads are dressed and seasoned well. I can't even begin with the sandwiches, the bread is so soft and fresh.
author: Nataliya M.

description: So delicious. Everyone must come to Blue Barn! The salads are large and are so creative and delicious. My favorite is the arugula salad. Also you must get the french fries perfect side dish for your salad.
author: Omar H.

description:
This place has a good choice of salads and sandwiches. There's limited seating so best to come with just one or two other friends -- not good for groups. 

I got the arugula salad and it was topped with a small bump of grated manchego cheese (not even a hill and I normally prefer a mountain of cheese). The manchego was too finely grated so once mixed into the rest of the salad, it's hard to detect the nutty flavor. The crispy chickpeas held up in the dressing and provided a nice contrast in texture.

The portion is large compared to salads at any other restaurant, but it still wasn't enough to fill me for lunch so my friend and I ended up stopping by Super Duper a few storefronts down after we left Blue Barn. So much for being healthy after our Sunday workouts!
author: Bonnie L.

description: I've always loved Blue Barn, but today they proved they are not only good food, but good people.  My parents are evacuated in Sonoma due to the fires and Blue Barn brought sandwiches and snacks to all the evacuees at Sonoma Raceway.  Thank you for your generosity during this horrible nightmare.
author: Kimberly S.

description: I ordered the Truffle sandwich with fries.  Probably one of the best things I've ever eaten.  I want to go back and try other sandwiches and salads.  So yummy!
author: Regina B.

description: Three only because I've had similar salads for a lot cheaper! $18 chicken tostada salad, really??? It did taste good, the dressing was spicy and yummy but I couldn't get over how much it cost.
author: Karen T.

description:
So if you're interested in a box of boring lettuce with some random stuff thrown carelessly on top, this is your place. If you'd like a delicious salad worth eating, and to pay less than $17 for that enjoyment, go elsewhere.

This was probably the most poorly executed salad experience I've ever had.

First you have to fight for seating. At $17 for a salad with some boiled chicken chunks thrown in, I expect better service (yes boiled, not even grilled...flavorless, $4+ chunks of awful).

After you've handed over the exorbitant amount of cash for your salad (or visa/mc - of course no Amex!) you can look forward to a pretentious Chinese-food style box to eat it out of.

A cup of dressing smashed on top, with whatever protein you ordered smushed next to it. You may think you have the wrong salad because whatever other ingredients came in your salad will be buried somewhere out of reach in the depths of your idiotic leaf-box.

Just do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else...or end up hate-eating a terrible salad because the only thing that would be worse is throwing the $17 away.
author: Jillian R.

description:
Water has rotten smell. 
Do you wash this water tank?
Terrible smell goes over all place. 

If you eat here - eat outside. 
 And don't drink this terrible smelly water
author: Marianna P.

description: Don't throw away your money here unless you have to. They nickel and dime - anytime I substitute blue cheese dressing for Caesar salad dressing on a sandwich they charge $0.75. I mean that's just ridiculous for a sandwich that is already $13. Also, they never answer their phones so forget about takeout without coming into the restaurant and waiting.
author: Dan C.

description: Went for the first time in awhile, the menu changed (not many sandwhich options as before and not the same quality or size) wont be back
author: Jason L.

description:
Unimpressed.
Big simple salad, everything could be fresher. $20
A salad for $20
I guess that's what happens when the minimum was goes up? 
Won't go back.
author: Mercedes R.

description:
I will preface by saying that the food is always great - consistently well made. 

Two gripes, specific to this location:
1) "Slow food takes time". They really mean it. Expect to wait 15-20 minutes for a single salad even when they don't seem too busy. 

2) There are constantly dozens of obnoxious flies circling in the air. Wouldn't recommend sitting inside for that reason. Buy a fly catcher.
author: Don H.

description:
So friggin' delicious albeit a little pricey. I found myself in the Marina which never happens and stumbled upon this little place. 

Their salads are fantastic healthy portions. I've really never enjoyed a salad so much. Veggies: The Buddha sandwich is incredible. Two types of cheese, earthy mushrooms, hummus, god knows what else. It was amazing. For refreshments, they have Stumptown cold brew and that actually sealed the deal as one of my new faves.
author: Dee D.

description:
Great salads, fresh ingredients. Love the salad.

I had to knock one star off. 10 min wait for check out. 20 min wait for food. 30 mins wait in total.

Not best use of time. Company could be using technology to better texecute, and serve customers better. Customer service can also be tad better - by being faster and understanding customers who took the time to wait for the food
author: Nicole L.

description:
Blue Barn is definitely one of the best places around the Marina area.  Their salads are awesome and they have some ridiculously good sandwiches.  I had the Ragin' Cajun and was super impressed.  It had great flavor and the overall texture of the sandwich was super enjoyable.  In an area where good sandwiches are plenty, Blue Barn held its own very well.

The Spicy Tuna and Chinese Chicken Salads are also on-point.  I'd also like to mention that they are indeed salads that can fill you up as the portions are bigger than your average salad.

The location of Blue Barn is also sweet cause you can grab your salad/sando to-go and walk a short way to the Palace of Fine Arts or even straight to the water.  No need to sit in when you you have such great scenery super close!

I'm glad my office is in the area cause I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Chris C.

description:
Fresh, tasty sandwiches and salads where you can choose to go indulgent (their grilled cheese) or super healthy (make your own salad). 

I can never resist anything truffle flavored, so I had the Truffle sandwich with turkey breast, brie, balsamic onions, and aioli among other things on focaccia. It was absolutely delicious!

The place is tiny with just a few tables, and our order took a really long time to come out. But other than that it was a good dining experience, especially if you want to sit outside and watch all the strollers and dogs going by on Chestnut. A great option for lunch!
author: Christina P.

description:
The only real difference between a $17 salad here, and a $10 salad at Plutos 2 blocks away are:

1.More girls in Lululemon, discussing the weight clauses in their pre-nups

2.the menu is written in chalk
author: Ash S.

description:
My favorite food spot in San Francisco by far. Can't go wrong with any salads from this place. The portion is solid and the only place I can trust with light dressing and good ingredients. I love the seasonal vegetables. Their tomato basil soup are not too salty so complement it with fries for perfection. 

I take all my friends here when they're visiting!! Polk place more places to sit with a bar.
author: Sunny L.

description:
I love blue barn, unfortunately this location does not meet the expectations set by the marin location.  Tiny and crowded with a line  no matter what time of day, this location needs some new staff that actually give a shhh. 

The women at the register taking orders has never smiled in her life.  When i asked to sub for a different cheese on my sandwich, she refused. When i asked for different bread with my sandwich, she said "we don't do that here" in a tone of complete disrespect. 

I wish the owner of the original blue barn would take a look at his new location and hire the correct staff to maintain his brand.  

I work in this industry and i know what it takes to make a business successful, PLEASING YOUR CUSTOMER!!!! 

That is the last thing on the staffs' young stuck up minds.
author: Nick B.

description: Yummmmm! I've had many different sandwiches from here and I can't even choose my favorite-- they're all so good! It's kind of small on the inside, but they have a couple of tables outdoors as well. I've always been able to find seating though because it's a pretty quick turnaround.
author: Irmak K.

description: Long wait + rude management + horrible service = Blue Barn. One of the worst experience ever. Not worth the inflated price s
author: Mark J.

description:
I have walked by this place several times and have been wanting to go here.  I was a the renegade craft fair at Fort Mason today and wanted a nice lunch. 

This place is small and crowded, but we managed to snag a seat and waited for our order. A chinese Chicken salad and a grilled manghego cheese with fig jam. The salad was good (and huge). The panini was perfectly grilled - golden brown and melted - a perfect balance of ingredients. Yum, I'm gonna have to go back for that sandwich.
author: Amy W.

description: Wow, this place has super corporate written all over it. Decent salad but expensive, and really, why add the sf health charge on top of the tax to an average 12 dollar salad?  Just include the charge in the cost of the salad.  Was so tired of this nickel and diming of the customer that I stopped going there.  Poor service when ordering too.
author: Bill S.

description: Best Sandwich spot in town! Order the truffle sandwich, best thing on the menu in my opinion :)
author: Chana P.

description:
Best salad place hands down.

Lower your prices by a smidge?!! Also sell your salad dressings! Go Organic! And let their be a substitution for the people who don't want the bread! 

Yeah.. just a couple suggestions. Ya'll are great.
author: Dede C.

description: This is an amazing little lunch spot. I enjoyed the "clubber " sandwich while the other person enjoyed the "detox" salad. We will be back before we leave SF because we enjoyed it and the neighborhood so much!
author: Matt C.

description: Came here, as a recommendation from my coworkers, to try for lunch for the first time, around 2:30ish. I love the look and decor of the place. It is fairly small, but I got food to-go so it didn't matter too much today. Ordered the Barn BLT, and it came out fairly quickly. It was a really good and satisfying sandwich, and I loved that they had goat cheese on it. I'll definitely be back!
author: Lexi T.

description:
Everything here is absolutely amazing. Salads, hot sandwiches, you name it. One of my go-to lunch spots in the Marina!

I agree with previous reviewers who claim there is not a lot of space to eat inside, so get it to go and have a nice picnic on the Marina green :-) 

Pleasant staff that do their best even when it is packed!
author: Meaghan H.

description:
My friends and I were making plans and we made a decision to come here! And it definitely was a good one, although the prices were a little more expensive than usual it was well worth it. 

From the front it doesn't look like much, matter of fact I've passed it a few times without even realizing it was there! But on the inside there was a simple kind of "at home" feel. The place was packed, full of people so it was a little hard looking for seats for three people. 

My friend got the the skirt steak sandwich and I got an arugula salad!!! AND OHHH MY GOD, it was one of the best salads I think I have ever tasted and it was huge! I couldnt even finish it haha. 

The only reason I gave Blue Barn four stars is because the prices were a little high(but what am I supposed to expect, its the Marina!) and there should have been a little more seating. But overall, this would be somewhere I could definitely come back to :-)
author: Megan C.

description: Spicy tuna salad was so delicious we had to go back in for the summer heirloom. Farm quality, Marina prices, but every bite's better than the last.
author: Be F.

description: Hey guys! Charlotte here. So... blue barn is literally a barn shape on the outside, which I think keeps a lot of people away who are walking by...but! #charlottleprotip GO INSIDE! (Spoiler alert:order the fries!). As I ate my salad (delish!) I started thinking about deforestation and stuff...and nature/being green and wanting to be more green in 2017! One thing led to another and I ended up with a side order of fries, which is how I know about them at this salad spot (basically secret menu) and highly recommend! Thank you, Blue Barn! I will be back.
author: Charlotte S.

description:
It was just amazing. Best sandwich ever. Get the truffle. Yum.

Counter service is easy in and easy out. Staff is friendly. 

If I lived here this would be a serious problem for me.
author: Annie M.

description: Their salads are great. Never get their salads to go. They will underserve you by half and their salads are already wayyy too expensive. It is really disappointing that the last 3 times I have gone there to get a salad to go it has been less than half the container.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Giant salads, greasy grilled cheeses, non-touristy crowds. I can get behind that. Sure, it's in the Marina, so parking is difficult, and you're going to run into a fair amount of bros, but it's worth it, even if prices are a little high (only downside I can see). I've yet to try their salads, but from what I've seen, I shall come back for one of these giants creations with loads of avocado slices. If you're going for a sandwich, you can't go wrong with the Provo ($12.25) - two thick slices of buttery, grilled levain bread with melted provolone and slices of deli turkey inside. There's also mashed avocado and arugula and thyme, so you can't go wrong. Add a side of twice-fried, freshly cut potatoes ($2.75) and a blood orange soft drink, and you're good to go. The service is friendly, but the place is tiny. If you can snag a seat, good on you, but if you can't, the water is really right there, so walk away from the bros, and catch a great view with your sando.
author: Danny C.

description: Love this place, salads are so yummy and service is great. Takes long but good food normally does.
author: Monique C.

description:
I ordered the rooster sandwich (chicken, bacon, cheese) which was tasty, but probably the least healthy item (but delicious) on the menu. It came with a plain side salad which was good and well-dressed. Because my meal was too healthy, I ordered a side fries which were surprisingly good. There are a lot of options to make your own salad but the choices were a bit overwhelming. 

The wait can be long on a weekday evening - I walked in and ordered and waited for ~10-15 min but a lot of people were picking up phone orders which is the way to go. The place is small - a few tables and some counter space - so it's really a takeout spot.
author: Wendy L.

description: Delicious salads! Can't wait to try their sandwiches! These lovely ladies promised they were friends cause they were silently devouring their sammies!!!
author: Monique Y.

description: Possibly the best salad place in the city. Get the detox, tostada or winter salad. Yum
author: Tina M.

description: I had the Beets & Greens. Really good size and delicious with the seasonal fruit (summer fruit peaches, blackberries and blueberries). Fresh and good quality ingredients. Crowded inside during lunch time but my friend and I sat at the communal table, which was totally fine.
author: Stella H.

description:
Tiny little place with great foods. Healthy choices and great ingredients and produce.

The prices may seem a little high if you're not used to gourmet stuff but it's worth the extra bucks.

I suggest you pick up and take it home. The place is a worse than a hot nightclub on a Saturday night. 

Oh and don't bother calling because they NEVER answer the phone.
author: Violet T.

description:
My good friend and I had lunch at Blue Barn the other day. 
The food looks and tastes delicious. I had the Clubber sandwich, and it was absolutely perfect for lunch: perfectly toasted, fresh ingredients, and fresh (not frozen) turkey slices. 
We set outside, because the weather allowed us in SF and the perfect feel of Marina/ Chestnut Street. 
The only down factor of this place is it's tiny; not enough sitting; it's cramped. We got lucky to get a seat outside. 
I cannot say anything bad about the service. We ordered, and the food was brought out to us within next 10 minutes. 
Very good spot for a quick/ not "fast food"lunch.
author: Jenna F.

description: Used to be a $9 beet salad not too long ago. Now it's 12.50 or 14 after tip and it's oilier than I remember.
author: Morris G.

description:
Though it was pretty slow to get our food, they have a sign warning you about that and the food comes out really delicious so you can't really fault them.

My boyfriend and I split the tostada salad (I thought it was pretty good but I'm not usually one to choose a mexican salad) and the Skirt Sando (AMAZING!).

The decor inside is cute and theres more seating that most SF sandwich spots.
author: Alexandra W.

description: This restaurant is a big flashy overpriced breeding ground for bigotry the owner gives me the vibe of a old school racist who basically only hires whites while mexicans do slave work they also think there super great place but if you take you time and look what is not so great should be apparent no diversity and a zero tolerance im better than you mentality this place also hires people that don't like to work
author: Michael R.

description: How can you NOT love the Blue Barn? It's fabulous - the food selection is amazing, healthy and sooo filling! The staff is truly fabulous. It's my happy place - especially when it comes to food! Yummation!!!
author: Anjali K.

description:
I really enjoyed my buffalo chicken sandwich here. It's a little on the pricey side, but the taste and food quality was pretty worth it. Very busy yet relaxing area. Seating is a bit tight, so you will need to divide and conquer by having one person order and another saving a table.

The windows all open out, leaving the entire front wall open/gone on a pleasant day. The day I was there had a bird trapped inside, and this was the only way to get the bird out!

I would definitely come back here to try other sandwiches as well as some sides. Good first impression for me!
author: David T.

description: One of my favorite places...great salads, great sandwiches. The only thing that would make it better would be if it was faster and cheaper
author: Jamie H.

description: The salads here are perfectly dressed and are sized decently. I typically get the smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwich, it's very good but the texture of the salmon and cheese combined is a little off (too mushy). However, the food is always consistently good and made with care; you can't go wrong with this place.
author: Maya B.

description:
Five stars for the food but three stars for the price.. I've been here twice and both times I ordered the Spicy Tuna Salad. Just a heads up, it's not actually spicy (not that I mind- I was quite pleasantly surprised since I'm not the biggest fan of spicy). Another tip, the line can get really long so be prepared to wait for a while. Anyways, the salad consists of mixed greens tossed with mango cubes, cucumber, scallions, peas, sesame seeds, crunchy dried soba noodles, topped with a fair portion of "spicy" ahi tuna and half an avocado with miso-ginger vinaigrette.
