Absolutely delicious man. Absolutely Delicious. GENEROUS serving sizes but it's still really expensive as they don't use all organic ingredients. That won't stop me from coming back though. Oh Blue Barn, thanks for making healthy eating so enjoyable.

Peace homies.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Maybe it's the bougie workout studios, the cute overpriced boutiques or the green juice that keeps me coming back to the marina. Though it may be gliz & glamour and maybe a bit snooty, there's no admitting that it is the home district to some of the healthiest brunch/lunch spots in the city. Blue Barn is one of them! 

My favorite order on a sunny afternoon would have to be a tie between the arugula salad or the smoked sando. 
On colder (rainy) days, I would opt for tomato soup with either half a sando or even fries. 

Be warned, it does get crowded here during brunch/lunch time.
author: Jenn H.

description:
I work right around the corner from Blue Barn and have seem to have had a bunch of issues with their food. At one point there was a rock in my salad that chipped my tooth. I called to let management know and my name and number was taken but there was no further action. 
The next time I had a salad from here there were two bugs in my salad! 
Delicious salads but there needs to be a little quality control.
author: elly w.

description:
Got a take out order and pre-paid online. Staff told me to wait in line anyway, which took 15 min.

Got to the front, but didn't know what name my girlfriend put the order under. 

I pointed and recited the order exactly; but since I didn't know the exact name, they wouldn't give it to me, even though I already paid. 

How the hell would I guess that it was two tostada salads, one with no tomato? Luck? 

Idiots work here.

Salad was good.
author: Lloyed C.

description:
We stopped by right at 11 am before a bike ride and had a salad, soup, and grilled cheese. Healthy, gourmet food at its finest. The Cobber salad was delicious (although the avocado could have been more ripe) but I thought the Provo grilled cheese was just okay. It is really a panini in my opinion. The tomato soup with basil was good. 

There were a lot of to go orders right as we sat down. It's a little expensive, but not unreasonably so.
author: Allison S.

description:
Y U M !! So glad my friend took me here! Definitely coming back for lunch sometime in the future. I would love to take my socal friends here and show off that LA isn't the only place with BOMB-dot-com food... ahahaha (Was that a really nerdy silicon valley joke? Meh!)

Anyways, here's what I got that really impressed me:

Chinese Chicken Salad = YUM!! Also, it's SUPER big. Definitely enough to fill you up AND share with your friends. All of the salads at this place look huuuuggeee. And they don't skimp on the chicken, which is great. 

Rooster = MMMF. Delicious!! Shared half w/ my friend and definitely wish I just got all of my own.. Even if my belly was gonna explode from how much I was overstuffing myself here

Churro Rice Krispies = HOLY SHIT!! BEST RICE KRISPIES IVE EVER EATTEN!! Wanted to buy 3 extra ones to gift to my friends in Mountain View and my mommy... I don't know why I didn't.... wish I were eating some right now :'(
author: Sophie S.

description: Delicious salads. The price point made me drop a star. It's $20 for a salad people. That's ridiculous and yet I keep going back. Fresh ingredients create playful bites that entice your senses. Most recently I had the tostada salad with chicken. I'll definitely repeat that order. The salad dressings are top notch. I'd recommend to my friends but warn of the price.
author: Sam W.

description: The absolute best beets and greens salad! They recently started to include raspberries and blueberries, knocking this salad out of the park.
author: Carly S.

description:
I'm a fan of Blue Barn Gourmet and wish that I lived in San Francisco so that I would have more opportunities to try out their entire menu. 

If you are looking for fresh ingredients and delicious food in a somewhat timely fashion, go to Blue Barn Gourmet. Their salads looked incredible, they have a great grilled cheese line-up amongst many other unique sandwiches. 

Cute place and friendly employees.
author: Alexandra K.

description: I came in on a Saturday afternoon around 3. I walked up to the register and no one was there. After waiting for almost 5 minutes, someone who barely spoke English walked up and said they were closed. Hmm, maybe put up a sign or lock the door?
author: Jack R.

description: The salads are good BUT the consistency is atrocious. My orders are NEVER right. Either the options for the salads are not correct or the order is just completely wrong. And this is not 1x..... this is after MONTHS of getting a screwed up order each week. Why bother reading the menu if the staff don't send out the right food?
author: Moxie A.

description:
If only this place wasn't frequented by Marina douches, I would love to get lunch here all the time. It's just super hard for me to digest while elbow to elbow with people bragging about their latte enemas or whatever. 

Anyways.

They have great sandwiches and salads here! Always hits the salad/sandwich craving on the nose. I love the spicy turkey. Their drink selection has a little more interesting variety than most other sandwich places.  I just wish they had a 1/2 sandwich 1/2 salad combo so I could spend less moolah and not have to take leftovers.
author: Bonnie G.

description: I was really disappointed with my salad. I asked for extra beets there were about 3 beets in my salad. I asked for tomatoes, there were about 4 small pieces of tomato in my salad. The side of salmon was tasty, and the egg was really good.
author: Cupcake C.

description:
Hit or miss, they either miss an item completely or skimp on it. There was the most rude woman ever at the register today, at least fake a smile. 
Never the less...I keep coming back for that little white $15 box! Yummm
author: Drea L.

description: This place is my go to for healthy but awesome giant salads. Their seasonal specials are always on point (just had the Winter Salad last week and I could eat it all the time and not get sick of it), and the boyfriend loves their sandwiches (he's recommend the Steak and Arugula I am sure.) Pro Tip, if you want to add Chicken to your salad, go for the Rooster chicken. It's a little more juicy than the grilled and costs the same!
author: Jane F.

description: This place is ok. More suited for to-go orders but I would definitely order ahead as I was here on a Saturday and service was really slow. Salads are big but mostly leaves with very little else. I got the Fattoush and was mostly lettuce and pita crisp with tiny amounts of the other ingredients. My daughter had the tomato soup which she really liked. Staff are friendly.
author: S B.

description:
The food here is not bad at all, they have delicious sandwiches and salads with a plethora of options. Its also a pretty cool concept, supposed to be fresh and healthy food. They have some unique options like the detox salad, yummy veggie sandwiches, grilled cheese, make your own salad, and craft bottled beer. 

The problem with this place is that its so small & not many people take it to go. If i went back i would avoid it on a saturday & get it to go- eat it at the park or something. The seating was so terrible and squished, no space whatsoever.
author: Kathleen D.

description: $28 for a soup and a salad? Butternut squash soup was good but the chicken in the salad was powdery, tasteless, creepy, and not tossed with the rest of the salad. But $28??
author: Ning T.

description:
Affordable. Fresh. And Quick.
The DETOX salad was tantalizing - fresh greens, quinoa, and spices made this dish savory to perfection. I think it was the sauce that was the 'icing on the cake'... the ambiance of a farmers table and outdoor seating with prime people watching definitely added to the experience. Next time I'll mix up my own concoction!
author: Regina D.

description: I just paid 17 bucks for a tasteless salad. Unbelievable. Got the chinese chicken salad which had exactly 3 tiny pieces of orange and 4 almond slivers and a LOT of gross-looking chicken pieces.
author: Naina M.

description:
This place always looks popular so I popped in for lunch with a friend one week day. Super packed, many people seemed to order pick up ahead of time (must remember this). Lots of tasty sounding salads and grilled sandwich options. I had the cobb salad, which was massive and my friend had one of the grilled cheeses with brie and walnuts. Salad was delicious and I had plenty to spare. My friend loved her grilled cheese but it wasn't a large portion by any means. The guy next to us must have been a regular, he knew the trick, order a grilled cheese AND a salad. Well played sir, well played. 

Will visit again and order ahead or avoid lunch rush!
author: Nicole Z.

description: My boyfriend and I came here, while vacationing in San Francisco. We both ordered sandwiches and they were great. The staff was nice. The food took a while but they have a sign that says "slow food takes time" so we knew what we were in for. The place was nice and clean. We finished our meal and I accidentally forgot my sunglasses. The next day when I noticed my glasses were gone I called Blue Barn and they were nice enough to hold on to them for me. While I was heading over to pick up my glasses I put in an order for a Caesar salad and my bf loved it! It has a spice to it. I wish this place was around in LA County.
author: Claudia G. S.

description:
Wow! I spent 20$ on one salad. It was fresh, it was tasty, I would have loved it and even felt it worth the insane price tag.... Except...

There was barely anything in it besides lettuce. I paid 6$ for flank steak and left hungry after a gigantic expensive salad because they are so stingy with the fixings. 

Sad because had it been normally proportionate I would come back again and again. Don't be fooled!!!
author: Jayne M.

description: Really yummy salads! Recommend if you're in the neighborhood and looking for a light bite. The buffalo sandwich was ok but not exciting. I loved the arugula salad with artichokes. Gets pretty crowded, especially on the weekends, but a lot of the activity is take-out.
author: Natasha F.

description:
I yelped "salad"in Sf and found blue barn.
let me tell you, this place did not disappoint.

super nice staff

what we ate:
Beets and Greens (great paleo option minus the croutons) - possibly best beet salad I have EVER EVER HAD
Curry mary's chicken (SO SO YUM)
Sheep Grilled Cheese (another WIN - so unique)

We will definitely be back to try the truffle sand and other salads. 

thank you Blue Barn. I was craving a good salad, and this place was the bomb.
author: Win H.

description:
Great salads and sanwiches. Totally understand why it is pricey - great ingredients... And its not "fast" food at all. My go - to for lunch after a workout. 

Recommend creating a salad or the buffalo blue sando!

I will say the front of house staff could be a bit friendlier.
author: Bea A.

description: I got a Cesar salad with tuna. Paid $16 and only got half of my to go box filled with salad. Pretty annoyed.
author: Natalie D.

description: Ordered the Tostado Salad with chicken. $15, overpriced. Salad was big, taste was okay, but not the best tostado I've ever had which I kind of expect for $15. There are better options in the Marina for a salad, like Pluto's.
author: SF M.

description:
Hours of operations here on Yelp are WRONG!  Blue barn closes at 8PM on Sundays, not 8:30 as yelp says.

I got there at exactly 8pm, and they refused to take my to-go order.  I even drove across town just to get something.  What a waste.
author: Steve M.

description: I LOVE their salads! My business partner and I order lunch from here ALOT. It's a winner! Fresh ingredients, their chicken, shrimp and beef all very good. Can't go wrong if a big, fresh salad is what you're looking for.
author: Ennie L.

description:
Great salads! I've tried the Fattoush, the Tostada, the Arugula, the Beets and Greens, and several of the ever-changing seasonal salads, all of which are excellent. 

I'm not usually an eat-salad-as-an-entree kind of girl, but these are filling and actually taste good because of all the mix ins and delicious dressings. I also really like the ratio of mix ins to greens because most salads are 90% greens and therefore tasteless. If you're trying to eat somewhat healthy, this place will make it easy.

I dragged my poor fiance here repeatedly when I was trying to get in shape for our wedding. He's not at all a salad kind of guy, but thankfully, they have plenty of sandwiches too. 

Only drawbacks are the long lines and slow service. Make sure you're not in a rush.
author: Shreya O.

description: One of the best salads I've had in the city! Now I know where to go when in a need of healthy delicious salad with whatever dreamy toppings I may have in mind ;) I had the stagily salad here but I wouldn't get the tofu again- that was too tasteless for me I like it way more seasoned so next time salmon or tempeh it izzzz ;)
author: V L.

description:
I rarely eat in the Marina, but I came across this sandwich and salad spot the other day and it was great. The interior is trendy and cozy. There was a short line to order food but I found seats easily. They have an extensive menu of sandwiches and salads.

I ordered the smoked salmon panini. It had tasty slices of smoked salmon, cucumbers, and horseradish aioli on levain bread. I added a side salad to complete the meal.

Nice place to grab a healthy bite, but it takes a while for the food to come out.  I want to come back to try their grilled cheese options.
author: Alfred L.

description:
Lovely salad. Sunny outdoor seating and warm service.

We had the spicy tuna salad which was large and hearty and came with yummy ground bits of raw tuna. The noodles, scallions, mango, etc all helped make the salad complete. Our one complaint was that it was a bit underdressed but after we asked for another of the miso-seasame dressing, the whole thing tasted great!

Solidly recommended!
author: Amy D.

description:
The salads are definitely the way to go for lunch here.

Got a sandwich today (the Kickin' Chicken). It was good, but very messy and heavy.
author: Rachel B.

description:
I once again relied on the Yelp community to direct me to a great place for lunch in the Marina district.  The menu was really diverse and, when hungry, very hard to choose from. 

Looking at the size of the salad bowls of those eating around me I choose a salad- the seasonal salad that had greens, kaboucha squash, pomegranate seeds, goat cheese and I had bacon added.  Overall a good salad- the size is predominately due to the amount of greens- not necessarily a bad thing. Dressed nicely too. Value- a little pricey for the amount of non-greens.

The atmosphere was relaxed with a tight seating area. Loved the communal 'bar' since I was a loner that day. The staff were very attentive since after ordering at the counter they deliver to your seating. (Not to be underrated- nice toilet accommodations)

Would easily return!
author: Karen G.

description:
My friends and I had a really nice lunch at this place. It's a small place but you can almost always find seating. We placed our orders first and then waited a few minutes before some seats out front became available. Portions are MASSIVE here. I suggest they have a half salad, half sandwich option (unless I missed it?). 

I tried their masala chicken sandwich with fries and OMG SO GOOD! The sandwich size is really large that I brought the rest back up to Portland with me. My coworkers asked where I had gotten it because the aroma made them all crave it, but unfortunately, it's only available in SF. The chicken works really well with the curry and the alfalfa sprouts. Their fries are also really good, not too greasy or salty but thin; it's really addicting! 

I will definitely come back!
author: Faye F.

description:
Quality food, great service. Fun, small venue, fits right in with the spirit of this neighborhood. Don't come here with a large group - you'll be annoying.

Friends ordered salads; I tried a bite of the Tostada salad and it was really tasty! The salad portions are huge, ingredients fresh and taste f-ing good. 

Green Egg Sandwich - first time I've had warm egg salad. So good. Again, quality, fresh ingredients. The fries for $2+ were so money. Lightly crispy and salted just right. 

Water in mason jars? Fun!

Clean restroom upstairs with a vacancy slot - which is a considerate touch. It's always so awkward when you're in the potty and someone keeps trying the door to check that it's actually locked. Not here!
author: Alex T.

description:
Definitely my go to sando shop when I'm home for the weekends!!! love this spot. 

My GF raves about the winter salad - she adds quinoa.
author: Astro D A.

description: Great salads with very tender pieces of hot skirt steak.  Perfect stop for after the Blue Angels!
author: Wendy N.

description:
I am obsessed with the turkey sandwich. It comes with roasted turkey breast, goat cheese, sundried tomato, watercress and kale-almond pesto on a ciabatta roll. Also love the kickin' chicken with grilled chicken, bbq sauce, bacon, smoked gouda, caramelized onion and thyme slaw on a ciabatta roll. You cannot go wrong with either of these! I like splitting the sandwiches with someone so you can try another half. I still need to get a salad from here, but their sandwiches are so good!

This location has a lot less seating than the Polk St location.
author: Alisha K.

description:
wanna feel healthy while consuming 1000 Cal? This is the place for it for sure. The salad is good, but huge!!! The Cobb Salad is $12.50, and the amount of chicken, bacon, and avocado makes up for that. 

The Salad was good. Sandwich, probably you can get it better at Lucca. Loose point for price and size. You can't bring salad home cause it gets wilted. Price is high considering its all self services. Even Grove cafe brings utensils for u.  I rather go to Pluto or Grove for much cheaper Salad and better service.
author: Mika G.

description:
I can't believe I finally found a healthy joint that serves fresh delicious food. I came into BBG with my husband yesterday to get a healthy meal and it was a wise choice.

He ordered the chicken masala sandwich and I ordered the Chinese chicken salad and we were both blown away.

My salad was $13 and it could have feed 2 people, but I was so flipping hungry I ate the whole thing by myself. 

I love the fact that you get exactly what you pay for.  I got a pretty huge salad with a good amount of chicken on it, unlike other places that tend to be stingy.

The service was decent and the prices are more than fair. Our whole meal not including drinks came to $24.50, which is not bad. Whatever you order from here I'm positive you'll love it! I can't wait to come next weekend and try something new. 

AWEsome job BBG!!!
author: V W.

description:
As a note: I paid $17.50 for salad with chicken plus a bag of chips, to go (winter salad special).

Will not be returning. Salad was large, it was all leaves, very few non leaf components. Almost sad. The greens seemed to be the same standard blah bulk blends every place serves (you know the ones that come out of a huge cardboard box pre leaved). Chicken didnt taste as good as most Mary's Chicken I have had before -- would not be surprised if it was a bait and switch. This particular salad wasn't even that great, but given that its a special, that COULD be excusable.

Not impressed. The place was typical SF "Manufactured Authenticity".

(Note I was hoping to a regular place close to me I could go for reliable, fresh (ideally farm to table), walk in salads --  somewhere I could go back to multiple times per week. I had mentioned how much I LOVED The Picnic Basket in Santa Cruz, and that I was there almost every day during the month I stayed a while back; someone suggested this place when I said I was looking for a good salad place. Too bad. THis place isn't even close.)
author: alex v.

description: Tried the Ragin Cajun and it was delicious. It was a great combination of flavors. Good quality meats and cheeses. It's definitely not a light sandwich. It's a good amount of sandwich for the price.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Hmmmmmm Detox, Arugula, or Tostada Salad; giving this place a go.

Chestnut Street/Marina Prices Salads are good but not entierly Special Despite the extravagant looking Menu. I asked them what they recommended and took their suggestion and tried the Tostada Salad. Nothing too special, memorable.

We've got better Salad restaurants on Irving Street in the Sunset! 

This place is very on par with 'The Plant' & this review ought to mirror my previous review of The Plant Cafe.
author: Julian I.

description:
This place was a nice little place for lunch. I ordered the rooster which is supposedly one of the best sandwiches in sf. I got an order of fries and a glass bottle of coke. I sat down with my plethora of food and surrounding new were salads on salads. These people must be looking at me, "who's this guy with the sandwich? " felt so out of place lol but onto the food 

So the food was pretty good. Now I don't see this being the top twenty sandwiches in the city's the sandwich was good, fries were tasty with the right f amount of flavor, and you can't beat a nice glass bottle of coke lol. Sandwich was Not too salty and a decent Balance but it didn't leave me feeling amazed. Just a decent chicken sandwich. I would definitely go back but maybe try some of the other different sandwiches and maybe a salad lol
author: Bobby K.

description: Great menu selection! A little pricey in my opinion, but definitely a go to place for good fresh food.
author: Lily S.

description: Surprisingly delightful and quaint salad place in the Marina.    Pick your ingredients or order from the pre-made menu.  We had the spicy tuna and it was excellent although I could have done without the crispy noodles.
author: Max K.

description:
Packed full of Lululemon and deep-V's, Blue Barn is a fantastic sampling of the Marina crowd. 

Blue Barn Gourmet is home to incredibly fresh seasonal salads, fantastic sandwiches, and a waiting area so uncomfortably small, that you should probably call ahead, or be doomed to overhear conversations about Fireball whiskey and yoga instructors while you wait.

All the food is great, albeit expensive - the Spinach and Tostada salad, and the Rooster and Clubber sandwiches are among my favorites.
author: William M.

description: This is a can't fail dining experience. I get good service and fresh healthy farm to barn choices. Warning Susie Cakes is next door, straight danger
author: Dawud H.

description:
I am genuinely thankful that I don't live close to Blue Barn because I would otherwise be in serious debt. Blue Barn is just about perfect: amazing sandwiches and salads full of amazing ingredients. Unfortunately, my knowledge of the menu is limited as I've had one sandwich and one salad and refuse to branch out as they are both so good. Re: sandwiches, the Buddha (goat cheese, roasted mushrooms, balsamic onion, broccolini, thyme-meter lemon gremolata (no idea) and butternut squash on country levaine) was simply incredible -- like how could it not be? as for the salads, I cannot get over the Winter seasonal salad (mixed greens, arugula, dino kale, toasted brussel sprouts (genius), blanched broccolis, roasted winter squash, pomegranate seeds, pine nuts, parmesan, and meyer lemon-balsamic vinaigrette. 

but don't let my choices trick you as they LITERALLY have something for every set of taste buds. also, they have a whole list of grilled cheeses. COME ON.

however, the minus one star goes for the lack of non-lettuce ingredients in my salad 1/2 times. like fill that shit up with the good stuff, Blue Barn. I'm not paying $12 for some leaves.
author: Annie D.

description:
Blue Barn Gourmet features sustainable and organic ingredients in their well-thought out salads and sandwiches. While a bit small, the cute and cozy decor in the restaurant makes you feel like you're actually in some sort of a modernized barn. I really like how all salad ingredients are presented out in the open for you to see- which can be a testament as to how fresh their ingredients are. If you order a salad to-go, they provide you a cute chinese take out box to eat your salad. They have a large range of salad dressings to try, including the acai-lemon 'master cleanse' vinaigrette, which is my favorite. 

Out of the sandwiches, I've only had the buffalo blue so far and I looooovee it. The chicken is well marinated with a spicy kick of buffalo sauce. If it gets too spicy, you can dip the sandwich in a blue cheese dressing. Tastes just like buffalo wings. YUM! 

One thing to note is that since this is a small space, it is very noticeable when it gets packed. I've found that in the times that I've come here, some of the waitresses are too busy to notice you and service may take a little longer than what you may want. 
The salads and sandwiches may be a bit pricier than most people (AKA, me) like but I suppose for such good quality ingredients in a prime location on Chestnut street, it works out.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
The sandwiches are good and original. I am not a fan of the kale Cesar.
Otherwise, they are very king and family friendly.
author: C B.

description:
Tasty salads, but they charge extra for everything little thing.  I asked if they could sub spinach for 1/2 of the romaine in my salad and was told it would be extra.  I also requested that they split the salad because they are huge and was told that too would be additional.  So, a $15 salad is now close to $20?  Really?

Overall, the salads are good in flavor but a salad doesn't need to cost $15+.  Personally, Harvest and Rowe in the financial district is MUCH, MUCH better.  Delicious salads for less $.
author: Kate G.

description:
I've posted two reviews of this place already but just wanted to say I've been coming to Blue Barn for a few years now, since I started working around in the Marina and the girls that work there are absolute sweethearts. They give exceptional service and make an effort to know your name. There was a time when I'd be going in a few times a week, but I haven't been able to go as often as I'd like to these days.

Marielle & the brunette, tall, w/bangs always smiling... I forgot your name :( But thank you for always greeting me by first name and making me feel welcome. You can't really go wrong with their giant sandwiches or hearty salads. The soup I feel can be hit or miss, but the tomato is so far my favorite. 

See you soon xx
author: Natassia S.

description:
SO GOOD!!!!!

The burrata sandwich add turkey is HEAVEN. Melt-in-your-mouth heaven. There is really nothing more to say because It is so amazing, I wish they would open one in the financial district!!! 

I've also tried the truffle sandwich, also very very good!
author: Jordan S.

description:
Good luck getting a seat here. There is limited bar seating and small tables towards the front. Still, I find this to be the main problem at Blue Barn, so it's easy to forgive (unless of course the slightly elongated wait time or the ever so slightly premium price on the meals bothers you too much as well - I'm ok with both since the food tastes so good). 

I can't speak to the salads, but I can vouch for the sandwiches. I normally go for the skirt steak sandwich, but I've tried a couple of the others as well. Be prepared for a messy experience. These things drip and the ingredients slide around, but that shouldn't deter you from diving in with both hands to pick them up. All have been delicious and plenty filling. 

Do you pay a little premium here? Sure. Both for being in the Marina and for the overall quality. I think the freshly made goodness justifies it. Plus when you factor in the whole "locally sourced" thing it makes it a little more palatable as well. Be prepared for a 15 minute wait for your sandwich and expect something delicious.
author: Taylor C.

description:
Not sure how long this place has been here, but it's a great addition to the already-ample good eats on Chestnut. 

We shared the Buddha sandwich (strangely on the paper menu but not the menuboard). The veg sandwich options were somewhat limited, but Buddha was quite good--perfectly balanced cheese, bread and fillings. Also had a custom salad, which was an excellent portion and well mixed (with just the right amount of dressing).

Space is definitely limited and service wasn't quite as helpful as you'd hope for, but all in all a pretty darn good experience.
author: David Z.

description: I think I'm in the minority because it seems like most people like this place, and it's always packed, but I haven't loved anything I've ordered (ahi-tuna salad, buddha sandwich, tomato bisque soup).  Everything is just OK.
author: Elise C.

description:
I only love the giant rice krispy treat smores here. The tragic thing is that I sent my bf across town (to the Marina) on a Friday night to pick up dinner and they FORGOT to put the smore in the bag. I tried to call them but they didn't answer the phone. I won't be back (to the Marina one). The one in Corte Madera is great. 

Also an $11 detox salad is nice, but you can make your own for much less!
author: Laura F.

description:
Bar(n) none, the best BLT I've ever had...no kidding.  They take their time, but damn well worth it. Goat cheese on a BLT?  Pesto aoili?  Who knew it would taste that good?

Don't miss this place.
author: Chaz S.

description:
FRESH INGREDIENTS DOES NOT MAKE UP FOR POOR SERVICE OR LACK OF COMPETENCE. 

I have given BBG three chances, and alas, three strikes. :(

First visit - super excited about the hype. Ordered the Cobber to go for me and Beet Salad for the BF. Service seemed a bit agitated and rushed. Understandable as it was 7:30 pm, but could it kill you to smile??

THEN WE GOT HOME. Cobber had NO chickory or avocado (a must have on my salads), AND it had the miso vinaigrette rather than ranch... Considering this is a menu item, I was appalled and to be honest, was grossed out by the dressing. We would've brought it back but were already back up in PAC Heights...

Second visit - gave it a second shot. This time the order (exact same) was correct but HOLY CRAP the girl at the register (last Tuesday, at 7pm) was incredibly unpleasant. She was very demeaning and clearly hated her job. My advice is to find a new one, sister, or you're going to start getting a lot of negativity right back. 

Third visit - Today. Picked up a build-your-own to go, with 9 toss ins that I gladly paid extra $ for. Service was very sub par, and, when I got home, there were THREE MISSING INGREDIENTS.  Like, the three I PAID EXTRA for. Again, back home already and didn't want to turn around. So, I fixed up a bit at home, making it more like a $17 salad... ;(

So, with deepest regrets, I must refrain from eating here and returning to my trusty Plant Cafe.

I do NOT recommend take out from here unless you are prepared to open up the box or wrapper and make sure your food is correct. Because I promise, the service isn't worth it either...
author: Valerie W.

description:
Kickin' Chicken Sandwich is off the hook.

Most common expression heard at Blue Barn is "Are you in line?".  Just call ahead and take out.  The lines are long and the place is small.   But the Kickin' Chicken is worth it.
author: Jon M.

description: Really tasty sandwiches and salads. All of the ingredients are very fresh and the staff is lovely. Any time I'm in the area and want something that is sure to be good I will come here. Light and delicious.
author: Melissa D.

description:
The salad spread looks like Pluto's.
The salad menu looks like Pluto's.
But the salad does NOT taste like Pluto's, it tastes AMAZING. So fresh and tasty, I'm not sure if they mixed crack into the dressing...

The sandwiches are heavy, and they only offer half-soup/salad combo's (no sammy-salad combos). Order to-go, there seemed to be lots of phone orders, or order a custom or pre-defined salad and pay at the cash register. They'll bring the food out to your table (and they have two tables outside so you can enjoy the weather on weekends!

I think I prefer the salads over the sandwiches, but I would highly encourage you to go check it out for yourself. They also have huge cookies and sell blue bottle coffee.
author: Jess C.

description: I had a small potato leek soup and the big cheese grilled cheese sandwich. The sandwich was good for a grilled cheese sandwich and the soup was good too. The potato leek soup was garnished with bacon bits, but I didn't see any mixed in. The grilled cheese sandwich was so much smaller than I thought. I think I paid too much for a soup and sandwich meal. The salads are big, but also pretty pricey for a salad. They aren't kidding about the gourmet part of this. The place was like a small, rustic, fancy deli complete with a metal water dispenser and mason jar water cups. The take out boxes are little Chinese take out boxes, but with the store logo on it. There is a community table inside, but only a handful of tables inside and outside combined. It was a nice environment, but also a little pretentious.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This place is no secret; it gets packed, even on the rainy Sunday I went. 

This fast-casual restaurant offers salads, paninis, and some healthy kicks. I recommend the Caesar Salad, Chinese Chicken Salad, and Spicy Tuna Salad. All super good. 

The prices are a bit on the $$$, but with good quality ingredients and size, I think it's worth it. 

Seating is limited and the place is very small, so come prepared!

You can also call in your order if you do not want to wait. 

Their paninis looked a little greasy, but I think I still want to try them next time :)
author: Lauren F.

description: OBSESSED with Blue Barn!!! During my first trip to San Fran we stopped here for to go salads to take with us to the bay. When I first walked in I was immediately overwhelmed by the selection of amazing salads a long with the make your own salad menus! The interior is small and a sort of modern-rustic style. I ultimately decided to make my own salad and was not disappointed! All the ingredients tasted so fresh and delicious. I think my salad came out to around $15-16, which a little steep for my college student sized bank account, but it's worth the splurge. Ps get the salads to go because they come in super cute to-go boxes
author: Isabelle S.

description: Great food! I tend to not eat healthy and I'm trying to more these days. I heard about Blue Barn. I ordered a healthy salad. Delicious!!!
author: David H.

description:
Totally a fan of this establishment. The salads are by far the best that I have tried in any cafe in the city. I had the chinese chicken salad while my friend had the special and both were just delish!!! 

The ingredients were fresh. Her cheeses were just mouth watering! My mandarines were vibrant with flavor. I cannot say enough yummy things about this place. Oh wait, yes I can...they serve blue bottle coffee. Just an added bonus! 

Only downer is that there isnt a lot of space to sit down and parking is really annoying in the neighborhood. But, I will not penalize this place for those things. The food is just OH TOO GOOD!!
author: Michelle I.

description:
Salads are good, but the service is HORRIBLE. They rarely answer the phone for a takeout order and instead make you suffer through the inefficient order and serving system. And the staff regularly gives customers attitude. Plus I have made more than a few orders messed up.

Plus, why close at 8:30? 

If this place made it easy to order and pickup food, I'd eat here multiple times per week. Very lame when terrible service kills an experience.
author: Sarah L.

description: My go-to-salad place in the Marina. I used to eat here once a week but maybe once every other week now, only because I am trying to cook more at home. My favorite salad is their spicy tuna salad. It's a tad pricey at ~$16 for salad but the portions are extremely generous and this could easily be split into two servings especially with protein in it.
author: Kai C.

description: Love BBG salads. It's a little on the pricier side and the wait for a salad can be a little shorter. The quality of the salad definitely makes up for it. Will be back when I'm craving a healthy salad.
author: Mary M.

description: Fresh and yummy!! Water cups are nice and big !!!! Place is tight but it's ok BC it wasn't hard to find seats on a crowded Sunday
author: Katie W.

description: Just like everyone says the salads and sandwiches here are great. The salads are definitely fresh and filling. The sandwiches have great favors. We got the Cobb and skirt. Yum! It receives one less star because of the price, but I guess it is Marina/Cow Hollow.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Blue Barn Gourmet is a cute, cozy place, typical of the health-conscious, fairly pricey, slim portions served up by San Francisco cafes/eateries. For my boyfriend who always used to ask for seconds as a child, it's not enough food. For a petite Asian female like myself, I consider their portions a full lunch.

On to the quality of the food - delicious salads. I ordered the Spicy Tuna salad and it blew me away. Light dressing didn't overpower the greens. Ample slices of fresh, fatty tuna lie on top of greens, mango (yum), avocado (yum), and soba noodles. The flavors and textures complemented each other and I was glad I ordered it.

The Ragin' Cajun sandwich on the other hand - not impressive. The ciabatta roll was hard as rocks and a lot of bread, little in between. Dry and boring.

The menu is overpriced. What's the most you've paid for grilled cheese? 6? 7? At BBG it's 9.25. Organic and slow food obviously have higher price points, but it should also be balanced with affordability. I guess when consumers are willing to meet that price point it's not such a big deal. But to me it's not worth it.

It's definitely more of a to-go place - the interior space is small and the line takes up half of it. The outside has all but 3 small tables. Good to pop in when you work or are walking around the area, but if you're meeting a friend or 2 for lunch I don't think it will accommodate well.

Loved the salad, disliked the sandwich, and turned off by the price.
author: Brandy A.

description:
My go-to salad place! This place taught me that a salad can really be a meal and not a side (girl from Texas talking) If you're doing pick up, call 15 minutes ahead to avoid waiting in long lunch lines.

FOOD:
+Beet salad with chicken. $13, which is pretty expensive especially for the crappiest chicken any salad place has ever had. They should consider adding seasoning or flavor to it, so its not white chunks of boiled chicken.
+Spinach Salad- pretty average salad with not that much excitement to it; HATE THE BLUE CHEESE; note to self to substitute that next time;  try adding their Ahi seared tuna (which is super tasty but another $5 :( )
+Caeser Salad- I usually get this but substitute the romaine for mixed greens since lettuce has no nutritional value; they add way too much dressing and it tastes like melted cheese so remember to go light on the dressing
+Spring Salad- another good option; mixed greens, arugula, roasted asparagus, fresh shelling bean medley, blanched snap peas, shaved fennel, toasted 
almonds, feta cheese & strawberry-poppyseed vin

+The other signature salads (detox ) are pretty good- they use fresh ingredients and the portions are hearty
+MASALA sandwich- AMAZING!! curried chicken-apple salad, almonds, dried cranberries, cucumber, red onion & sprouts on seeded whole wheat; big sizes

SERVICE:
the lines can get long and the seating is competitive but order pick up or go during off time 

AMBIENCE:
You're eating in a barn! On high tables or sit outside if its not too cold/or too crowded. Bathroom is available upstairs.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: I like the food here a lot. But ordering is a pain. They never pick up the phone. Very frustrating. Waiting in line and for the order takes 20 minutes minimum.
author: Zach T.

description:
I loved this place when I visited  the city! Very small, but you can still sit and eat. The decor is so beautiful and the sandwiches are unique and fresh! They also make great salads!

If you are bored of sandwiches, you should definitely try this delicious place!
author: Anne J.

description:
Ive got to admit, this place has become one of my favs. Chinese chicken salad? Unreal. Spicy tuna salad? Mouth-watering. Buddha Sand? Cant believe it's just veggies... it's so good!

It's definitely become a solid place. Just make sure to order ahead of time because it does get extremely  packed.
author: Chieko H.

description:
What's difficult about Yelp on occasion is that some of us have been caught in that one moment when a server may have had a bad day, or the kitchen is a little off, or someone's cat just died-and they're not working on all cylinders. 

I think that's what happened that one time (in a land far far away) at Blue Barn because since that one time they faltered they have COMPLETELY rocked my world!

The staff is incredible attentive (even when there are thirty size 2 skinny starving white girls in a row and six sweaty post workout men waiting) and always say hi to me, ask me how my day was and smile-genuinely. I enjoy over tipping them as they deserve it. They go above and beyond serving up the freshest tastiest damn salads and best savory sandwiches ever. And the tomato basil soup visits me in my dreams as it's identical to the one I used to enjoy in the tender pre-mortgage stresses of yesteryear. 

12.00 for a sandwich!? At Blue Barn say YES!
12.00 for a salad?! YES-don't walk...run!

Sorry for hurting your feelings before Blue Barn...can we make up?!
author: Danielle S.

description:
For a time, I would get Blue Barn for dinner every night. The go-to's are the Tostada Salad, the Spicy Tuna Salad, and the Burrata Sandwich. Those three items are just incredibly yummy. Plus, every employee is nice, courteous, and efficient.

The middling rating is due to how insanely popular this place has become. And, I don't mean that (entirely) in a hipster way. I mean that it is so popular that it is no longer possible to have an order completed in a reasonable period of time. For the love of God, do not order at the counter to eat in. Once I waited a half hour for a sandwich. After that experience, I vowed to only order Blue Barn by calling ahead. Well, now any time I call in I either get a busy signal, or it goes to voicemail. I have literally tried calling multiple times each day this week and have not been able to talk with an employee. It really has gotten crazy over the past year, and so unfortunately I am going to have to go here much less.
author: Andrew G.

description:
This place is realllllllll good for salads.  In particular, I love their spicy tuna salad.  The detox is also delicious.  I've had one of their sandwiches which was also good, but forget which one.

Waits can be a bit long, but as they say--good food takes time to prepare.  Call in ahead of time if you're impatient.

My only complaint is the price.  Yes, I know it's in a pricey part of town.  But I still have issues paying that much for a salad.  

Some seating inside and out, but not a ton.  I normally take it to go so not a problem for me.
author: Tristan Z.

description:
all the seats/tables were taken when i decided to grab a bite to eat. (you know it's an honestly good place to eat when the place is packed.) i couldn't complain...i usually get food to-go, so that wasn't a problem. i really like the style and atmosphere. you could really tell that people enjoyed it. 

i got the buddha sandwich and a side of fries with ranch! nothing bad to say, at all!

the sandwich itself was nothing like any other veggie sandwich i've had before. i never had a sandwich with asparagus, or even a pea hummus spread.  the goat cheese really brought it over-the-top! that sandwich really hit the spot. and people say that vegetables are filling...

the fries...seriously, they tasted like a fry & chip hybrid...however they cook/fry their fries, thumbs up! 

oh, and if they ask if you want their ranch dressing, get it...it will not disappoint. goes perfectly with their fries!
author: Donald G.

description:
Creative and delicious salads -- this place is not to be missed! Casual and friendly, you can sit back and take your time or sit at the community table or bar stools if you're in a hurry. 
The spicy tuna was the best salad I've had in awhile. Unique, satisfying, and best with a glass of chilled white wine. I love that they serve salads in big bowls, not plates. And, that they have real/metal utensils. 

I'll be back!!
author: Sarah J.

description: I have become completely obsessed with this place. I've gotten their Cobber salad 3 times in the last two weeks and it is so freaking good. I one time strayed and got the tuna salad, but it didn't live up to the cobber - it had an ice cream scoop shape of the spicy tuna they put in sushi rolls, which wasn't very good over a salad. HOWEVER! 5 stars for the Cobber. The dressing, the toppings, the bread.... I don't want to move from the cow hollow because it'll mean leaving my cobber salad.
author: Sarah B.

description:
The interior of Blue Barn is on the small side (maybe 1/3 or 1/2 the size of Plant Organic a block away) but there were plenty of seats on a late Sunday morning. It was nice to be able to snag up some window seats.

With the suggestion from the pleasant lady at the counter I ordered the Burrata grilled cheese sandwich. It sounded interesting but I didn't care for it at all! Although I love burrata cheese I don't think it works well as the sole cheese on a grilled cheese sandwich. Either that or it was just not executed well here. What I had was two slices of toasted ciabatta that went cold (isn't a grilled sandwich supposed to be hot or at least warm?) and the burrata had more of a cream cheese (whipped) consistency that kept dripping out from the bottom with a slice of green tomato, arugula with a hint of pesto. C had the BLT which he really enjoyed and we both shared a hefty sized beet and green salad. However the salad was great. 

I will return but next time I will definitely be ordering something else.
author: Esther A.

description:
How anyone could give this spot below five stars is beyond me. Their salads are phenomenal. You can choose from any one of their delicious combinations or customize your own by picking out the ingredients (which includes options like avocado, arugula and sundried tomatoes) you want yourself. If you're craving something a bit more substantial, their grilled cheese menu hits the spot. Yes, you read that correctly: THEY HAVE A GRILLED CHEESE MENU. I ordered the Provo, packed with provolone, turkey, avocado, roma tomato, arugula and thyme aioli. It is the best thing on this earth, and I still dream about it.

Never mind that there is only one big communal table, and a couple tables outside. The food easily makes up for the lack of space here, and you will almost certainly leave feeling happy (and healthy).
author: Tiffany W.

description:
For those of you who like to get your 5+ fruit and vege a day this is the joint it for you.  
The salads are humungous and full of locally sourced, seasonal goodness. Although maybe a wee bit pricey, with a salad to toppings ratio (approx 60:40) like theirs you really are getting good bang for your buck.  

In terms of what to order, you really cannot go wrong. I have literally tried every item on the salad menu (they have sandos as well) and am yet to be disappointed.  My current go to is the Detox Salad with Avocado but for those more adventurous souls, I would definitely recommend the pick n' mix (beware, once you go over the included number of toppings things can become expensive preeetty quickly).

Note: This place can get pretty packed so for those in a hurry, order ahead and ask for the dressing on the side. After all, no one likes limp salad.
author: Alex D.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I love Blue Barn and it's probably one of my favorite salad-focused places in the city. But I feel obliged to leave this review. 

Today I got a salad to go, and about 1/3 of the way through I found a big BUG in it. Fortunately, I'm not too squeamish and cautiously continued to eat my salad anyways (Ok, I was hungry and wasn't about to waste my $10.25). I'm surprised that they don't already do this, but I highly suggest that they cover the ingredients that sit out all day.  And while I'm at it, for such exorbitant, inflated salad prices they could really have a better ingredient to greens ratio - if more than half of the bites I take are just lettuce with dressing, I am not getting my money's worth.
author: Krissi P.

description:
Really, I couldn't have asked for anything more from a soup and salad place. My husband and I eat a vegan diet (with the exception of fish every once in a while) so, wherever there's a  large fresh bowl of organic salad - we're there. 

Everything on the menu sounded absolutely amazing that we ordered a few items to share. Those items were: the spicy tuna salad, the detox salad and the falafel sandwich. As hungry as we were, we had an extremely hard time finishing off that delicious masterpiece of a falafel sandwich after conquering our giant bowls fresh veggies. The spicy tuna salad was unlike any other salad that I have ever tasted. They give you a hefty amount of ahi tuna, avocado, mangos and greens that you would think it cost much more than $12!

I highly, highly recommend it to anyone who's a fan of getting lots of fresh food for their money and enjoy to nom away in a cozy and clean environment.
author: Melissa L.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Blue Barn! My most favorite salad in the whole city!!!  

Blue Barn is the real deal.  They've got the cutest entrance, the outside actually looks like a barn.  The ingredients they use are absolutely scrumptious!  They even do a weekly product box, which is probably really solid.

Every time I go here I get the exact same thing... The detox salad with almonds instead of quinoa, oranges instead of cranberries, and add tofu.  Yum.  Delicious salad perfection.  I love that they use a ton of ingredients (11 total) so this salad would be tiresome to replicate at home.  Also the dressing is so tasty and wonderful! And they never put on too much, just the right amount.

Brings me to my next point on Blue Barn, they ALWAYS get my order right.  Even though I custom order (dangerous thing to do at some restaurant, I'm looking at you The Grove).  The quality of the salad, and the amount of salad dressing they use is ALWAYS consistent.  Perfection.  They have their kitchen system down to a fine art.

Finally, the only reason I don't give more stars is because they don't have nearly enough seating area.  It's always jam packed, so I pretty much always have to get my food to go.  They are opening a new location on Polk though,  so fingers crossed that that one will be more spacious!
author: Evelyn N.

description: Great lunch spot! Loved the tostada salad and smoked salmon sandwich. Looks small from the outside, but more seating than expected. The staff was wonderful too!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Food is very good but be prepared to wait.

We really enjoy their gourmet salads; the arugula one with steak and spicy tuna one are two of our all time faves! 

We often end up going elsewhere when we think of Blue Barn though because when we call in our orders ahead there have been too many times where they don't answer the phone. So frustrating!! 

If you have time, go here and you will enjoy it!
author: Jen N.

description:
This place is great for a quick delicious sandwich! 

A little pricy for just a sandwich, but definitely a place you have to try at least once!

The custom made salads are awesome!
author: Robert R.

description:
Happened upon here this week and really loved it! The interior is absolutely adorable. The place is a bit small and can get super busy if you go at the wrong time of day. I noticed a lot of folks pre-ordering and picking up lunch to-go so if you work around the area, it's an awesome option!

We ordered the following:
- Buddha sando - I thought this was delicious. I might ask for a little bit of the garlic aioli to give it a little more flavor but everything was fresh and healthy.
- Beets and Greens salad - This was a solid standard beet salad. A bit heavy on the dressing and a hefty serving. 
- Truffle sando - This might have been my favorite. They give a good amount of meat so it's filling and the garlic aioli is awesome.
- French fries - They are yummy and salty.
- Rooster and Hen sandos - Highly enjoyed by friends but I didn't get to try them.

The food was fresh, properly portioned and came out pretty quickly. Definitely a win.
author: Raina B.

description:
Every time I come here, I get the Detox salad.  It is a really tasty, "detoxifying", huge salad with different greens (including kale), quinoa, veggies and a light lemony vinaigrette! It can definitely be split for 2 people.  The hen sandwich is also yummy.  

FYI: It takes a while to get your food despite them just having to put the ingredients together and toss a salad.  So if you call for take-out, it takes about 20-25 min sometimes.  

Can't wait to try the other salads on the menu!
author: Juliana K.

description:
Great food.
Local flavors.
Healthy ingredients. 
Blue Bottle coffee.
Amazing salads.
Mind-blowing sandwiches.

I had the 'Clubber' sandwich today for lunch. What a cute name! The name really was calling me. I needed major protein after my 12 mile run. The 'Clubber' included layers and layers of deli chicken and bacon. BACON! What a treat for my achy body! The sandwich also included roma tomatoes, red onions, watercress, Havarti and jalapeno-BACON aioli on a sourdough bread. Did I mention that the sandwich was pressed! Love it! Not only was the sandwich delicious, but because it was pressed, it was so crunchy and gave the sandwich amazing texture. I got crumbs all over me but who cares. 

I always have a great meal here. However, service was a little slow. It took awhile before I got my sandwich. It is worth the wait!
author: Molly T.

description: Enjoyed the Chinese chicken salad it was very tasty. However the prices at displays are a little on the higher side but they do give you a very good portion of food overall I would definitely go again and splurge. Their service was good the guy at the counter was very helpful and recommended a few of their popular foods.
author: Scarlett F.

description: The Spicy Tuna Salad is amazing. I get it every time; I don't even mess with anything else.
author: Andrew K.

description: Huge, fresh salads and creative sandwiches.  Great to go and reasonable prices for what you get.  This is the type of place that you could put into your weekly rotation.  Very solid.
author: Five C.

description:
be aware as they will charge you 5% of the sf health for their employees & tips for a pick up!!!

that is just not right & i just felt cheater on after being a customer for more than 5 years.

Overall the food is good and the owner did call me back explaining about this and they refunded me the tips but the 5% sf health was not removed even though this is for a pick up order.
author: Yoshi L.

description:
The salads and sandwiches are excellent. Blue Barn has pretty much any combination of salad you should want. They serve hefty portions too. The sandwiches will undoubtedly fill any grown man up.

I've read a number of reviews complaining about the service. I had no problems with the servers. The only problem I found with Blue Barn is the seating arrangement. There are 3-4 outdoor tables. One of the outdoor tables has a door that takes up half of the table. The indoor seating is quite awkward as well. The water dispensary is directly next to the cash register, which makes it also awkward experience. 

Give this place a go.
author: Zack K.

description:
Two minutes into a nice meal here when all four of our friends jumped back as a GIANT BLACK BEETLE CRAWLED OUT OF THE SALAD that I had been munching on for ten or so bites.  Gross I know, but what happened after was even more appalling. 

The surly snot-nosed girl at the front took five minutes to come over and when she did and saw the beetle, she just ran away with a little squeek for someone in the back, which we thought would be a manager.  Nope, a chef came out and took the plate away...another 5 minutes passed and no one has said sorry or come and spoken to us, finally the same insconsiderate idiot that jumped back, came and said that she could offer me a free side salad for the NEXT TIME I CAME IN!!  Obviously this was absurd and I had to ask for the manager, still no apology at this point.

Ten minutes after that, the manager comes down and barely says sorry and after yelling and begging, she said she can only get my meal refunded when my three friends are sitting there with salads in front of them that could easily be beetle, cockroach or god knows what ridden.  Obviously, they did not eat, I did not eat and she only refunded the one of our meals and we did not ever receive an apology.

These pretentious pricks here think they can charge $15 for a basic salad and not treat people with respect because they are in the marina and there are thousands of girls with hefty plastic cards looking for a low-carb meal. This is an embarrassment of an establishment with COMPLETE IDIOTS WORKING HERE, from the front desk to the management.

Do yourself a favor and don't go here ever! That is unless you are preparing to go on Fear Factor the next week or you like to get treated like a second class citizen at a cafeteria...
author: Sammy B.

description:
Un. Believable.

Best salad I've ever had.

This place has put thought into every aspect of the business: the casual decor, the freshest ingredients, the most delectable dressing, the rosemary bread, all the way down to the adorable take out boxes.

You'll get heaping salads of the highest quality. You can make your own - I put mixed greens, ginger miso, balsamic onions, grilled portobellos mushrooms, garbanzo beans, scallions, crunchy tortilla strips, and grilled organic tofu in mine. Extremely reasonable price for such high-quality fixings ($12). It'll be tough to find a better salad in SF.

I will come back MANY times (except when I'm in a hurry, because I waited about 15 minutes at 11:30 on a Sunday). And I don't even like salads.
author: Jeena C.

description: I love the seasonal salads. They're so fresh and all of the flavors compliment one another. A bit pricy with added protein, but well worth it!
author: Bree G.

description:
Yum yum. Every salad I've had here has been delicious.

Today I had the winter vegetable special which had brussels sprouts (obsession of mine) and butternut squash (another obsession of mine) but other star ingredients I wouldn't have thought to include myself included pomegranate seeds and parmesan. 

I used to get annoyed that they take so long, but now I appreciate they take the same amount of care as more formal restaurants. 

I think they should open up the 2nd floor for seating, though I might explode from too much cuteness.
author: Richa A.

description: Bummed that prices keep going up, not really the most affordable grab and go now. I still love their food though.
author: Lacey L.

description:
So I thought this place was over-hyped and chose other places in the hood to eat at. I am so glad I gave in and tried it this past week though! Amazing food. I got the provo (grilled cheese with turkey, provolone, tomatoes, some really good sauce). SOOO GOOD. It was worth the 20+ minute wait. 
So good that my friend ordered one for her sister. I'm hooked.
author: Cesie A.

description: Consistently delicious salads of all sorts. My favorite is the Tostado and Chinese Chicken salad. Oh, and the churo ricecrispie treat is ah-mazing!
author: Heidi A.

description:
Cute little restaurant that offers big portions of delightful salads and sandwiches. Often come here for a quick bite after jogging at Crissy's. My favorite is their nicoise salad, which has mixed greens, tuna, olives, cherry tomatoes, artichokes, red onion, feta cheese, potatoes, and herbs. Served with a mustard vinaigrette but I always replace it with their champagne dressing.

It's too bad they close early, I've tried coming down here for dinner a couple of times but missed opening hours due to the complication of finding parking around chestnut!
author: Jenny K.

description: I love you blue barn but for the love of whoever you worship, start taking AMEX!!  You know your demographic, charge a few cents more to make up for the AMEX transaction fees.
author: Patrick L.

description: The best salad you can get on Chestnut Street!!! HELLA PRICY but worth the splurge. I wish they would cut down on their portions a bit though which would help reduce the cost. The portions are TOO BIG.
author: Melissa S.

description: I don't leave reviews on Yelp very often, but I was very disappointed in the Blue Barn that just moved to Steiner.  I had an order of several items for a business meeting and I called Blue Barn last week to find out how to best go about the ordering.  I was told they open at 11 and I should simply call in 20 minutes prior to pickup.  I attempted to call in my order this morning and at first the phone wasn't picked up even though it was after opening hours.  I kept trying and finally somebody picked up the phone, but didn't say anything, and very apparently just set down the handset because I could hear the chatting of the employees in the background.  I said hello several times, but to no avail.  I eventually hung up and tried again and got a busy signal.  I finally decided to drive to the place and put my order in there.  The place was not very busy (yet) and I was helped right away.  I mentioned to the young lady that I had tried to call several times and that evidently the phone had just been put down - seemingly on purpose.  She just said "I'm so sorry" with a very fake smile, while she was raising her eyebrow at one of her co-workers because of my comment.  I ended up having to wait almost 30 minutes because of the fact that the staff chose to not pick up the phone at all or just simply set it aside.  The behavior of the young lady was not business like, but rather rude.  No matter how good their food may be, it is not a cheap place to eat and with the attitude I encountered today, I will make sure to give my business to a different establishment next time I have to organize a business lunch.
author: Maria R.

description:
Tasty tasty tasty! 
I went in and got an ahi tuna salad for lunch. For the price, it was awesome! Yes, it's a little pricey but come on, it's three times bigger than you need it to be! I ate almost a half of it and was stuffed. Everything was fresh and yummy.
 The decor inside is nice. Lotsa wreaths.
author: Taryn S.

description: Overpriced and terrible customer service as other reviewers have noted. I ordered a salad and asked them to replace the meat with tofu. Salad was $20 as they didn't sub the proteins, just charged me extra for adding tofu. When it came out 30 minutes later it had meat in it. I asked them to remake it and they took it back to the kitchen, removed the meat, and brought it back with chunks of chicken still in it. Very unimpressed with how they handle their business which is too bad because I wanted to love this place.
author: Laura H.

description:
Damn now I know I really like this place.  I chose it over Pluto's again.
My new position has me in a few different neighborhoods, I'm learning to like the Marina in doses. I'm learning that the people that work the shops & restaurants on Chestnut are pretty awesome, despite having to deal with so much of the neighborhood pretension. You will see a lot of that here :)

Had the yummiest lunch and it resembled something I make pretty regularly at home, but still, defiantly a fan of Blue Barn and for the price of organic stuff, a $8.75 salad is not offensive since it's very generous.

Detox salad is good but customizing your own is better (says my controlling inner gremlin)
....

6th star * they have a gourmet grilled cheese bar. Even if you are not religious, you might still thank the good Lord for their options.
author: Athena S.

description:
After hearing a lot about this place from my boyfriend who used to work at a salon in the marina, i finally made it down here due to an apple appointment next door.... This place was super cute and was awesome! I had the Tostada salad and added chicken and avocado. It was super delicious and fresh. The people in here were really nice as well and had smiles on their faces. It looked like they had a nice variety of sandwhiches also. The woman next to me was having a bowl of soup with some french fries which looked scrumptious. 

I will def. be coming back and will next time have to try the spicy tuna salad! Glad i finally made it to this spot.
author: Scott Y.

description:
So, I have some friends that have mentioned this place to me. Though with my slightly bad hearing, I assumed that there was this magical salad place called Blue Bar. I wanted to go, but just couldn't find it. So finally, I do realize where it is and what it's called...I'm one step closer to salad goodness.

Well, I know that it's in the Marina...but I didn't want to hold that against the business and the staff. I figure "Marina girls love salad, so good location. I can suck it up and all that."

I ordered my food to-go, as they were closing and I didn't want to be like the rude bitches in front of me that ordered salad and wine and decided to park it and make the staff hang out longer.

The pre-made salads are quite delicious, and even going rogue and making your own results in a deli sh result. I went premed rogue and had a tasty combination that I wolfed down without a problem. And the staff was really friendly and nice. Plus, they put up with the wavelike Marina girls that come in wearing yoga clothes and giggling like a schoolgirl. Esther were plenty there that night.

Good service and good selection (even saw a few big, burly guys in there getting their salad on). Did notice that it's an awkward space to wait for your food. You either have a few random chairs, or you sit at the communal table and have girls give you dirty looks like they think you're going to molest them (sorry bitches your closeted boyfriend). Additionally, it's a little priced, but I suppose that's the cost you pay for fresh and delicious.

Overall, worth the visit. Plus, eavesdrop on your neighbor and you're sure to get some entertainment with your meal.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Wow, it is time for an update on Blue Barn! Even though I no longer live in the city, I have come back here many, many times. And I always order the Fattoush salad (with a few substitutions - like the goat cheese for the feta, and no onions). They will also make a custom salad and have expanded the sandwich menu from when they first opened. My only complaint? They need to expand the seating!!

Whenever I'm in the city, I find a reason to make my way over here for lunch. It's worth braving the crazy parking situation for a delicious salad like this!
author: Lindsay B.

description:
After a long day of biking this fair city I told my husband that I wanted a delicious salad and sandwich for dinner. He jumped on Yelp and immediately settled on Blue Barn and boy am I happy he did! This place is not only adorable inside, but the people who work their are friendly, the atmosphere is relaxing and the food is SO good! 

We chose the ceasar salad and the Smoked sandwich. The dressing for the salad was deliciously light and citrusy. The Smoked sandwich had amazing lox with fresh greens and a light cheese spread.

Overall the meal was more than enough food for two hungry bikers and only $18. We will definitely be back! I'm thinking take out on a busy work night :)
author: Emily S.

description:
I LOVE Blue Barn! 

I have eaten at the Corte Madera location twice and this location twice and have adored my food each time.  The salads are large and fresh- the sandwiches delicious- yum.

I will be back again and again.
author: Christy L.

description:
Ladies & Gentlemen!!! Blue Barn is the bomb.

     My sis and I decided to get get some salads at Blue Barn this afternoon, and my experience was very pleasing.  There were available seats inside the cute little barn, (which could seat about 10-12 people) but we thought it would be nice to sit outside.  It was such a sunny, beautiful day afterall.  Yes!! It finally feels like summer is near... We saw the cuttest dogs & puppies stroll by as we enjoyed our delicious lunch.  I give them a full 5 stars.  

     I ordered a roasted herb chicken salad with romaine lettuce, champagne-sumac vinegarette dressing, red onions, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, feta cheese, green apples and d' Anjou pears. They carried Honest Tea so I had to have one (Green Tea with Honey). TOTAL= $13  

You Pick Salads (make your own) = Start at $8.5 including 6 fixings.
Fixings = Choose from a varirty of veggies (roasted or raw), fruit, nuts, cheese, crunchies (croutons, crispy pita, etc.) 

Avocado = Extra $1

Protein = Extra 
Roasted herb Chicken = $2.5
Meyer Skirt Steak = $5
Albacore Tuna = $2.5
Grilled Garlic Shrimp = $4
Crumbled Egg = $1
Bacon $1
Tofu = $2
Falafel = $3

     Alrighty, obviously ordering a salad is simple & easy, but since I was new to Blue Barn, I experienced the "I am not exactly sure what's going on here" vibe.  Kind of like what you would feel if you didn't know the name of the coffe sizes at Starbucks, or how to order a drink at Blue Bottle...
    
     So, ordering was a bit tricky at first because I didn't know the routine of ordering a "You Pick Salad".  I told the cashier, who complimented on my dress, exactly what I wanted on my salad, but all she needed to know was what kind of salad I wanted; whether I wanted one of the chef's specialty salads from the menu (if I did, I'd just order it by name) OR a "You Pick Salad".

Here's a heads up all:  If you want to make your own salad, first you tell them that you want to make your own salad & tell them what kind of protein you'd like on it because the protien costs more, and the lovely cashier will calculate your total, and you pay her.  Then you move over to your right where you tell another person what you want on your salad.  You'll be able to see all the fixings through the glass.  And you'll be on your wayyyyyy!!!! 

Go to Blue Barn for bomb salads =)
author: Amethyst Popkiss A.

description: Best north SF spot for robust salad. Tiny place, but extraordinarily tasty quick food.
author: Kip W.

description: Salad didn't have kale like it said it did? Also the chicken had an interesting texture and didn't look very appetizing. The salad dressing needed more acid.
author: Ella S.

description: yummm yum yum beets & greens! also try out the turkey sando, it's unreal
author: Clay P.

description:
Detox.

I crave and want every salad to be this good. If only.

It's a rare sight to see me up in the Marina, so I try to keep it brief. I don't wear lululemon and I don't own a yoga mat.

The times I'm headed back from runs in the Headlands and I haven't stopped at my favorite North Bay cafe (http://www.yelp.com/biz/cafe-del-soul-mill-valley#hrid:T2mo2LWRAFcF0KqIMN9pzA), you'll find me here. The salads are ridiculously good and the sandwiches don't disappoint.

Just don't tell my friends you saw me here. They'll be concerned I've traded in my colorful old school Sauconys for some UGGs and that will never happen.

Life is good again.
author: Alissa A.

description: This place is mislabeled-- it's actually a sandwich and salad spot. Having said that, their food incredible. They have really good vegetarian options and a great atmosphere.
author: Abe S.

description:
I LOVE Blue Barn!!!
My husband and I literally order take out from here at minimum twice a week.  We both get the Tostada Salad EVERY time.  He gets steak in his and it is so good I usually steal some!  
I have had the sandwiches and other salads here as well and they are always so delicious.  When we feel like a sweet treat we grab one of the rice krispy treats, they have a hint of lemon and are so Yummy!

5 Stars for Blue Barn!
author: Lauren A.

description:
What a great place! It reminds me of a gourmet version of Pluto's

I got the Cobb salad which was delicious and flavorful! There were generous amounts of meat and dressing. I did notice it was missing cheese but I didn't feel like getting up to tell them. The avocado chunks were great.

The food does take awhile to come out, it took about 15 minutes for our salad to come out. It wasn't *that* crowded either. It's different from pluto's because there are gourmet toppings such as avocado, bacon, flax seed, kale, etc. It's a nice change.

A lot of people were coming in and ordering to-go. This is more of a to-go place than a sitting and eating place. There are only 2 tables with 4 stools each, and a long table. It can get awkward if you have to sit next to others on the long table.
author: Kristina N.

description:
I don't eat nearly as many salads as I should. 
1) I prefer cupcakes and 
2) We don't have many great salad places in Chicago.

I chose the make-your-own-salad option, which is as close as I get to "cooking" these days. I asked the friendly salad woman to load it up with lettuce, chicken black beans, corn, mushrooms, goat cheese and pita chips. Lots of good dressings to choose from, but I went with a spicy chipotle dressing. It also came with a small slice of soft bread so I could get my carb fill.

Finding a table isn't an easy task in this tiny little restaurant, but my friend and I lucked out while devouring our tasty salads. I was kind of sad when it was all gone because I wanted more!  

If Blue Barn was in Chicago I've got a feeling I'd be eating a lot less cupcakes. Mmmm...
author: Andrea R.

description: Is it too much to expect someone to answer the phone at this establishment?! Been trying to call in an order for the past 20 minutes and no one can bother to pick up. What a disappointment. Guess I'll go to Pluto's... #rudebarn
author: D K.

description:
Undeniably my favorite place for lunch! It gets pretty crowded during lunch time but if you call in you can cut through the line and pick up your order. Everything is completely organic and they have a great mixture of salads and sandwiches; which for salads you can either make your own salad or pick the salads made by the restaurant. Typically I get the Spicy Tuna salad or the provolone grilled cheese sandwich- they are absolutely mouth drooling. 

In addition, the ambiance is "pottery barn-esque" which plays well with their organic green vibe though seats are limited. Blue Barn will not disappoint!
author: Megan D.

description: Very tasty, unique offerings. Portions are a good size my only complaint would be how long the food takes, but overall, it was a very pleasant experience.
author: Susan R.

description:
Really great make-your-own salad. Ingredients were fresh. The interior is a bit tight and people spend some time trying to figure out where the line is, then where to stand to wait while their salads are being made, but it works. Only thing that I will say is the salad dressing was a bit heavy, so get on the side or request light. 

Pluto's is another great alternatives a few blocks down and may save you a couple of bucks for a similar salad.
author: Angela S.

description:
This place is delicious. But, you have to want to spend like $11 on a salad, which is not something I'm always up for.
Favorites include: Fattoush, Detox, Tostada, Cobber. Holy Cow and Skirt are also delish sandos. I love the feel and the to go boxes!
author: Francesca F.

description:
I'm terrible with jokes, but here's one: 
Why did Skrillex get fired from the salad bar? Because he kept dropping all the beets!

I've been waiting for my sandwich for over 20 minutes. This is what "The Hunger Games" is about, right? I can go watch that eternal movie next door, come back, and it still won't be ready. Nope. Not ready yet...

The place is cute, it's a little barn, and its blue. They have one long table for like 9 people, 2 tables for 2 inside and 2 tables for 4 outside. The barn is pretty popular and there's always a line. The sandwiches are really good and the salads too. 

My favorite sandwiches are:
Rooster
Kickin chicken
Hen
Burrata 
+ fries with aioli. 

Really excited one with open on Polk Street with 30 seats inside and six to eight outside. Russian Hill is in dire need of a Blue Barn!! There's nothing healthy past 9:30pm.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Just do yourself a favor and go here. Amazing salads. Large portions. Enough Said.
author: Dustin C.

description: I had the Buddah sandwich, you'll need a lot of napkins for this one! I also had a delicious S'more Krispy Treat.
author: Josie C.

description: There is no bigger salad in the world. I think if I only ate these salads everyday I would gain 50 pounds.
author: Carleen W.

description: I would eat here every day if I lived closer!  I ordered the buddha sandwich because I wanted to order french fries and was trying to balance it out with something "healthy."  However, the sandwich was surprisingly good!   I think I even enjoyed it more than the french fries!
author: Kelly M.

description: Delicious salads and healthy choices.  best to order ahead, seating is limited.
author: David B.

description: Love this place! My friends have been raving about it and I finally got to try it out today. The salads are amazing and huge. They are a little pricey but totally worth it. I got the spicy tuna salad with light dressing and it was so delicious! Healthy but hearty enough that I left super satisfied and happy. Definitely will be going back!
author: Molly N.

description: Built it yourself or order Menu Item salads/soup/sandwiches. This place is delicious, everything is fresh. Seating is first come first serve, can get really busy during lunch & especially weekends. I loved my salad, added chicken & it was absolutely delicious.
author: Priscilla N.

description:
The ladies are cooing over the salad bar at this place, which I will admit is pretty impressive.

I had a sandwich that had buffalo sauce on it (forget the name) which was amazing except it was way more spicy than I prefer, which unfortunately will likely prevent me from ever getting it again.
author: Captain B.

description:
Food was good but the service was horrendous. It is not a full service restaurant but someone from our party had to wait an extra 10-15 minutes to get her meal (after a large group behind us). No apology was offered. 

We asked for some silverware and were rudely told we could get it ourselves. Maybe the staff was having a bad day but I would not go back.
author: Nate L.

description:
In a former life i thought mixt greens had the SF salad sealed n' delivered.

After you have a salad at Blue bar, organic chicken, grilled mushrooms and kale inclusive, you consider making pilgrimage to Blue barn in the middle of a busy work day. Imagine the possibilities... and go.
