The winter mix and detox salad made a believer of me; trust.
author: Rachel S.

description:
This is the worst customer experience I've ever had. If I was the owner I would fire all the staff. 
The stopped picking up the phone for pick up orders about 45 minutes before closing. They are so slow at taking orders and often make you repeat things over and over. They say you can put a salad on file to make the phone ordering system easier, yet I've had to do it 5 times in the past 4 months and they keep losing it. 
This place could be so much better.
author: Alejandro M.

description: Sandwiches are killer! I alternate between the Rooster and the classic grilled ham and cheese. Fresh ingredients, reasonable prices. I only wish they had more seating room. It gets crowded fast and the wait is sometimes long.
author: Heide B.

description: Had the winter salad to go, the salad was nice with great combinations, dressing was just right. Though the salad did take a while to come but there's already a sign said slow food and be patience. I bet it worth the wait and I will be there again :)
author: Eskimo M.

description:
Looove their salads! Addicted! Best ingredients and yummiest balsamic vinaigrette EVER. Summer Heirloom Tomato, Winter, Tostada salads are all phenomenal, but you really can't go wrong.

Would be 5 stars based on taste of food, but because of the following I give 3 stars: they don't have delivery (or try to partner with seamless or designate pick up parking spots or bring food to your car if you could pay over phone. Horrible location for people driving to pick up). Need larger space. Always a massive line (regardless of time of day). They need nicer staff (I tip EVERY time for take out and they're still pretty rude and get my specialized orders wrong 1 in 10 times, so I'm stopping now).

I like that there's some outdoor seating (which Polk street location doesn't have). Would be great to have heat lamps though.
author: Katherine L.

description: Great salads and sambos.  Great choices. Expensive but totally worth it. Big serves. Not the quickest meal but it is made fresh. Will still be quicker, cheaper and tastier that you could make yourself.
author: Livia M.

description:
I'm writing this review ahead of reading any others b/c I don't want my opinion to change. 

First off, there is no doubt that Blue Barn's food is fresh and tasty. This is, in fact, where they earn there 2 stars. 

However, that's where it stops. I have been several times over the course of my years living in the area. And, WITHOUT FAIL, I have been disappointed every SINGLE TIME. 

It's like I have a cartoon bubble over my head when I order that says, "forget this person's order," or "get this person's order wrong," or, "be a complete snot to this person." 

Today, all 3 -- maybe that's what has convinced me to write this (overdue) review. 

I tried BB again, with an open mind, and high hopes that my past experienceS were flukes.  First - I stood there (no line) for about 5 min before someone took my SALAD order. Then, proceeded to watch 4 or 5 people get helped right away after me. I also took note of their orders -- ALL salads. 

I waited...and waited...and waited. Still no salad. (How long does a salad take when there was no line?)

Then I proceeded to watch every single person that was in front of me get their orders ahead of me. We all also ordered TO GO. 

There was nothing special in my order that should take extra time. Standard lettuce, veggies, vinagirette -- toss toss toss -- put in to-go container. DONE. Employees finally noticed I was waiting and checked on my order. It hadn't even been started. (see above - "forget this person's order." )

So, I wait...wait...wait..some more. FINALLY get my order and the employee acts like this is my fault. Gives me some attitude and ends w/ a condescending, "thanks for waiting" (see above - "be a complete snot.")

Get home. Open my salad box and notice it's wrong -- where is my chicken? where is the manchego? And, why do I have the chipotle vinaigrette (my salad is supposed to have lemon)? (see above "get this person's order wrong.)

After all that...well, you guessed it... I starting yelping. These things may seem little, but really - when you're getting food to-go and have paid a decent price for it, the little things matter. And when they are CONSISTENTLY wrong, it shows a lack of caring and respect for your customers that I just can't appreciate.

So, that's it BB. I gave you lots of chances. I won't be back. I won't recommend you to anyone, despite the freshness of your food and blue bottle coffee. It's over.
author: Tracy K.

description:
Blue Barn. The walls really are blue and the structure really does resemble a barn. You serve yourself water in a glass jar from a huge tin milk can. 

A few weeks ago, the BFF & I devoured "make your own salads" here during the lunch hour rush. 

In my salad, I chose: oak hill's seasonal greens, cherry tomatoes, scallions, strawberries, candied pecans, avocado (extra $1), cucumber, garlic croutons & grilled garlic shrimp (extra $4) with garlic caesar dressing. 

I don't remember exactly what my friend chose in his salad but I believe it included spinach, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, crumbled blue cheese, corn & skirt steak (extra $5.)

The taste & freshness of my salad deserves a full five stars but I do have a few mini gripes; because BB is cute & quaint (read: on the small side), the line gets long real fast & everyone who is not taking their salads to go is forced to fight for one of the 8-10 seats available. There's a lot of breathing down other peoples' necks or if you're lucky enough to grab a seat- people breathing down your neck. Also, those "extras" for protein really adds up: $28 total for two salads.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Reminded me of being at a cool lunch spot in Paris. Ordered the buratta sammie. Yum. 

Will come back to try the salads. They looked amazing.

thumbs up: good portions, healthy 
thumbs down: none yet!
author: Heidi L.

description: This place always drives me mad.  I like the salad 's at Blue Barn(although I think Sweetgreen's salad's on the east coast are way better then Blue Barn for less money with MUCH better service)  The problem with this place is not the food but the whole experience is terrible.  I have never been able to get food in under 15-20 minutes which is just crazy for a salad restaurant.  The pickup processes for the food is right next to the line where everyone is ordering and you are constantly being bumped into and pushed around.  All around this place should get a 3 for food quality because I do like the salads, and a 1 star for experience/design/layout/customer service/speed of service.  I absolutely can not stand how this restaurant operates and it has made me never want to come back.  Now if only Sweetgreen would open a San Francisco location...(one can dream, right?)
author: Ben K.

description: Built my own salad. It was salad. Decent size portions here, but paid $20 for a salad?!?! Think it's overpriced for salad. Added the chicken, but it was only a few pieces. Customer service was ok. Place is too crowded to feel comfortable.
author: Getinmybelly H.

description:
I love salad. Although good salads can be hard to find, and large, good tasting, healthy salads can be even harder to find. Luckily my coworker turned me on to this place. If it was closer to my work, I would probably go several times a week. 
I ordered the Detox salad, which had Kale and an assortment of other goodies mixed in. It was large, came in a cute oversized chinese to-go box and felt good going down. I could feel myself getting skinnier by the minute, or at least that was the hope, haha. 
I definitely want to try more of their salads when I'm in the area.
author: Sonya D.

description:
What's not to love about healthy sandwiches and salads in the marina? The salads are big and offer the option to get organic meat (fish, chicken, steak) but I don't think that they're worth the high price. With meat, the salad gets up to $15 which seems outrageous for a salad (but marina girls will pay it anyway). I did. The chicken is dry, dry, dry so get the tofu or sans meat. 

The service is ehh as the ladies who work there are unfriendly and rude. If you're looking for salads, go to Tacolicious or Plutos and you'll get the same sized salad for a cheaper price :)
author: Joy A.

description: Blue Barn is like a little heaven on earth. The salads are the best I have ever had in my life. The people who work there are SO amazing and sweet, and are always so helpful and friendly. It is such a pleasure to go in and get my incredible salad and also interact with such cool people who work there. Their salads are always, without fail, the highest of quality (and SO SO tasty!), and this place really helps me maintain a healthy lifestyle. I feel very lucky to have the opportunity to eat such amazing food in such an amazing environment.
author: Talia R.

description:
What does a 20-minute sandwich taste like? Go to Blue Barn in the Marina. 

The sandwiches are decent - I often get the Masala or the Ragin' Cajun. I haven't tried the salads, but my fiance was underwhelmed with the Chinese Chicken salad, especially given the long wait.

3.5 stars for the food. 2 stars for the service.
author: Mark H.

description:
I agreed to drive from Long Beach to San Francisco just for a one night trip with my boyfriend for an event for his school.  

Well that's what I told him.  

Secretly (or not secretly because I probably brought this place up at least 5 times during the drive) it was because I knew I might have the chance to eat here again (we ate here a few years ago).  Perhaps that is a long drive for a sandwich (and a school event), but I LOVE this place.  OK, so I've only had the turkey sandwich and the detox salad, but both are fantastic.  

Please Blue Barn, open a southern CA location.
author: Ashley F.

description:
Why isn't there one of these in EVERY district of San Francisco?! I love walking into Blue Barn knowing that I will have many fresh and delicious options for making-my-own salad. The seasonal veggie additions are my favorite! I wish I could eat here every day. 

They also have fantastic sandwich options as well. Thinking about their grilled cheese menu makes my mouth water.

Favorites: seared ahí addition, salad dressings, kombocha on stock
author: Alexandra A.

description: Drop-dead amazing! I had the winter salad with the curried chicken salad on top and it was one of the best salads I've ever had. Everything was perfectly proportioned and their flavor combinations are amazing! The ingredients were fresh and I can't wait to go back and literally try everything on the menu! So mouth-wateringly good!
author: Zehra V.

description:
My boyfriend came here and got two sandwiches and a salad to go for $30. 

-Spicy Ahi Tuna Salad. The salad was EXCELLENT. The mango + lettuce + avocado + tuna + chicory + mango makes a perfect bite of sweet, crunchy, savory, and creamy with a hint of spice, and they don't skimp at all with the avocado or the spicy tuna. Highly, highly recommend it.
-The Clubber: Solid sandwich with creamy, savory havarti cheese and tons of roast chicken breast. It was yummy, but had a little too much mayo for me.
-Kickin' Chicken: Very good! BBQ sauce in a sandwich is always kind of worrisome since BBQ sauce can be overly sweet, vinegary, or just generally overpowering. This BBQ sauce was good and complemented the gouda and the chicken well. 

The super crispy bacon on both sandwiches was also another plus.

FYI, parking in the Marina impossible on the weekend so don't plan on driving here unless if you want to get something to go.
author: Wendy S.

description: Went here with a friend after a massive workout of kickball on the Green!  Good salad but I probably wouldn't treck all the way over for another. Good for some people watching. But also kind of noisy.
author: Ali B.

description: Loved the grilled ham and cheese and black bean soup. Only issues are that they use tablespoons not soup spoons and they close early on Friday and Sat. Great place to people watch.
author: Kevin L.

description: Nice place to pick up a good salad, soup or sandwich.  Portions are big my favorite one was chicken Cobb salad very good service. Always busy at lunch.
author: Monica M.

description:
I am obsessed. I have no idea what took me so long to try this place, considering it is exactly what I have long been looking for - an easy place where I can sit and have a good sandwich, or take it to-go easily. I must try the grilled cheese varieties, but I have been unable to move past the delicious skirt steak sandwich and the incredible Thanksgiving "Gobbler." Everything about this place appeals to me. The delectable simplicity of the food matches the country charm of the surroundings. 

Note: I recently went on a Sunday afternoon and it was too packed to even move. But if you can hit it up on a weekday afternoon, there is just the right amount of bustle and available seating :)
author: Kiesha R.

description:
Solid solid place.

Ate here and got the Turkey sandwich.  My girlfriend got the Masala.  They were both very good.  I'd give this place 5 stars but  they are a bit slow. And hey, I know good food takes time -  maybe this is just  a bit too long.  Extra points for them having Abita Root Beer though.  

All in all, places like these are what make living in the Marina worth it. I'll be trying their salads next.
author: Hani S.

description:
This place is good but it's so SLOWWW!!! Any sandwich that requires heat will take at least 20 minutes even when they're not busy. If you plan on ordering a sandwich, call ahead because you will be waiting a long time. 

Also, what I said in my previous review is still true. Only order the sandwiches that come on soft bread.
author: Jamon B.

description: Great food - delicious soups, salads and sandwiches. I'm marking BB down to a 3 for one reason: there is never any space to sit down. I can make a great salad at home so when I go to Blue Barn, I'm interested in getting a great salad AND sitting down and eating it there. The last two times i've had to take my salad to go because there have been too many people waiting for tables to give me any hope of getting a table. How about creating a parklet out front? Or expanding?
author: Erin W.

description: My new favorite spot for salad and sandwich. Not a lot of places to sit. so it is a very casual place. Good for take out or a quick grab. But the salads are 5 star. I usually get the detox salad with avocado and shrimp. I am very picky and this place though not cheap it is worth every penny.
author: Mahasti T.

description:
How it takes 30 minutes to make a salad from ingredients that are already prepared is beyond me. 

Food is expensive, ordering can take ages, and mistakes are frequently made.

I'd suggest going to the Plant across the street, or Plutos a block away. Both are better choices.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Best place for "make your own" salads. Nice rotating  selection of roasted veggies (squash, portobellos, peppers).  Higher quality and larger selection of seasonal choices than Mixed Greens (which is also a nice place. Blue Barn is just more artisnal). 

Sandwiches are great but a bit small. Soups are fresh and light, even if they contain a little cream.  Overall this place is a bit pricey, but if you're a salad conisseuier, it's definitely worth your time. You can also have a glass of wine to go with your healthy lunch.

But don't count on a table. There is one communal table that seats about 9 and 2 inside tables that seat 2. There are also two 2 tops outside. Gets packed! Even though I like my space, I always leave happy.
author: Josh O.

description: Had the Chinese chicken salad. Paid $15 for a to go salad. Dressing was good but there were 2 pieces of orange in there no snow pea pods at all. Chicken was fresh and tasty. Way too pricey. Big salad as far as lettuce goes. Not even a piece of bread to go with it. Won't go back.
author: Nel M.

description:
I really don't like paying $9 for a sandwich, especially when the funds in my bank account are dwindling due to my purse addiction.  (When I have to choose between purses and food, I sadly choose purses.)  However, I was walking down Chestnut Street and saw someone eating an amazing looking panini in front of Blue Barn.  Before I knew it, my feet grew a mind of their own and walked inside and up to the counter.  The girl at the register was really, really nice.  I went up to her and was like, "I want that gooey panini thing the guy outside is eating!!!" and she actually helped me figure out that the gooey panini thing was actually a brie, ham, & garlic grilled cheese sandwich.  After I ordered, my food was ready in no time, and I got it to go, although there is a cute yet small dining area inside.

I decided to devour my grilled cheese in Washington Square and it was UH-MAZING.  I love all things cheese and could tell from the smooth, tart taste of the sandwich that they used high quality brie.  The ciabatta bread was grilled to perfection, making it crispy on the outside and super soft on the inside.

I really, reeeeeallllly want to go back because there are lots of other grilled cheese options on the menu, but I could easily spend $100 working my way through them.  So I guess the moral of the story is this:  If I have to pay $9 for a sandwich, I'd rather do it here than anywhere else.  I'm so glad that random guy was sitting outside eating his grilled cheese... Otherwise, I probably never would've discovered this place!
author: Christy L.

description:
The food here is fresh and tasty.  The salads are large and the sandwiches tantalizing.  That said, the service is sssllllllllooooooowwwwww!  

I've gone there when they've been busy and just left because the line moved so slowly.  I've gone then when there were only two people there and waited forever.  I've tried calling and was put on hold twice, each time for over 5 minutes... and was disconnected each time.  I got food somewhere else.

Update: I've found that the service has gotten slower.  I love the food, but the service is so painfully slow that I can't be bothered going there any more.  A real bummer.
author: James B.

description: I love this place! The staff is so friendly and the food is so fresh and yummy! Definitely convenient :)
author: M Q.

description:
This is the reason why I LOVE living in SF. I must've walked by Blue Barn dozens of times and never noticed it. Interior is small with only a few tables, so if you get here on a busy night you might be out of luck with scoring a seat. I know we definitely hogged a table until closing time. I ordered the provo grilled cheese sandwich with a side of fries while my girlfriends all had salads. Way to make me feel like a cow, guys. Food was amazing with sizable portions and the staff were all friendly and helpful. I will definitely be coming back here more often when I'm in the area! 

Ladies: Don't you hate going to restaurants with chairs that make it impossible for you to hang your purse on? Blue Barn installed these tiny hooks on the wall perfect for hanging your beloved purses! What a genius idea!
author: Vivian D.

description: If I lived in the area, I'd be here every day. Yum! My boyfriend and I shared the truffle and the rooster. They were both heavenly!!!  The salads look absolutely huge but in a good way.
author: Emily M.

description:
As soon as you walk into blue barn you feel the friendly and welcoming atmosphere. The staff is helpful in all kinds of way. I wasn't sure what to order and they suggested multiple things to me. In the end I choose a simple salad. Honestly, I can't remember the name if the salad but I can assure you it was delicious. 
I am a really picky person when it comes to the salad dressing and that's the reason why I ordered it on the side. As you can imagine the dressing was very special. I've never had the pleasure to eat a salad sauce like that one. It was creamy but not too creamy, salty but not too salty, spicy but not too spicy. Overall I just want say; I enjoyed it a lot to have lunch at blue barn and I know you will enjoy it as well.
author: Hélène M.

description: This place offers various options to make your own salad. Everything tastes so fresh!!! I would recommend the spinach salad! It's a very tiny place, so be prepared to wait in line to order and find a table. It's located in the marina so after you eat you can walk around to shop!
author: Kat P.

description:
I would literally move to the Marina solely so that I could eat here more often. Rarely do I want to try everything on the menu at restaurants - whether it's fine dining, casual and quick, takeout, whatever - but I think I would enjoy every single item on the menu at Blue Barn if I had the time to try it.

I'm actually surprised at the complaints regarding service in some of these reviews. I've never had a problem here - not with the staff and not with an order. Blue Barn is one of the best go-to's I've found in the city and if they opened up a second location in Pac Heights, I wouldn't complain...
author: Sarah S.

description:
I hate salads.  In fact, salads are my angry food.  What is an angry food, you ask?  Well, it's a food that makes you pissed off when you're eating it (http://citymisadventures.wordpress.com/2010/07/23/angry-food-day/).

After a sweaty cardio dance class with my friend Jenny, we decided to add "dinner" to our post-workout plans, which originally was just "froyo."  Normally I'm not hungry after working out, but I didn't want J to starve, so we headed to Blue Barn in hopes of finding relatively healthy food so as not to completely negate our exercising.

I see Blue Barn as a more yuppie/trendy Pluto's, but at the same time, I haven't been to Pluto's since moving to San Francisco (the one I went to was in Palo Alto).  The inside of Blue Barn is incredibly cute, but it's incredibly cramped.  As rustic and thematic the big communal table is, I think they would best utilize the space if they'd put in a few small tables instead.

The line is long and doesn't move very quickly, and there were lots of people sitting and standing around waiting for their order around 7:30 PM on a Wednesday.  Maybe it was because it was the first warm day of the year?

I decided on the Detox salad ($9.25) because I wasn't hungry, and I felt like being moderately healthy so I could gorge on froyo later.  Despite not liking salad, I had to admit this was pretty good, not because I like shoveling leaves into my mouth, but because the red quinoa made for an interesting texture.  I also liked the slices of green apple, but the radish and scallions (or some other sort of onion) overpowered everything else.  Overall it was a good, light, refreshing option.

As a future resident of the area (for those of you who've read my review of my current residence, you'll know that I'm incredibly excited to get out of here next month), I'm glad to know that I've already found a go-to spot for healthy eating.
author: Tori S.

description:
Food is a 5, operation is a 0.  Watching my food sit on the counter for 10 min was awesome!  Especially since it was a hot sandwich and fries.  Looks like they prioritize the salad orders, as I saw people get there  10 min after me and get their food 10 min before me. 

 Next time I will just call my food order in when I get there, wait in line to pay(since depending on the employee, you have to wait in the regular line to pay for your take out order) and then it will be ask good!
author: Steve G.

description: Our favourite sandwich spot when we visited The City. Get the Truffle or try one of their grilled cheese sandwiches.
author: Nathan Q.

description:
- Nice atmosphere, clean with a friendly staff.
- $34 for two salads and two drinks and 15 minute wait for the salads. The salads weren't anything special or great but they were good, ordinary salads.
author: Kevin W.

description: Watch out for the rush when the nearby yoga classes let out as this place will quickly get filled with Marina girls in tights and sweat tops. But as for the salads, first rate ingredients and offerings you aren't going to find at just any make your own salad shop. I have a tendency to go a little crazy when left to figure things out myself so I went with their combo of the Detox salad with tofu. Really loved the combo of veggies and fruit. The colors were a fantastic blend that highlighted the interesting pairings of things such as the sweetness of the apples vis-a-vis the kale. Nom nom!
author: Stephen S.

description: Unbelievably tasteless salads.  Completely flavorless even though loaded with fresh ingredients
author: Seema L.

description:
Blue Barn is solid. My only complaint is that the Barn BLT (add avocado for perfection) is so good I don't want to order anything else off the menu. I am a sandwich man and this place does not disappoint. 

Like anywhere in San Francisco Blue Barn does get pretty busy and is a small space so plan accordingly. The line has not stopped me yet. 

Score!
author: Kyle B.

description: I always order the beets and greens salad and skirt sando.  The fries are pretty good too.
author: Michael L.

description: a place that reminds me of my dear Mendocino Farms from LA, but not quite the same. Delicious sandwiches but a 45min wait for two grilled cheeses on a weekend during lunch is quite sucky. About 10 seats total so be warned if you plan a lunch date you may need plan B.
author: Angela L.

description: Great sandwiches and equally nice salads. They're always happy to customize it for you. I really like their skirt sandwich!!
author: Pepper T.

description: One of the best soup, sandwich & salad joint in the Marina in my opinion.  Amazing grilled cheese selection to top it off - how can you not love this place?! It's a small place, so seating can be limited at times.  But if you are lucky enough, you will get to sit on Chestnut with a nice plate of fresh spicy tuna salad and a side of tomato basil soup, chatting away and people-watching.  An ideal hour on Chestnut, isn't it ;)
author: Lindsey O.

description:
I am OBSESSED with this spot. In all fairness, I want to give it a 3.5-4 star rating, but felt generous. The menu items are all AMAZING and they have unending selections of salads, sandwiches, grilled cheeses, and if that's not enough for you, there is a build-your-own salad bar. Really good quality ingredients - niman ranch bacon, cage free eggs, organic everything (including tofu!) AND the best discovery I just made: They have Blue Bottle coffee!!!! You order at the counter, give them your name, and if you are seated outside or at one of the tables inside, they will bring the food to you.

One should know that It is more of a quick take-out or stop-and-go sandwich joint, due to the limited seating. I love their new extended summer hours (open until 9pm), and how healthy their menu items are, BUT at the same time, they make everything so tasty! Their secret? They use great dressings (all organic, even their ketchup!), and sauces, but they do a lighter approach, so it doesn't give you a  heart attack. The salads are all dinner salad-sized - so you certainly have enough for more than one person. Soups change on a seasonal/daily basis. 

There is always a line out the door - given the quality of their food, the affordability, and the plethora of choices - so be prepared for a wait if you come on a nice day or during a popular lunch/dinner hour.  They are a small but quaint joint. Even non-salad eaters can be tricked into liking salads from here! Can't wait to try the grilled cheese next time!
author: Tammy H.

description:
Looks like any other cute little restaurant on Chestnut, but I'm a fan b/c it's not pretentious at all and the food is delish! I shared the Green Eggs sandwich (cage-free egg salad, mixed greens, roma tomatoes, red onions on sliced country levain) with a side salad (mixed greens w/ balsamic vinaigrette). Loooved it! The bread was lightly toasted, so that was a nice contrast with the soft, creaminess of the egg salad. I also liked how they put a little bit of egg salad on both slices on bread, then all the other stuff in the middle, instead of putting a huge glob of egg salad on one side because that usually results in spillage & a mess.

Good variety of salads, sammies, and best of all: grilled cheese sammies!!! Can't wait to go back and try other items.

Other random things to note besides the food:
*Cute seating, but very limited so don't plan on eating there unless your timing is just right or you have time to wait.
*Purse hooks underneath the counter - LOVE!!!
author: Miss H.

description:
coke in a bottle + the big cheese = a happy tummy!

I love this place and it turned out to be the perfect dinner spot before catching a movie at the presidio theater.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Definitely a solid ingredient sandwich. The cost is under 10 bones. They have a couple seats outside which is key for gorgeous days like the one we had today. 

I ordered the turkey sandwich which came with goat cheese and fresh turkey. I really liked it. It wasn't big enough to last me the day but I would def go back for a light lunch.
author: Michael S.

description: I have ordered soup to go here twice an each time I leave frustrated at the fact that I have had to wait 20 minutes for it come. Yes the soup is good here but the fact that it takes so long is really disappointing. I wouldn't recommend coming here on a lunch break or when you are in any type of time crunch....you will be late.
author: Nina H.

description:
JUMBO fresh salads.  

I'm in love with the Cobber.  Bacon, egg, chives, delish little tomatoes.  The ranch dressing tastes really fresh and dilly.  

I would rate 5 stars if:  
The dressing was a little thicker... its almost the consistency of half & half.  I would prefer the juicy cubed chicken to have a little more seasoning.  I would love a couple more pieces of focaccia thrown in.  The side they toss in is hardly bigger than the croutons.
author: FancyPant S.

description:
Next time you're in the Marina, do yourself a favour and grab a falafel sandwich at the Blue Barn Gourmet, it is the BOMB!

SO GOOD, I am truly disappointed to have discovered this place just when I am moving out of the area.

Really, its how a sandwich should be, indeed this is a falafel sandwich done right. There is nothing that is extra that gets in the way of your enjoyment of the falafel or the bread - the tahini, sprouts, etc only serve to enhance the overall taste.

I will definitely come back some time to sample their assortment of grilled cheese sandwiches and the roasted veggie

This is more of a salad place - I don't care much for salad, especially not when the sandwiches are so great!

Deducting a star for the fact that it didn't really feel very warm and/or friendly inside, so I just changed my order to go instead of eating it there - maybe I should try again ;)
author: Aditya S.

description: Dear Blue Barn - Please come to the 16th Street Mall in Denver. If you cannot, please give me your recipe for cheddar broccoli soup because it's the best I've ever had. Oh and your Cheddar grilled cheese sammie was to die for, but I bet you hear that all the time. Grilled to perfection w/oozing cheese and tangy mustard... I almost want to go back for dinner, but unfortunately have other plans. Seriously, think about Denver - I think we could have a deep and lasting relationship. Yours truly, A.
author: Alicia N.

description:
I like the concept (create your own salad, signature salads, Panini sandwiches in a quick service format with fresh, even gourmet ingredients like wakame, jicama, heirloom tomatoes, toasted corn, tofu, caramelized onions, roasted beets, feta, etc.). Order at the counter - make your own salad ($8.50, includes 6 toppings), choose one of their salads ($8 - 11), sandwiches ($7 - 9) or soups. They also sell drinks, cookies, and chips.  The takeout boxes are so cute (like Chinese takeout boxes).  

I had the Chinese chicken salad ($9.50).  It's a pretty salad with plenty of variety; they cut and julienne the carrots, crunchy soba noodles, almonds, scallions and romaine lettuce into small, even pieces and sprinkled sesame seeds on top.  The extra large, meal sized salad was crispy, crunchy and fresh.  It comes with a small piece of foccacia.  I didn't like the sweet and sour vinaigrette dressing though - it was too sweet (tasted like sweet hoisin sauce).  I wanted something more sour, light, and tangy.  The chicken was dry.  I think it would have been better with red onions, cilantro and a different dressing.  

Seating is limited and you may have to share the large communal table.  It does look like a barn inside with exposed beans and blue walls but in a rustic, charming way vs. a dirty, farm animal way.

If I found a dressing that I like, I'd give it four stars.  

P.S.  It's not a cheese shop.  They used to have a cheese case - it's gone now.
author: Lolia S.

description: I've never been to the place, but their sandwiches are good.  Had a rep bring us lunch and I was intrigued by the masala sandwich.  Curried chicken apple salad in a sandwich was a delight!  The sandwich wasn't too heavy, full of flavor, and by looking at the menu, only for $9.25 for such a good size.  My co-worker raved about her BLT.  Now, I'm gonna have to drag my hubby to this place soon!
author: Lisa W.

description:
I'm a fan of Blue Barn because the sandwiches that I have had there are good. The Rooster is the best of the lot in my opinion because it has the right blend of roasted chicken breast, bacon, avocado and tomato. 

What I don't like its the tremendously long wait that you have to endure to get your sandwich. Also though I get it that the names are supposed to be cute but really what warm blooded male is going to order a Hen or a Skirt even if the sandwiches are good? Just saying. And on the same point, this place definitely seems to be a "ladies hangout". During the lunch there is normally groups and groups of females eating there. Not sure why, is it because of the salads? or maybe they supporting the two lovely young misses that run the spot? who knows? who cares?

Back to the task at hand. Good sandwich spot and apparently good salads also. But I blacklisted this restaurant during lunch because its unacceptable to have to wait 25-30 mins just to get a sandwich! But it would be unfair to give this place less that 3 stars because the food is good.
author: Lenneal G.

description:
Not sure why original post not showing. Updating to repost it:

Horrible customer service!! I had a similar experience to another reviewer (Lisa M.) Had to wait 20 minutes for a sandwich, and then watched no less than TEN people who came in after me and placed to-go orders get their food before me. Pretentious sign that says "slow food takes time". You are just making salads and sandwiches!!! Get over yourselves - you are not hand-rolling pasta back there - ridiculous! And the manager was not friendly when I asked him to check on my sandwich - pulling out my receipt and showing him I had waited 20 minutes. No apology whatsoever. Shame, I had been excited to try the place and would have brought my family there when they come visit. Food was decent, but expensive. No side item comes with your sandwich, either.
author: Rebecca W.

description: My daughter and her friends love Blue Barn and recommended it when we visited. It's  a small place so it's crowded, but that's usually a good sign. They have an extensive menu of salads and sandwhiches. We will be sure to visit the next time we are in SF!
author: Pamela P.

description: Mix bag. My first time here I caught attitude from one of the employees. Other times however I've had good service so that was probably a fluke. Salads have always been fresh and served up fast, though if you're vegan you'll need to modify one of their listed salads or go completely custom. I typically don't end up with enough plant protein (I typically order a mediterranean but the amount of chickpeas is skimpy) and end up hungry an hour or two later.
author: Jeremy S.

description: I agree with Patsy K. the food is delicious, however customer service is severely below where it should be, especially for the cost of the food. I called in to place a larger order (over 5 items), spoke with Megan who informed me of the no phone orders over 5 items rule which I understand. However, I gave her the first 5 items and she said that I would have to call back, but they would likely not answer because they are too busy, which I found kind of a strange thing to say to a customer who is calling with a large order, and since she had already taken the first portion of my order and charged me for it. I attempted to call back for the next 20 minutes either the phone would just ring or go to a busy signal. I finally attempted to call from my cell phone which was answered immediately. I can only think that they likely screen their phone calls and when they saw on the caller ID that I was continuously calling back to place the second portion of my order decided to prove their point that they were too busy to answer my call. When I got through on my cell phone I again spoke to Megan who took the second part of my order and remembered speaking to me previously. The whole experience was extremely frustrating. Though the food is good the customer service really needs some work. I understand that if your busy you can get flustered or frustrated but like in any business customer service can make or break someone's decision to continue coming back. My experience today definitely made my decision...
author: M S.

description: Good food, terrible service. Good luck getting them on the phone anywhere near meal time for a takeout order. I've spent 20 mins just letting the phone ring thinking "there's no way they're not going to answer". Also, be ready to wait 20 minutes longer for your food than they tell you.
author: Alex N.

description: Is it normal to automatically charge a mandatory tip on To-Go orders?
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I love almost any place that rocks Blue Bottle Coffee. For the first time I tried drip coffee, I was wired to say the least. I'll stick to my Lattes. 

I'm a fan of the Sandwiches and Salads. I don't have one favorite. I seem to be trying something new off the menu every time I come here. 

I look forward to my next picking. 

HEADS UP: Long lines and no place to stand to wait comfortably.
author: Dee C.

description:
I literally eat here almost once a week and always order the Tostada salad. I think it might have crack in it, because I am seriously addicted. Ingredients are all super fresh and their dressings are very flavorful.

Additionally, their sandwiches are also really good, haven't tried their grilled cheeses yet but one of these days I will.
author: Tamara R.

description: I was shopping in the area and this place was the only restaurant during lunch that was packed. I ordered the Rooster, which was a spicy lime zest chicken sandwich on ciabatta bread with white cheddar cheese and avocado. It was pretty dee-lish and satisfying. It was $12 with no sides. The bread was fresh but a little tough, but I think that's with most ciabatta bread. There is seating outside and a few tables inside, but they were all taken by bros and yuppies. The place is really like a barn, in the most charming way possible. It's teeny. I managed to squeeze into the side bar seating which is where everyone lines up to order. It wasn't a big deal. I would recommend getting there when they open to secure a space outside. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, but if I'm in the area, I would happily return.
author: Kat R.

description: Big salads and good-sized sandwiches, lots of tasty options, on the pricey side though!
author: Krista R.

description:
I have wanted to try Blue Barn for a while, but was never in the mood for a sandwich or salad when I walked by. Again, I walked by then back tracked and decided to finally give it a try. 

The salads and sandwiches sounded really good and then I looked at the prices. $10 for a salad, really? And an additional $5 for mean? Seriously? I couldn't decide if I wanted to pay $15 for a salad or $10 for a sandwich . . . either way I would have felt ripped off. I went with the sandwich hoping to get full and not feel like an idiot for spending $15 for a salad. After ordering I was told it would be 10-15 minutes. Freakin' hell, it's only a sandwich. Were you butchering a pig back there for my bacon? The wait for a salad was just as long. There were at least 5 people working behind the counter and they couldn't even knock out a salad in a decent amount of time. My sandwich was ok, not worth $10 nor was it worth the wait. 

You Marina yuppies can have your overpriced salads and sandwiches, I won't be back.
author: Adelina W.

description:
Great gourmet deli and sandwich shop. They offer cheeses, cured meats,breads, salads and other selections that would make for a great party spread.  Got the Muffalata sandwich that has salami, ham, mortadella,fontiago, artichokes,and pepperoncini on ciabatta with a salami ring and candied cayenne pecans to go.

I was drooling over the grilled cheese panini selection and if I had more time I'd have eaten there.The staff were super friendly and said they had been open an hour.literally. Good thing I was wandering aimlessly killing time before going for drinks because this place is a little gem.
author: Kim N.

description:
While the layout is overcrowded and leaves something to be desired, the food here is incredible (albeit a bit spendy).

The tuna sandwich is my personal favorite, but the array of grilled cheeses are kind of to die for too.

A tostada salad with shrimp for $19 though? That seems a bit steep for a to-go lunch...
author: D S.

description:
Pros:
The best salads in the marina, as well as the amazing rooster sandwich.  Try the rooster, you won't regret it, then do your arteries a favor and get a staple salad you can eat every time.

Cons:
Can get pretty crowded/backed up.

Fun:
Bathroom is hidden upstairs and behind the counter, and they serve you water in moonshine jugs (that is unrelated to bathroom, in case that wasn't clear!)
author: Mike G.

description: Make sure you are okay to wait a little while, especially when it gets busy. Everything is super fresh and made to order. If you just wanna pick up a salad or something, call ahead of time, or order and then come back in like 15 minutes.
author: Amelia W.

description:
I am a carnivore. Blue Barn is a salad place. It is in the Marina. This combination could result is something bad... or at least very underwhelming. It couldn't be farther from the case. 

I visit Blue Barn once or twice a week to get my fix on great vegetables grown on local farms and to balance out my carnivorous ways of the weekend. Not only are they in touch with the "slow food" movement, they dole out some bountiful and hearty salads. No way you say? YES WAY!

All time fav, the FATTOUSH: romaine, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, scallions, chickpeas, nicoise olives, feta, mixed herbs, crispy pita & champagne-sumac vinaigrette.

Current seasonal fav, the SUMMER HEIRLOOM: mixed greens, farm heirloom tomatoes, basil, pinenuts, scallions, blue cheese, croutons & balsamic vinaigrette, bacon optional.

They even have some good looking sandwiches and grilled cheeses sandos. Imagine this, the BURRATA: heirloom tomatoes, fresh mozzarella burrata, arugula & pesto aioli on ciabatta roll, grilled chicken optional.

GET SOME! And get healthy doing it...
author: Al L.

description:
Organic, local farm ingredients are the stars of Blue Barn.  Adorable setting with barn trinkets, old oak wall paneling, & jam jars for water!  Each salad & sandwich is a classic Californian celebration of the finest produce in season.

++ | The Buddha |
Roasted bell peppers & portobello are literally dripping with juicy caramelized sweetness.  Also, watercress & cucumbers to provide a sharp contrast & there's a hearty helping of hummus to keep you full.

++ | Sheep Panini |
Narrow thin pressed panini that has a genuinely unique salty but sweet flavor from the manchego cheese, fig jam, & chorizo combination.  I'd recommend ordering a bowl of soup to go with this.

++ | Burrata Panini |
Generous slices of heirloom tomato with fresh mozzarella practically melting over arugula + pesto aioli.  Hot, toasty, & delicious.

Cheers for our consciencious Bay Area:
Sandwich = $9
author: Christina J.

description:
I ate the truffle turkey sandwich on Friday 12/13 and got FOOD POISONING. I have no doubt in my mind that it came from the sandwich because I had a slice of pepperoni pizza for lunch, some m&ms for a snack - and the Blue Barn truffle turkey sandwich for dinner. I woke up the next day sick as hell with severe stomach pain - and stayed that way for 36hrs. I just started feeling better on Sunday evening.  

BE CAREFUL - I wouldn't wish food poisoning on anyone so I'm giving you a heads up to avoid that sando at all costs.
author: Quinn N.

description: Hands down the best salads and sandwiches ever. You can always count on the fact that the ingredients will be fresh.
author: Niro D.

description: Sheep grilled cheese is ridiculous!!!! It's got chorizo sausage and a fig jam... The flavor combination is insane! Yum! Not the friendliest or the fastest... But food is delicious...
author: Jessica M.

description: Just went for the first time. Loved the menu and all the different salad and sandwich options. AND they have a build your own salad menu with TONS of options. Tried the Ragin Canjun and it was SO good! Everything we got tasted fresh and flavorful. Can't wait to come back!
author: Jena C.

description:
I wanted to give this place 4 stars but when I pay anywhere from $9-11 for a sandwich that I order at the counter, I really want it to come with something on the side, a salad perhaps or a few options to chose from.  

I will absolutely say their sandwiches are great.  From the bread to the meat to the ingredients in between, everything is top quality, fresh and natural. 

There are a few tables outside for nice weather, two inside and one community table where I usually end up sitting at with friends.

So when looking for a quick and bite and a great sandwich this is the place to go, and it's much better than a lot of the Chestnut options but just expect the sandwich on your plate and nothing more unless you order a side salad.
author: Inga W.

description: We don't live in the Marina but thanks to Postmates get it now.....Blue barn is now one of our favorites for organic salad delivery. These are MONSTER sized meal salads that definitely get you full! I have tried the Tostada, Cobbler, and Beet salad. Excited to try them all..... ;-)
author: Lee M.

description:
annoyed.  I want to like this place and sometimes I do, but there are just too many things that annoy me about this place.

1. outrageously overpriced.  seriously, there were 5 tomatoes (tops) in my salad.  Don't act like you're charging me for basket from the farmers market

2. you will ALWAYS wait.  no matter what.  for a long time.  and it's awkward because there is no where to go.

3. the staff look irritated at the fact that they have to take your order.  Newsflash- this is your job and you shouldn't have applied if you didn't like humans.

4. they've messed up my order the last few times and just forgotten ingredients.  Today they forgot two ingredients in my "make your own" salad.  annoying and unacceptable when you're charging me an arm a leg for lettuce.
author: liz g.

description:
Unfortunately, I was expecting more... (Sigh)

I'd heard such great things and I will definitely have to come back and try many more creations but sadly, I think I picked the wrong item (fattoush salad). While super healthy and wonderfully chopped, the olive tapinade or whatever was in there was *way* too dominant and just kinda ruined the experience for me. I also got a little bit of anxiety *praying* a spot would open up somewhere (for the love of gd!!!) by the time our order was ready. It's mostly community style seating, which is okay and all, but it is a bit anxiety inducing, especially post workout and tummy rumblings. 

Blue Barn, I will be back and will try more of your menu and will hope to fall in love with you. 

Moo...!
author: Meredith R.

description: Best spot for lunch on Chestnut, hands down. You can't go wrong with any of the salads or sandwiches on the menu. I especially love the Arugula salad and the spicy tuna --- amazing flavors and a great ambiance/location.
author: Julianne P.

description: Love the Chinese chicken salad, but it takes 30 mins to get it! Best advice: order by phone beforehand!
author: Heda J.

description:
Amazing Amazing. I can't just tell you this place has great salads and sandwiches, you have to experience it for yourself. 

I'll usually not opt for a salad but these ones are amazing. I've tried the tostada salad, and trust me, you won't feel like you're eating just a salad.

I've also had the brie sandwich (brie, arugula, green apple and red onions on a ciabatta roll). Great combination.

Can't say enough about this place. If you're thinking about trying it out, TRY IT OUT. Definitely worth it.
author: Ayesha I.

description:
Everything I have had here is great - even the HUGE rice crispy treat my boyfriend insisted on. The treat had a hint of lemon - such a nice surprise - and I will have to had some lemon next time I make my own. But about the main food - SUCH quality ingredients and large portions. I love making my own salads (well, the guy behind the counter does it for you) and adding as many sauteed mushrooms as I want - you can never have enough mushrooms. 

The only downside of this place is the small size, so there's usually a huge line of Lululemon-wearing Mom's and 20-somethings... it is the Marina, after all. But they do a great job at making the line move fast and the salad take-out containers look like huge chinese food boxes - so cute!

So good - I would come here a few times a week... if I could afford to eat out that often. But the portions are large, so it's worth the money.
author: Holly H.

description:
Probably best place to get salads in the Marina. 

BUT ooober expensive with protein options - Pretty sure at one point - my salad was $21. and I hate the wait!!

( variety of protein options - tuna, shrimp, chicken, steak, tofu, eggs etc )
All kinds of greens, veggies and croutons.
Love their chiptole dressing with the shrimp - my favorite combo.

But if you come during lunch or dinner time ( call ahead and order ) cos the wait is between 20-40mins.

They might just need a bigger space to accommodate the busy traffic to have happy salad eaters.
author: ThuZ W.

description: This place is good. I've come here twice, and had salads both times. They taste very healthy and the service is good. I would reccomend coming here for a healthy bite.
author: Madelon C.

description:
I have stood in line at Mixt Greens, and after one bite, I was ready to burn the place down for serving me crap.
I have stood in line at Ike's, and took off a definite 1.5-2 years off my expected lifespan due to the amount of butter they put on their sammiches.  I mean.... if I wanted unhealthy, I'd have gone for a burger!!
I've been to Pluto's that serves both sandwiches and salads - I was underwhelmed, at best.

I love salads and sandwiches - but to date, nothing comes close to Cafe Intermezzo in Berkeley for freshness, taste, and portions when it comes to salads and sandwiches.

Blue Barn nearly bumped Intermezzo off the list!

My girlfriend and I decided to go out to lunch and she recommended Blue Barn.  I trust her taste in food and we headed to the Marina.

We ordered a salad and a sandwich, and shared  the food.  For the salad, we ordered the Nicoise - - it was fresh, tasty with JUST enough dressing for taste, and even had artichoke hearts and potatoes!  Delicious!!
For the sandwich, we shared a provolone turkey.

HOLY SMOKES that was one fine sammich.... with toasted bread and a slight amount of butter..... beautifully melted cheese with thin but abundant slices of turkey....fresh tomatoes and the works.  The only thing I'd have liked to have is some sliced fresh jalapenos, and it'd be a meal of the gods.

Overall - the reason Intermezzo remains on the list is because it's healthier and cheaper.  Blue Barn is tastier and pricier, but it also doesn't require a drive to Berkeley.

After the meal, we went across the street for coffee (Starbucks or Peet's, take your pick), and chatted for hours.  A wonderful afternoon w/ my partner in crime!
author: Grace K.

description:
Amazing salads, friendly staff, great ingredients and if you like rice crispy treats at all these are the best ever!!!!!  I dream about them.

The salads are healthy and filling - and there are so many options!
author: Alexis B.

description: We had lunch he and the food was brilliant. The steak sandwich is one of the finest meals I've ever enjoyed. Loved this place.
author: Brett D.

description:
Upon first entering Blue Barn Gourmet I was shocked yet not so surprised to see that every single person here was eating a bowl of salad. Oh. My. Goodness. That's the Marina for you!! Pretty much only one guy was eating a sandwich...with fries!! Gasp.

I ended up following my heart and stomach and ordered the "Rooster" sandwich which was...DELICIOUS. Usually I'm a little apprehensive about shelling out money for sandwiches considering I could probably make most of them given the right ingredients. This one I could definitely not duplicate! There was this amazing sauce going on and the chicken was delicious! Throw in the extra bit of avo and a $2 side of fries and I was HOOKED!! 

The bf ordered the "Skirt" sandwich which was a little lighter on the sauce with a deliciously cooked steak sandwiched between ciabatta. The dijon mustard and arugula gave it a good kick and it seemed to be a pretty good choice too. I hate it when I have a bite of someone else's food only to discover that it's better than mine but am happy to announce that at this particular meal, this was not the case - the Rooster ruled!

With delicious food, a super relaxing ambiance (not to mention beautiful weather) and an incredibly nice staff (I'm serious!! The lady who took my order had amazingly white pearly whites that I noticed simply because she had the hugest smile!), Blue Barn Gourmet is now one of my favorite lunch spots in the Marina =).
author: Christina L.

description: I go to Blue Barn a lot, usually for take-out and the food is great. Last Saturday I was extremely disappointed by the service. The guy and the girl at the cashier were paying no attention to what was going on around them and were mostly busy chatting and joking around. I placed my order (a sandwich and a salad) and waited inside the shop. The guy passed by me a number of times so he should have noticed I was there for a while. I waited patiently since I know the food usually takes a while (10-15 min). No one ever called my name when my order was ready. 30+ minutes in, after noticing that people who ordered after me were receiving their food, I walked up to the girl and asked if my food was ready. It turned out my sandwich and salad have been sitting there for a while. Sandwich was cold. Worst of all was her reaction - she was distracted, rude and did not even try to apologize. It looked like working with customers was the last thing she wanted to do.  Very poor experience.
author: I T.

description: Addicted to these salads...they're definitely on the large side but not complaining. The Caesar is perfect (and comes with avocado which is awesome)!
author: Cate S.

description:
Blue barn has amazing grab and go food.  The salads are huge but my favorite thing on the menue is the turkey sandwich with goat cheese.  It comes on the perfect bread and literally melts in your mouth.  Hands down one of the best sandwiches in SF.

Be warned though, the wait can be really long.  I'd say it took a good 30  - 40 min to get our sandwiches last time.
author: Garrett D.

description: Rude rude rude staff! For eating here probably 5 days a week you would think if they messed up  your $15 dollar salad and filled it with wilted lettuce and rotten veggies they would comp your next meal but no! Be warned...Sadly I will probably still go there as it's convenient and fast if you call it in, but my advice to the owner, talk to your staff!
author: Sheridan G.

description:
This place is great! If you are luckily enough to find a seat, grab it! The salads are amazing and are huge portions.  I recently had the falafel sandwich and it was excellent, not greasy and full of flavor.  

Only downside is very limited seating.
author: Sarah H.

description: This place is not that close to my apartment, but I literally make the drive and search for parking (hard in that area of the marina and the lots are $$) because it is so yummy.  I've made my own salad and tried several of their combinations, and have liked them all.  I've also tried the mozzarella grilled cheese - yum!  Really can't go wrong as far as I can tell here.  It's really casual and I usually do takeout, so not sure what the setup is otherwise.  Order in advance (by phone) and you should be good to go!
author: Nicole D H.

description: My go-to sandwich spot. Get the Rooster or Steak sandwich, Everything is fresh, big portions. You may have to wait for a few, but it is well worth it.
author: Mike G.

description:
To my surprise, I actually really liked this place.

Chestnut is not where I normally roam around.  I seriously would love to do it more--- I am getting old, and the chaos in the Mission scares me now--- yet I am not all there in a life stage where I drink my triple nonfat latte in lululemon yoga pants...  Still, on a sunny Tuesday that I didn't have to work, Chestnut was one nice street to stroll along.

Here they serve salads the way they are served at Pluto.  Ah how I miss Pluto's.  And they have Blue Bottle coffee!  So after a grueling session of bikram, and before a groupon value massage, I enjoyed my coffee and salad while watching an episode of HIMYM on my iphone.  That's how simple happiness is obtained, at times.
author: Jiajia C.

description:
Loved Blue Barn. The food is all fresh, the atmosphere is comfy, and the employees were friendly.

The salads all looked amazing, although I only tried the Beets and Greens. It had beets, candied pecans, pears, pomegranate seeds, caramelized onions, goat cheese..... It was perfection.
author: K. D.

description: So freaking good! Best salads I have EVER had. I used to work in the area and would come almost every day regardless of the fact that they are a little pricey and they do take a long time to come out with the food so I always made sure to call in advance and place my order for pick up. One of my favorite restaurants in the city. They're sandwiches are great too.
author: V L.

description:
The turkey sando and fries here are on point. I will admit that it was quite a wait for the two on a Sunday afternoon, but it was well worth it!

My sandwich was nice and toasty; jammed packed with roasted turkey breast, goat cheese, sundried tomatoes and a lovely pesto aioli on a perfectly crunchy ciabatta roll.

The fries had a nice aroma to them, as if they were fried in truffle oil. I can't put my finger on exactly what the flavor is, but I liked how they were skinny, crispy, and not too greasy. The size reminds me of the McDonalds french fries that I try so hard to avoid.

I like the variety that is offered here and wish I could order a little bit of everything, just like a dim sum place! this spot is def worth coming back to and checking out again!!
author: Christina D.

description: Awesome salads and sandwiches! The staff are always looking quite attractive as well so I am a fan indeed! Great option for lunch or dinner. Quality portions with very high quality ingredients, win-win!
author: Ryan B.

description: An upgraded, gourmet Pluto's style eatery.  Primarily take away - not much seating.  My friend had a huge, colorful salad.  I got the sheep panini ~ manchego cheese, fig jam & ham (instead of chorizo) on country levain.  Grown up version of a grilled ham & cheese - mmm, mmm good!  I should have eaten only half but I gobbled up the entire sammie - good girl gone bad.
author: Kim S.

description: One of my favorite salads in the city. The food here is super yummy and always local and seasonal. It's a great place for a casual late lunch or early dinner after shopping.
author: Grace R.

description:
I Didn't see the Big hype. Nice place, first time there I looked at everything and wanted a healthy simple salad.. Told the girl this said i just want spinach, kale, and chicken. She cuts me off to say "i just need to know if you want protein".... I said yes, chicken as I just mentioned. "$12.75, just Tell them what you want when they call your name," she says. The "chef" looked at me like I'm some A-hole when I told her no dressing or anything else.
"just chicken?" 
"yes," I said, almost feeling ashamed to want something simple. 
I ate my $12 bowl of spinach and pinch of chicken quietly and left.  First and last visit to Blue Barn. Employees match the neighborhood stereotype well, no thanks.
author: Kelvin M.

description:
Delicious and nutritious! I love being able to "create my own" salad.. and it's big enough to fill me up! 

Tip: if you're planning to get your food to go, call ahead and order - that way, you won't have to hunt down sought-after parking on Chestnut.
author: Tiara H.

description: While the food is great, the service is horrible.  When ordering a salad, I should NEVER have to wait more than 5 minutes, 15 minutes is just plain crazy.  Hire more people to make salads.  And the staff that work the register are less than friendly.  I asked a gal the other day after ordering my salad why people who ordered after me received their salads first....response in a snarly tone: salads take 10-15 minutes to make.  No mention of why others were served before me.  Despite the horrible customer service, the salads offer great variety and taste good, so I'll continue to get my salad as they've got all the fixings I don't keep at home.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Once upon a time I loved this place but the service and quality has just taken such a dive I feel I need to modify my previous review.  My frustration has been building for some time now (I've been a regular since they opened) but as organic farm fresh take out is limited I have continued dining here and have bitten my tongue but I just cannot do it any longer.   

The short version:
Food: 4 stars
Price: 3 stars
Consistency: 2 stars
Customer Service: 0 stars! 

The longer version: 

The food is good because it's fresh and it's local.  Sadly, if you are ordering take-out, odds of you receiving everything you order are a crap-shoot and odds of the workers to give a hoot are even slimmer.  We get take out from here about once a week (again, not because we like patronizing them, but we like buying organic and don't always have time to cook) and frequently u-pick salads are missing an item, or it's the wrong salad, or they've run out of something major and don't tell us until the last minute.  (Tonight they ran out of salad. HA! Seriously, greens, the salad place ran out of mixed greens.  It's almost funny.)  What get's me is not that they ran out, but that when we went to pick up our order they were rather matter of fact, like it was no big deal that we came to pick up an order that doesn't exist.  An sincere apology for the inconvenience would've been better customer service in my opinion.  However, this is small potatoes compared to previous bad customer service experiences we've had in the past so here are a few of them finally written up.  I should've done this a long time ago.  


3 big ones.

1: Recently my mother-in-law was visiting to help with our new baby and she went to pick up some food for us.  I wrote an order down for her to bring (as no one was answering the phone after several attempts at calling) and when she tried to hand them the order, written on paper, they told her she needed  to fill out the paper provided by them.  She explained to them that she didn't have her glasses with her (she's 70 with bad eyes) and asked if they could fill it out for her and they said they were sorry she needed to fill it out.  She had to have another patron in the restaurant fill it out for her and when she turned it in, the cashier snidely thanked her for filling it out (as though she was capable from the get-go and decided to follow directions) upon which my mother-in-law said, "I didn't, like I said, I couldn't. I had to have another customer do it for me!"  
Seriously Blue Barn, you couldn't even help an old lady fill out an order form? A form that you're just going to input into a computer anyway?!? That was already on paper?! I'm mad that I ever went back to you after this! Shame on me for not taking the time to complain then.  If not for being overwhelmed with a new baby I certainly would have.

2.  While I was pregnant (7-8 months ago) I came in when it was not busy (I would not ask for modifications during rush hour, I know better) and asked for a sandwich I routinely get but asked them if they could heat up the meat because I was pregnant and couldn't have deli meat unless it had been heated.  They said they were sorry they couldn't make modifications even for health purposes.  I said I'd be thrilled if they could just throw it on the grill or toss it in a microwave ( While I'm not sure they have the latter I know that they have a grill) and they said sorry but no.  I'm just surprised given that I'm a regular, it wasn't busy and they have a grill that they put beef and chicken on they couldn't throw some cold cuts on the grill for me in my current state. Again, they just don't really give a damn about their customers.  

3:Dining in the restaurant once, my friend asked for extra dressing as her salad was done lightly.  As we were sitting in the establishment dining I was very surprised when the girl made us pay for the extra dressing.  I can understand charging if it's take out, but when you're dining in? That's just tacky.  

Blue barn, I'm done giving you money for over priced salads.  Not because of the cost, but because of your inconsistent service and seriously crappy attitude.  You're just not THAT good.
author: Rebecca S.

description: As you can read from all of my reviews, I'm vegetarian. Blue Barn is a vegetarian's dream come true. That may sound cheesy but the lettuce and veggies are always fresh which is not usually the case at other places where you can order a salad. They have quinoa and a nice diversity of veggies to choose from which again is not usual. Whole Foods is the only place I can say the same thing. Love this place!
author: Lisi G.

description: Love Blue Barn! Amazing salads and sandwiches. My favorite is the caprese sandwich - it's one of the best I've had. The only bummer is the wait time, but all good things come to those who wait right?
author: Christina S.

description:
Great salads. Great food. Great drink selection. Great service.

-1 star for the wait, it's a ridiculous amount of time you have to wait for you food 
-1 star for all the sweaty marina girls thinking it's okay to sit, eat, and stink right after working out. Seriously gross.
(to avoid this, try not to go here from hours of 6-9pm daily)
author: Honest Y.

description:
Since it was a lovely day in San Francisco, the boyfriend and I decided to grab a sandwich and enjoy a picnic lunch on the Marina Green. Although he's a die-hard for Lucca's, I finally convinced him into expanding his horizons. (Pulling the "it's my birthday weekend!" card didnt hurt either!)

We stepped in to Blue Barn Gourment- Note: This is NOT a place for a sit-down lunch! Seating is limited and rather cut-throat. 

After some serious consideration, I decided to order the Hen and he decided to order the Clubber. Although both were yummy...I was left a little disappointed. They SLATHERED on the mayo!!! I would have been happy with half the amount- and it still would have been moist and delish.
Additionally, my chicken tasted straight out of a Oscar-Meyer package...I thought I was going to get some good, rich deli meat!

We both agreed- we wouldn't order the Hen or Clubber again- but we probably will be back. Their salads (Chinese Chicken & Tostada) look FANTASTIC as well as the Rooster sammie.
author: Annalise F.

description:
Appearance: very small restaurant with a few bar stools lining the table at the window. There is a long table in the middle of the restaurant with few seats.  Hard wood floors, very clean. This is mostly a take-out sort of place.

Food: California type salads, sandwiches and soups. I have only been here once but I can't wait to go back. There are so many items that look good on the menu but I tried out their new seared ahi tuna salad. It's not on their online menu but you can find it on their menu in the restaurant. It was delicious and the ingredients were extremely fresh. The portions are very large. I've heard many good things about the "BEET" salad as well as the Chinese chicken salad.  What's great is you can substitute ingredients and also make your own type of salad. This is always a plus for me since I am a pescatarian and am always frustrated when I can't switch out ingredients on a menu. They sell a variety of drinks as well as beer. They have a few desserts (cookies, brownies and marshmallow treats) My friends and I shared a very large marshmallow treat; it had a hint of lemon in it and was delicious.

Customer Service: When my friends and I went this place was packed so the girl behind the counter seemed a little flustered but she took my order fast and efficiently and we received our salads within 5-7 minutes. While we were waiting for our food, another server was working hard to get the line moving along which I thought was very efficient.

Overall: great food but this place is always crowded so just expect to take your food to-go.
author: Whitney S.

description: Amazing salads. I love the seasonal winter salad.  The fries aren't worth the calories!  It's always a little crowded up front though and very little seating.
author: Sonya L.

description: Great sandwiches and gigantic salads. The girls are super friendly and keep their cool during the hectic lunch hours. If you can negotiate the convoy of Maclaren strollers and Chestnut street lunch crowds, you'll be rewarded with a great meal!
author: Dan B.

description: Yes a bit pricey, but the quality and taste are well worth it. They give you a great selection of healthy and tasty options. The bf and I split a salad and a cheese sandwhich with fries, and everything was fresh and tasty. Here is a place you can eat and not feel gross afterwards. Can't wait to go back again.
author: Misha Z.

description: I can't say enough about blue barn... I'm here at least three times a week, it is always delicious from start to finish! I call my order in and within 10-15 minutes I can pick up my beet salad! The gals are friendly and personable! You get an extremely large portion which could equal two meals.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Blue Barn Gourmet is adorable. Eating here is literally like eating at a little blue barn . . . except it's clean, with great food and on Chestnut street. 

My friend and I stopped at Blue Barn while walking down Chestnut (on our way to another sandwich place). I had never heard of it but she, being the foodie she is, recognized it from a NY Times article and said we must try it. I ordered the Tostada Salad and she got a panini of some kind. Both dishes were fresh and delicious. 

The atmosphere bumps this to five stars. I can't think of a place in the city that resembles this place on the inside. For the Marina, it's as original as the 40's served in brown paper bags at Bullit. Once again, I love to find places that are original :)
author: Lauren B.

description:
Not only did I eat every last bite of mine, but i woofed down my partner's leftovers, too!  I got the Rooster sandwich - YUM-0!!, and the Detox salad --true, it's a disgusting name but that,  too , was incredibly good --  and somehow the shredded kale and watermelon radishes made this salad remarkably more than just ok. And not to be gross, but my colon is still completely intact~ so maybe it just detoxed my soul... :-)
The sandwich was perfect... great roll, with dressing that made me feel not one bit bad about knowing i'll need to do 45 on the stairmaster to burn off.
Even if you're in the East Bay, this sweet little spot is totally worth the drive into the Marina.  I'ma goin' back to this one!!
author: Bikeit X.

description:
This is my favorite place to get my salad fix when I am in the Marina.  The food here is excellent - my favorite salad is the Fattoush (yummy crunchy pita chips, greens, chick peas, olives, lemon vinagarette! YUM!)

The sandwiches here are also pretty good too.  I usually get the bbq chicken sandwich - awesome sauce, perfect bread!  

I also want to mention the FABULOUS staff here.  They truly understand customer service and treat their customers the way they should be treated - with the utmost respect and are super sweet! 

I am a huge fan and will be coming back here again and again!
author: Cherlyn M.

description: I ordered the ragin cajun and while it was pretty good, it seemed to be a bit out of balance. There was way too much meat and the bread didn't contain the sandwich.. Most of the other reviews here are positive though so maybe I just chose the wrong sandwich.
author: Eric A.

description: This place really fell flat for me. I'm always looking for a good sandwich/salad place and I really haven't found one yet. The salad here was really bland. The lettuce wasn't very good quality and tasted too "watery" and wasn't flavorful (albeit, I know lettuce isn't THAT flavorful, but there was something off). I had the cobb salad, but the whole lettuce thing can apply to all the salads. I also tried the rooster sandwich on recommendation of the person taking my order, but that was just meh too. Good bread, but the sandwich was uninspired and wasn't high quality enough to make up for the lack of creativity. I wanted to like this place, but it just didn't taste good.
author: Victoria J.

description:
Went here for a late lunch on a weekday after a quick run by Crissy fields.  Was in dire need for something light and refreshing and luckily there was no line or wait for blue barn.

The Provo sandwich was amazing!  I think the provo cheese made all the difference!  The sandwich was the perfect amount of salty without being too greasy.  We also shared the spicy tuna salad.  The spicy tuna was almost nonexistent in the salad, but there was such an amazing generous portion of avocado; i still loved it!     

They also serve blue bottle coffee, and I had just a standard cup of regular coffee black.  It made me happy.
author: stephanie c.

description:
I had such high hopes for this place:  the reviews, the location, the menu, and the fact that it was such a sunny day today in San Francisco! 

I headed over to the Marina with a friend and though we found parking on the same street (that almost NEVER happens on Chestnut!) we did not have such luck with seating in the restaurant.

The line was out the door and there seemed to be confusion about the protocol of waiting for one of the limited number of tables. (The person in front of me tried waiting outside while the person she was with was in line to order - turns out someone else was waiting for that same table)

But despite the line, we stuck it out and ordered:
- detox salad (mixture of greens, green apple, carrots, quinoa and flax seeds)
- kickin-chicken sandwich (chicken, bbq sauce, bacon, carmelized onions, cheese, and slaw)

Overall the food was meh - I expected more.  The ingredients were fresh, but the salad lacked a lot of flavor.  And I know what you're thinking...I had the detox salad, BUT, I saw 3 other people asking for the salt to put on their salads...  And as for the sandwich, the bread was way to hard (like scratches your gums, hard!).

If next time I was in the area and there happened to be seats, I wouldn't be opposed to trying another salad...but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Alvina W.

description: A great gourmet sandwich. Maybe a little pricey but well worth it. Large enough to share. But get your own order of fries...you'll regret it otherwise!
author: Robin M.

description: The rooster is delicious if you're in the mood for a sandwich, if you're looking for a salad you're in heaven!  It is small and can sometimes take a little while to get you're food BUT as the sign says, real food is not fast.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
I absolutely love love love thier salads. 
Never could I say that I "crave" salads, but blue barn does such an awesome job at throwing together awesome, fresh ingredients. 
My go to salad: the Fattoush with chicken. The mix between the champagne vinaigrette, greens, chicken and pita chips makes my mouth water just thinking about it. 
And another great thing about blue barns salads are the portions! The salads are so big that I am able to get two meals out of it.!

One con: the wait. The space is pretty small, so when you are waiting, that place can get pretty cramped. So either order to go or call in ahead and pick up.
author: Jenn H.

description: Really fresh and yummi. Had a salad and a grilled cheese sandwich, which was heavy on the oil. Next time I'll ask them not to soak my bread in oil, and it will be perfect!
author: Karla B.

description:
Great salad menu, always smiling personal, healthy organic products, what else can you wish for?

The "U Pick" is fantastic option for you to build your own salad, own ingredients, dressing, proteins, anything you like, good staff!!

Going there again today for my delicious protein lunch!

They should franchise or open more locations..

cheers
author: Tomas J.

description:
Blue Barn salads are ab-fab, and their sammies are TDF (to die for) but it ain't cheap. (No five...five dollar....five dollar foot longs here folks). 

Fun activity -- grab a salad and take it into the Marina Movie Theater down the block. (Closest licquor store on Chestnut & Scott, if that's how you roll...'cause I sure do. That was me laughing hysterically at the facebook movie. Comedy!)
author: Christina C.

description:
I grabbed the "Buddha" - which is a veggie sando. Shrooms, bell peppers, sprouts, etc. Was pretty tasty. Can't wait to try the grilled cheese next time. 

Only reason I don't think it's "great", is because it took forever to get our food. I don't expect a direct correlation between elapsed time from order to reception of my comida, but if it takes a long time, it better be good :).
author: David N.

description: A bit on the pricey side for salads and sandwiches, but really darn good. The portions are pretty massive too, so I guess I can't complain. They have an amazing selection of grilled cheeses, great for a cold, foggy day, and a yummy selection of fresh salads-- my favorite is the spicy tuna salad. You can even create your own salad with their fresh ingredients. A great place to get something to go. There's very limited seating inside this place so good luck finding a spot during the busy lunch hour.
author: Ashley D.

description:
