Absolutely love this place!!! Really fresh and reasonably priced. I usually get their build your own salad or the Spicy Tuna salad. In my opinion, I think this place is better than Plutos. it does have a little less choices for salad toppings but they seem more healthier and fresher. 
The only reason I am not giving this place 5 stars is because 1) it takes FOREVER to order and get your food. The woman working usually Saturdays in the front with the short black hair, I swear she looks at me like I am an alien. And Ive noticed she does this to everyone. She is SUPER slow too. I work 4 blocks away so I call in and order and then go pick it up. and 2) multiple times when I have ordered the build your own salad I would get like small pieces of something I didnt order. For example last time I got a piece of candied pecan which is whatever to me because Im not allergic to nuts but it was REALLY suck for someone that is. I did call in and speak to the manager though and he said he will talk to his staff. Other than it takes 20-25mins to get your food, this place is really good and HEALTHY!!!
author: G O.

description:
Not many places in the Marina are delicious AND have great service, not to mention ALWAYS feel a bit crowded and over-hyped trendy (and pricey, of course).

BLUE BARN is a good balance.
Every SANDWICH I've had here is very good, from ham to chicken, to grilled cheeses, to the PB&J with blueberry jam.
BREAD is really hearty and meat and veggies seem fresh.

And FRIES that rival Micky D's...  and actually are still tasty-ish when re-heated, so rare in a potato product.

Staff is somewhat Marina unfriendly, but they always give you food with a friendly goodbye (maybe they are happy to see you leave?) and make sure you have everything, so good experience OVERALL.

SALADS follow Pluto's "pile on the toppings" concept, but since they run 'bout $4 pricier, I can't stomach it ($10 compared to Pluto's $6).
author: Bamboo T.

description:
Oh the Blue Bard...how I miss thee!  At the Blue Barn, all the sandwiches are made with love (or at least take long enough to create the illusion of love) and the staff is very attentive and kind.  The list of sandwich options is broad and wide and should have something more most anyone.  From veggie options to delicious chicken (I recommend the Rooster and Kickin' Chicken highly), I don't think there is anything on the menu that has been anything short of fantastic.  The Falafel is great in theory,  however, the bread choice creates an unusual balance that makes the sandwich a bit mushy.  I would recommend getting it with a crunchier bread (or crunchier falafel).

In addition, the grilled cheese options are quite awesome.  Crunchy, melty, and delicious, they epitomize what a grilled cheese should be.  Sadly the basil tomato soup that I sampled along with it left a bit to be desired.

Overall, for the best sandwich experience in SF, one must try Blue barn gourmet in the Marina.  Grilled to perfection with the freshest ingredients, it is a can't miss!
author: Adam M.

description:
During my two month sabatical I came here twice a week for their made-to-order salads. They don't skimp on their ingredients and they offer seasonal salad toppings that you can't find at other places. It's one thing to like what you eat..it's even better when you feel good about what you eat!
 If you want something more hearty, their paninis are damn amazing...and you can add an order of fries. The staff here greet me by my name and are always pleasant.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Today was the wait that broke Blue Barn's back.  I debated giving this place two stars, as its food almost serves as its saving grace (in the 3-4 star range), however, after further consideration, one star seemed more valid as I will never return to this place.  

Back to the point...

Problem #1: this place is setup as if it were going to be fast, however, it is begrudgingly slow!  After a few previous frustrating experiences, I took the liberty of timing them today, and it took no less than 18 minutes from the time I paid at the register until the time my to-go sandwich was ready.  Did they have to kill the chicken in the back?  What are they doing here?  This is what I have found myself asking each of the few times that I have visited this place.  I am ordering a (albeit good) relatively basic chicken sandwich for lunch...what could possibly make it take 18 minutes when the place isn't even that busy?  

Problem #2: I reiterate, everyone there must be taking slow pills, so even when the place is relatively not busy there is always a line of a few people, which will take 5-10 minutes to get through.

Problem #3: While you would think the snail's pace at which the place operates might lead to them being very detail-oriented or having some other redeeming quality, apparently it does not.  They often mess up little things such as today when they forgot to put dressing on my girlfriend's Chinese Chicken Salad...and since it was a to-go order, we didn't realize this until we were home.

Goodbye Blue Barn, and good luck continuing to exemplify an operational disaster.
author: Cameron D.

description:
My favorite place to eat in the Marina!

They have GREAT food, cute decor, and the staff is the friendliest I've ever encountered.

Favorite Salad: Beets and Greens, or make your own with grilled tofu
Favorite Sandwiches: Rooster, Kickin' Chicken, Holy Cow

They also serve Blue Bottle coffee

Avoid the Tostada Salad.... the dressing is way too spicy.
author: Julie V.

description: Out of this world amazing. The Truffle sandwich was sooo yummy! Definitely coming back!
author: Krista L.

description:
I'm obsessed with the food here. Tried the Buddha sandwich and the beet salad. All really good. The beet salad is extraordinary -- there's some ingredient (pomegranate?) that's taking it to another level, high up above all the other beet salads in the world. My friend had the Kickin' Chicken sandwich which he really liked (update 03.10.2010: his current favorite is the Rooster sandwich, followed by the Hen). On a different day we tried the Falafel sandwich and the Greek salad, which were not as exciting, so we're back to our usual Buddha, Rooster sandwiches and beet salad.

Really appreciate that the ingredients are organic. One of the three servers is very cheerful and friendly. And you can help yourself to all the hot water you want (if you often feel cold in S.F. you know what I mean). It closes too early, esp. on Fri-Sat at 7pm. (Fortunately Plant Organic is just across the street, and the Beautifull at 9th/Irving is open till 10pm daily.) Wish I live next door!
author: Yvonne C.

description:
Hands down, Blue Barn rules! Salad portions are HUGE and sandwiches are toasty warm and delicious! Yeah, the place is small but if you want good food, who cares!  I love the glass jugs they have as water containers. It just adds to the whole "barn-like" feel.  

You can build your own salad or pick one from their menu. I've only built my own salad here. They load up a huge bowl and are VERY generous with their toppings.

I've also tried their brie grilled cheese-- delicious! Only warning with it is eat it quickly because once it gets cold it's not as good. Their tomato soup is really good-- I got super lucky the last time I got it because shortly after I ordered mine they were sold out!
author: Eugenia G.

description: I guess i agrée with other reviews.. I liked my arugula salad but the artichokes were missing... :( :(
author: Jean-Elie K.

description: Great Salads and amazing employees. Cashiers are friendly and nice.
author: Miss M.

description:
We were looking for  place like Intermezzo in Berkeley but in SF... so we found this place via YELP - and it's nearby our house. Yay :) 

I had the Chinese chicken. He has the Beats and greens. Very generous serving and very tasty. What I thought was super grubbin was the Burata grilled cheese sando we had to share. There was something very cracky and delish about it. I will be back just for one of those. 

Service was quick and I noticed that you can call it in for a quick "drive by" pick up if needed. 

The girl who handed me my food and bagged it up seemed to be a bit grumpy- but may be she was just having a bad day. Like I said before, I will be back.
author: Tara M.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to go for a delicious tasting healthy meal in the Marina.  I've tried the Nicoise and Tostada salads, both of which are amazing.  They're packed with fresh greens and vegetables, and lightly dressed with flavorful vinaigrettes which make you feel like you've just consumed something that's really good for your body.  The skirt sando is also tasty.  Tender slices of grilled skirt steak, paired with carmelized onions, chunks of blue cheese and a kicky horseradish dijon mustard - a sando combo that is guaranteed to delight!

Add a star for serving Blue Bottle coffee ~ I love it!
author: Janet L.

description:
Such a delicious, huge salad. However, not knowing this place literally gets mobbed, I stupidly brought two out-of-town lady Sailors here for lunch. Had to drop that they were military (thank you, Memorial Day) after a Marina snob put up a fight for the table we were waiting for. Even after her boyfriend graciously made room for us.

Seems like they should have some system for seating.

But that aside, I'll definitely be back for pick-up. This would make a great spot to catch up with a friend, post-workout, too.
author: Kerry D.

description: Tried this place for lunch today when working in the area, BIG mistake going around lunch time. It's was packed. I ordered right away but had to wait 25min for soup and salad Togo! The salad I got was huge! I will be eating that for the next few meals, very every good, however a bit over priced for not having any meat in the salads, I had to pay extra to add chicken. I also tried their soup of the day, potato leak, very savory and delicious. I would definitely go back when I had time sit and enjoy, not on a short time crunch, or order ahead. Overall it's a bit overpriced for the service that you receive but a nice fresh lunch to share or splurge on.
author: Jazmin S.

description:
Beat by KQN again! How does he do it? At least his review was on their 1st day of opening.

Rustic charm meets gourmet eatery on Chestnut St. A little dysfunctional being day one and all. Just had a sausage stick to go BUT will be back tomorrow for a real taste!

update:

Finally got lunch here. I did a "You Pick Salad" with the mixed greens and a little baby spinach. Ingredients were: cucumber, shredded carrots, diced cherry tomatoes, roasted peppers, sun-dried tomatoes, diced roasted beets, eggs with the sushi ginger vinagrette. It was freshly made right in front of you.

The "acid-test" for me will be tomorrow night when I bring home a Nicoise salad for my wife.
author: Ed L.

description: My go-to for lunch or dinner. Love the custom salad options. There's often a little bit of a wait, but you won't be bored since you can check out all the beautiful people that go there.
author: K C.

description: Always a great experience here. And possibly the best fries. Yes, anywhere. Slightly crowded and cramped, though. My regular order: Kickin' Chicken no bacon, fries, Mexican Coke.
author: Farooq J.

description:
The last time I was here I sat at one of the tables outside. Next to me was a youngish couple with a small child just starting to walk. This kid was not shy! He tottered over and smiled at me like he wanted some of my tostada salad. Then he tottered over to an empty chair next to me and began banging on the seat as if it were a large drum. It was pretty funny, once he found that empty seat/drum his parents pulled him away. As soon as they thought he was under control, he returned to the seat/drum. It made for an amusing, although distracting, lunch. 

My favorite thing to order here is the tostada salad. I like it because it's a hearty, vegetarian salad. They have Blue Bottle Coffee, although I don't usually pair that with the salad. 

Also, they support local agriculture by being CSA (Community Supported Agriculture) produce box distributers.
author: Lauren Lynn L.

description:
Really cool sandwice place in the Marina. This is the gourmet sandwich style place, trendy, high-quality meats, good bread, very small sandwiches. 

I came here after Bay 2 Breakers with a bunch of girls, and they all seemed to be even bigger fans than I am.

I've been told they have great salads, but let's be honest 200 pound men don't eat Salads, even in the Marina.
author: Devin K.

description: LOVE!!!!!!!!  I wish I could eat here for lunch every day!  And I would if I lived closer!  Ordered the Fattoush salad today and nixed the feta and added some grilled shrimp. Amazing...I told my hubby I would never try anything else on the menu because I enjoyed this salad so much; that was, until I saw and tried his salad: the Spicy Tuna Salad. There is no mayo (thank god); lots of greens and a gigantic scoop of spicy tuna, with some crisp soba noodles, mango, and avocado. Next time I'm trying that. Highly recommend this place :) It is a tiny place and somewhat slow, so go early and be patient.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Yes it is on the expensive side, and yes the wait is sometimes long, and yes there isn't much seating but the food is so good that Blue Barn still deserves a full 5 stars.  I usually go for the U-Pick salad and order by phone so the salad is waiting for me.

This is easily one of the best salads in the city.
author: Denis G.

description:
I was told to go to this place, I finally got a chance to go.  Went there with me gf for a quick dinner before movie started.  We both shared Brie sandwich, Tostada salad with steak and fries.  
That sandwich was dam good!  It wasn't a huge sandwich, it had ham, brie cheese, but it was GOOD!  Tostada was good too, loved the dressing, and the fries were awesome too. Fries were fresh and light. 
Definitely good place to eat.
author: Peter L.

description:
This place is known for their sandwiches. My sister and I got 2 sandwiches (smoked salmon and beef) and the detox salad (just went to a spa to get a detox wrap so it seemed fitting). The salad was huge and the sandwiches, although it was normal size, was very filling. Tried their  hot apple cider, which was good but too sweet for my taste.

There is limited seating (there are some tables outside) so either to go it or eat on the go (many shops nearby).
author: Tif L.

description: Pretty decent sandwich/salad spot. Everything was fresh and the pressed bread made the sandwich. I had the gobbler (turkey cranberry) and it was tasty yet interesting. Some of the ingredients aren't what you'd expect, but it works. The tomato soup was a little bland - wouldn't get it again. The salads look healthy and you can mix and match whatever you want. Overall i'd go here again, probably if I wanted something to go. It's pretty small and busy inside with awkward congested tables.
author: Nate S.

description:
Skirt steak sandwich was perfect. Had one similar in the past and it brought back good memories. Had some out of towners with me and they thoroughly enjoyed their sandwiches as well. 

Great lunch spot in the heart of the Marina. May have to wait about ~10 minutes to order and another ~15 for food to arrive if it's a typical busy weekend. Well worth the wait.
author: Nelson C.

description:
Sandwiches --especially the grilled cheese-- are delicious, but the feeling of the $10 leaving your pocket is sort of sad. If you like salads, Plutos (just down the street) is half as much and just as tasty.

Helpful tip: to avoid the long lines that sometimes exit the store (and the long waits), call your order in ahead of time for pick-up.
author: Kelly B.

description: OK, they got the "barn" part right, and the fries and ketchup are good. Sandwich was not good. Clubber made with soggy tasteless tomatoes (why even put them on the sandwich??), three pieces of packaged pepper jack that was glued together and cold, sliced deli chicken breast, also cold and wet, and cold bacon! Wow, I want to go eat where all the other reviewers are eating. Service was friendly, but no way was my lunch worth $15 (included a nice tip). Maybe go back to try the salads, but very disappointed.
author: Linda B.

description:
Blue Barn does not disappoint. This is my go-to place for an amazing salad, panini, or some yummy fries! We typically order the Chinese Chicken Salad...which, unless you are starving - is definitely enough to split! All of the ingredients are super fresh, and I've never had a funny tasting bite of chicken. 

If you're feeling a little something sweet - their chocolate chip cookies are delicious...need more? Try Susie Cakes next door to take your sweet tooth to the next level!
author: Michelle N.

description: Blue Barn is so good it should have a bigger place to accommodate all the loyal customers who come to get a healthy/delicious meal from them. Seating is limited, but I usually get my order to go since I work in the neighborhood. Though the pricing is a bit high, you're paying for quality and service. Now, if only they would expand their franchise, more people would benefit from eating such good food!
author: Sher D.

description: Very good food however the space is quite confined and the line is long. In addition, the salads can be too complex but the grillednurses are to for for.
author: Matt H.

description:
There are three things you can count on when you go to Blue Barn:

1. If you bring a girl, she'll say, "This place is cuuute."
2. The food is really good and fresh, especially the Buratta. 
3. You'll enjoy sitting outside and watching people do what they do in the Marina: go to the gym, walk dogs, look good. 

Good spot for a sandwich or salad for Marina prices (about $10).
author: Mike D.

description:
OK, so I don't normally shop/eat at places with "barn" in the name, but I made an exception and am so glad I did! Blue Barn's food is delicious, and the sandwiches and salads are both creative and seasonally appropriate.

Only 4 Stars because the price-to-portion amount is somewhat off kilter IMHO.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
The salad just tasted okay.  We ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad. Huge portions but I find the dressing lacking in flavor and it doesnt pack a punch.  I asked for dressing on the side.  It was about $9.

There is a communal table area and two high tables with bar stools.  

They dont have a very diverse selection of soup but the sandwiches and grilled panini's look good. 

The decor definitely reminds you being at a barn!
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I love those "make your own" salad places, but this place takes the cake (or salad topping of your choice).
Fresh, gourmet ingredients.  Amazing dressings.  For protein I had the roasted chicken and my friend had the falafel.  Both were cooked excellently.  Chicken = moist and not dry! Falafel = crispy outside, flavorful inside.  Well done, blue barn!
author: Irene K.

description:
Used to be a fan but the quality and consistency has steadily decreased to the point that the name should be changed to Blue Barn No-way.

I was looking forward to a nice chicken sando after my 6 mile run but it turned out to be one of the worst ever.  I ordered the rooster and it was doused in chipotle mayo. I spent 10 minutes trying to remove as much mayo as possible -- which had infiltrated every layer. Despite my efforts and my growing hunger, I could only stomach half  -- and there wasn't one moment of enjoyment during that process.

I will never go back.
author: Maria R.

description:
I have to say I come here all the time since I live nearby, however I may need to consider an alternative healthy lunch choice. I arrived 5 minutes after they opened at 11AM and waited 25 minutes to get a simple salad because they had so many phone orders and there were 3 people ahead of me in line. 

There are several girls who work the register and pretty much all but one of them have a major attitude and act like you are bothering them. The woman making the salad never has a smile on her face, looks depressed, and after she makes the salad, while you are there staring at her,  will refuse to actually hand you the salad. Instead, you must wait until the person at the register finishes handling their transactions and phone orders. Then, that person hands you the salad.

I guess they have their rationale as to how they do things, however if it's busy and people are standing around, I feel they should just hand you your food so you can get out of there.
The food is healthy and I like their salads, but sometimes this place is ridiculous with the wait, and amount of phone orders. Also, I have a baby and a stroller and there is absolutely no room in the restaurant to hang out and wait a while if it's crowded.
author: Kimberly C.

description: Solid salads, tasty, always fresh. Wish the service could be a little faster and this place is definitely on the pricey side, but it always hits the spot. Wish they could take Amex too, but I'm not gonna stop going here anytime soon.
author: Tina U.

description:
I miss this place. The last time I was here I had a beet salad. I always say that a salad is never filling however this was an exception. 

1. It was gi-normous!
2. Lightly dressed and tossed. Evenly distributed. Sweet with a hint of sourness from the vinegar. 
3. Beets. Yum!
4. Fresh. 
5. Tasty!
 
However it still is only a salad. 4 stars
author: Chen D.

description:
Going to school at UC Davis for 4 years made me Pluto's # 1 fan. I will go out of my way to pick up a delicious Pluto's salad in the city....however, my friends and I decided to try Blue Barn after a kick ass yoga class at Aha. Something new. 

I created my own salad and it was absolutely delicious. The avocado was fresh and the grilled shrimp was tasty. I really love the topping selection at Blue Barn as well, as they have some creative ones such as caramelized onions and pita chip toppings. 

But. $15? I know I got shrimp, but come on. 

Though I enjoyed my salad at Blue Barn, I did not enjoy the price. Perhaps, once in a while, if I'm in the mood for some fancy grilled shrimp atop my salad, I will come here. But my heart still belongs to Pluto's and their delicious homemade ginormous croutons and fabulous balsamic vinaigrette.
author: Laura D.

description:
Atmosphere here is cute, kinda like a barn, hence the restaurant's name. Decor is very mid-west feel. The staff is a pleasant bunch. 

The Paninis here are the greatest toasted sandwiches my mouth has ever consumed. I believed I've had every single of their paninis and a few of their 'Sandos' which you can request to be toasted extra long for the panini taste. 

I've had not had any of their salads but my co-workers seem to like them. 

Only reason for not giving 5 stars? The prices are steep. 'Marina' prices. $8 and up for a sandwich is not what I would like to put my paycheck in every day for lunch. 

Will I come back again? Of course.
author: Dee T.

description: Full range of salads and sandwiches, including an extensive menu of grilled cheese selections. I hit up this place every time I'm on Chestnut Street during the weekends. It sometimes takes a while to get your food, but it's worth the wait!
author: Amanda R.

description: The owner is a total Jerk, the food is not great at all but the staff is nice and hardworking. I watched the manager/owner lose it out in front one day, WHAT A FREAKING JERK!!!
author: Jim B.

description:
Two words: grilled cheese.

My friend Dave and I each had a grilled sandwich and shared--the Swiss and the Sheep. Rave reviews for both sandwiches.

The Sheep features an originally Spanish manchego cheese, mild chorizo and fig jam. Dave is going through a fig fetish and loved this--the bread was browned just right and buttery, and the fig jam wasn't too overpowering. I personally felt like I couldn't taste the chorizo enough, but that may just have been my inner Muslim rebel wanting to revel in the explosion of porky sin on my tastebuds.

Moving on to more halal/kosher Semitic delights, the Swiss sandwich was the heartier of the two and included sauteed onions, two types of cheese (Jarlsburg & Gruyere), mustard and pastrami, all adding up to one fierce reuben-evocative sandwich. It also went better with the tomato soup, which we both ordered.

My favorite part of the soup was the crunch of the green spring onion that was cut up into it--and not just as garnish either, it was more part of the dish. Although we took our food to go down to the Marina, the soup was lukewarm at best. Says Dave:

"while i am not particularly intimately familiar with the thermodynamics of tomato soup, i submit that either tomato soup has a generally flakey specific heat or the original temperature simply wasn't that hot"

Also lukewarm: the staff. I agree with other reviewers on their service critique, but I thought there was something refreshing about a California barn employee that didn't hee and haw at their customers.
author: Liane G.

description:
I love the philosophy driving this business.  They support local farmers and offer organic produce.  

Great salads and sandwiches at this casual little spot.  You can make your own salad or order off of the menu.  One really can't go wrong with any of the salads but the Fattoush salad is my favorite.  The Burrata Grilled Cheese is so warm and gooey however if you are feeling like something meaty the skirt steak is also super yummy! 

You can eat there at one of the high tables or take it to go and devour your healthy meal at home.  But make sure you don't pass it by!
author: moodyfoodie m.

description:
I've been going here regularly for over  a year and it just keeps going downhill. Every 3rd or 4th salad I get is excellent so that's what has kept me coming back. But the seasonal salad I ordered last night for $11 had so few ingredients in it! I felt like I was eating mixed greens and dressing - that's it.

Very dissapointing. Also, I think the To Go orders are never as good as Eat In, which they need to change since so much of their business is folks going to the gym and stopping there for salads to take home.
author: Heather W.

description: Excellent spot in the marina to grab a quick and healthy snack or meal. The tomato soup is delicious although a little pricey for the size that you get. I have tried most of the salads and all are delicious and uniquely different which is great if you get tired of the same old thing. All of the other reviews rave about the grilled cheese so that will be up next to try. Blue barn is opening soon on Polk street as well!!! Bravo!!
author: Brooke B.

description: One of my favorite quick lunch spots in the city. Owned by the same family as Sonoma's Oak Hill Farms, they use local, seasonal, and organic ingredients. The menu is comprised of high quality soups, salads and sandwiches that will be sure to be an organic party in your mouth. Almost everything on the menu is less than $10. I highly recommend the Fattoush and Heirloom salads as well as the Rooster sandwich and the Burrata panini. Blue Bottle coffee also brewed fresh upon ordering.
author: Jasmyn M.

description:
The girls and I are big fans of Blue Barn. I really like:

The Nicoise- lots of goodies to pick out of the salad, baby potatoes, fresh tuna, goat cheese, squash, olives, artichokes. Comes topped with an excellent mustard vinaigrette that compliments all these flavors.

The Blue Barn BLT- heirloom tomatoes, goat cheese, bacon, arugula on toasted ciabatta bread, I looooove this salad- so yummy!

The Rooster- chicken breast, bacon, avocado, scallion and a creamy spicy chipotle sauce on toasted ciabatta. I love anything with lots of "sauce", this one hits the spot with wonderful flavors and fresh ingrediants.

I will admit it's a little on the pricy side for a sandwich/salad place but it's well worth it and I never leave hungry or bummed for paying those prices.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Good food.  Sandwiches are great. Soup is very good. Salads are fine...fresh ingredients and delicious, just nothing to write home about.

The decor is fun, I like the big communal table even though I've never really felt the urge to meet my neighbor.

It isn't cheap.  As a matter of fact, it is rather expensive for salads and sandos. But, you do get what you pay for here as it is all quality.

I'll have to go a few more times and branch out from the usual before I give it five stars.
author: Nicole P.

description:
I really should have ordered the spinach salad I was craving, because maybe then I'd be giving this place four stars. 

It's a bus ride away from my cozy (read: boring) ParkMerced apartment -- a long, loud 30-minute bus ride. So, upon getting there, I expected, well, a barn. What I saw was more like a house with farmyard fixings. But it wouldn't be fair for me to judge it on its atmosphere alone, would it?

The falafel sandwich we ordered was, well, average. It wasn't anything special and I probably ordered the wrong thing but reading Yelpers' input beforehand, I felt I could've ordered anything and it would've been good. So very undeserved, the hype.

I won't be back unless I'm craving a salad ... but then, that's what places like the Plant Cafe are for. Or the nearest local café.
author: Amy S.

description: I decided to try blue barn for lunch the second it opened having read of the long lines. I got the rooster sandwich which is marinated chicken, bacon, avocado, white cheddar, chipotle aoli on a ciabatta roll. To start the place is very small. I couldn't imagine sitting in for a meal. They have several good sandwich and salad options along with a few beer/beverage choices. I appreciate all the fresh ingredients but to me the sandwich just fell flat. I think u could put bacon and avocado on any sandwich and I wold love it! Though this one seemed over the top on ingredients leaving me wondering if there was any chicken inside. The chipotle mayo is pretty darn spicy too. Overall the food was ok, nothing I couldn't make myself at home with some fresh ingredients. Perhaps blue barn would be a 4 star review in small town USA but around here, I guess I am looking for a little more creativity.  I might stop by again if I need something in a pinch bug not on the top of my list for sandwich options in this foodie area. 3 stars for quality ingredients and location
author: Mark N.

description: I am so torn. This place is one of my favorite lunch spots to go to so naturally I should give it five stars. But my lord is it expensive. I lived in NYC for 5+ years and never once paid 10 bucks for a salad. Are they good? OF COURSE. They have a wide selection of salads + a make your own salad that you can add a protein ( steak is my favorite)  But the price is so prohibitive, but if yoga pants wearing marina moms will pay 10 bucks for a salad i guess i have to too.   Also the sandwiches are very good. Everything is good to even great.
author: douglas B.

description:
The sandos and salads at Blue Barn are healthy and delicious.  I live down the street and order out here 2-3 times a week.  I am a big fan of the rooster, hen, kickin chicken sandwiches and nicoise, tostada salads.  They also have pick your own salad and some grilled cheese sandos that are next on my list to try.  The line can get a little long at lunch and dinner times but it moves quickly and you can always call ahead and order to bypass the wait.  
They just opened 2 new restaurants on Polk St. and the Towne Center in Corte Madera.
author: Brian S.

description:
Came here for lunch at Blue Barn on a beautiful sunny Sunday afternoon. I had the beets & green salad which was refreshing, light and delicous! Also had a bite of the PB&J which was also tasty! Lots of other good stuff on the menu I can't wait to come back and try.

Come here if you're looking for a healthy meal & to support local farmers. Two thumbs up.
author: Mai N.

description:
There are very few things I miss about the marina, having moved out of frat-row a year ago.  Blue Barn is one of them.  

They have wonderfully huge tasty salads (the beet salad is my fav).  And great coffee!  Mmmm Blue Bottle...  The girls who work the counter are always pleasant.  I use to go here fairly regularly and never left with one complaint (aside from the obvious - that it's in the marina).  I really really miss living so close to this place.  Please open another location in Hayes Valley!!!
author: Nicole K.

description:
Marina- you now have 3 (that I know of) healthy salad restaurant type things in your district- wouldja share a little with the rest of the hoods???

A must have stop pre or post stroll on the marina green- grab a salad (dont' forget a fork too, they past few times I've been, they don't pack you one), and walk straight down to the Marina to enjoy your score waterfront.

Note to Blue Barn: Can you guys figure some system (perhaps a rope) to separate those waiting to order and those waiting to pick up? Sweet geez it's confusing in there during peak time
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Delicious salad with fresh ingredients including underrated items like scallions and pumpkin seeds.
author: Susan V.

description: The food is excellent. absolutely fresh and delicious. the service though...it makes me not want to go. Everytime I order the people that work their are acting annoyed I am ordering. Or when I asked for a sample of soup, like I have killed a small kitten. It just makes me not want to go to this place. I really think they need to get happy employees that aren't rude to customers.
author: Jen B.

description:
Very Cute Barn looking decor and architecture (apparently I am discovering and embracing my inner farm girl these days.) Blue bottle coffee, great drink selection, friendly service. Very small!!
Salads are a good portion and are made up of fresh ingredients. I had the Spicy Tuna salad, which was a special of the day. Spicy tuna, avocados and other delicious Asian touches. yum yum yum! 
The grilled cheese sandwiches look good, and will have to try one one of these days.
Draw backs, prices are hefty for salad and sandwiches, the wait can be pretty long and there is limited seating. There is a few tables outside on the sidewalk, however here is not heater for those chilly SF days. Plan to take out may be he best option during bus fooding hours. Also don't plan to spend a great deal of time choppin' it up with you meal mates as you may get the stink eye from those who are eyeballin' your table.
The other draw back, and I know this can not be helped and is truly a personal opinion, but location. Chestnut street is a bit of a nightmare, and if you plan to come on a Weekend afternoon, plan to wear your yoga pants with stylish accessories, with your hair done and makeup perfected. he food decor, employees and general ambiance is all very cool, but the clientele is very indicative of the neighborhood. 
So if you happen o find yourself in the Marina, are not pressed for time, are craving a fresh salad or sandwich and have some some money to spend, Blue Barn is a great option.
author: Kelle K.

description:
Blue Barn is a favorite stop of mine when I'm down in the marina running around doing errands. The salads are hearty and filling. You pick one off the menu or make one yourself which is what I always do.  There isn't anything fancy about it just a good stop for salads and sandwiches. 

The service is good. You just order at the register and then pray for a seat (its a tight area).  Luckly seating turnover is pretty quick so I've never waited more than 10 minutes for a seat.  Usually by the time my food comes I've managed to find somewhere to sit.
author: Yelper S F.

description: Hooray for healthy delicious food...everything is great here...everything. I love the build your own salad with the ahi tuna.  Expensive but I think it is worth it.
author: Nilu r.

description: A little pricey, but delicious. The wait can be a while, but again, its worth it. The skirt sandwich is phenomenal, and the tomato and motz sam is amazing as well.
author: John C.

description: I need to order the Rooster sandwich the next time I come.  My dining partner ordered this the other day when we came and it RULED!  Chipotle aioli?  Count me in!!!
author: Nora S.

description: There are days that I want a salad...then there are days that I want a salad in a huge Chinese food to-go container.  When I mean huge, I mean its a large enough salad to feed a litter of rabbits or a growing guy like me.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Everything is fresh and their dressings are excellent.  My go to salad is the Cobber salad...chicken, avocado, eggs, lettuce, tomatoes, bacon and ranch dressing.  My co-workers are in love with the selection of grilled cheese sandwiches they have available and I've been eying the chocolate chip cookies and rice krispy treat squares, but haven't stepped up to the plate to try them out...although they do look delicious.  The dining room is fairly small but it's a great spot for lunch and take out!  Definitely a must if you are looking for something pretty healthy to eat in the Marina.
author: Joel C.

description: My favorite salad place in SF.  My bf is addicted to their tostada chicken salad and orders it twice a week!  Their chicken panini isn't bad either!
author: Candice L.

description:
Throwing a bunch of food in a bowl does not make a salad. Poor quality ingredients and a lack of care coupled with over-inflated prices make for a terrible experience.

The sandwich was alright but not worth more than a few bucks; certainly not the 9 I was charged for a simple grilled cheese.
author: Mirto H.

description:
The other night we were going to see a movie ("I love you, man" was a lot of fun) at the Marina Theater. After getting parking easily and buying candy at the Walgreens, the age old of question of what to do about dinner reared its ugly head.

When you're going to a movie, the movie takes priority over a decent meal. And, in the Marina, the food establishments catering to the post-fraternity brother and sorority sister clientele don't really understand this very well. The relaxed pace starts when you stand around waiting to be helped. We've walked out of numerous places.

Enter: the Blue Barn Gourmet

We'd passed by the place on another movie excursion, but had been packed to the point where we couldn't see what all he hoopla was about. When we passed by a couple of nights ago, we saw a couple of people and some seats. Decided to give it a try after realizing there was something both of us wanted on the menu.

Other Yelpers seems to have had a problem with the service, we couldn't have had a more pleasant experience. The woman at the counter was friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the restaurant and food, so much so we took her as the owner or partner. And, it wasn't only us. She and the woman prepping the salads were nice to the stroller mom and dad who followed us. Nothing but friendly. The next day we came and recognized us, again, welcoming us back.

The first night I had the Beets & Greens salad. Perfectly roasted beets, goat cheese, caramelized onions, pecans, and delicious lettuces. I tried a bite of the sheep panini: manchego, fig jam, chorizo. The next day we both had salads: Chinese chicken and nicoise salad.

For all those who think it's pricey, I will agree that it's more expensive than I would like -- especially since free is the starting point of negotiation in my mind. Blue Barn is actually worthy of the expenditure. The salad portions are large. The ingredients are extremely fresh. I like the idea they are sourced locally. It's still a better deal than many places in terms of the cost-value price relationship.

Special notes: you will run into Marina people here. If you like them, great. They are everywhere. If you're not so thrilled about the self-obsessed set, you might want to get take out. The place is small with only a dozen or so seats. You'll definitely have to bear them.

Some warm weekend (chant with me: rain, rain, go away, come back during a work day), we have plans to grab it to go and head to the Marina green and have a picnic.

To sum up, terrific friendly service, delicious food, and a great little business that I hope continues to thrive.
author: Dave B.

description:
High quality ingredients, creative combinations, careful preparation, good prices and gracious cashiers.  What's not to love?  Faves: the select-your-own ingredient salad, the smoked salmon sandwich and the broccoli-cheddar soup.  

The salads seem a little pricey; but they're big enough for two meals.  

It does get crowded, the staff is small, and you have to wait while they make the food for the people who've ordered ahead of you, so don't go if you're in a rush.  But do go!
author: H. G.

description: Kickin Chicken sandwhich was great.  Lightly toasted bread, good amount of chicken, and an excellent oklahoma style bbq sauce (tomato based and slightly sweet).   Yummmm!  Young hip crowd was attracted to the restaurant.  Limited seating includes a coupla tables outside.  Will definitely be back to try some of the other sandwhiches.
author: Marcus K.

description:
Blue Barn is not cheap, but the make-your-own salad has the freshest, most organic ingredients in the city and is a generorus portion despite the price. 

Seating is very limited, but I highly recommend the salads, take-away options, and weekly home produce packs from their affiliated organic farm. 

My feedback is that there should be an alternative side to the salads for those who are gluten-free besides bread. For instance, I asked for corn crisps without charge as a substitute and have sometimes been met by resistance by the staff.
author: G F.

description:
Remember on Seinfeld when Elaine wanted the big salad?

Elaine: How about if you bring me back something?
George: Sure, all right, what do you want?
Elaine: Um, hum, I don't know.. . . A big salad?
George: What big salad? I'm going to the coffee shop.
Elaine: They have big salads.
George: I've never seen a big salad.
Elaine: They have a big salad.
George: Is that what I ask for? The BIG salad?
Elaine: It's okay, you don't...
George: No, no, Hey I'll get it. What's in the BIG salad?
Jerry: Big lettuce, big carrots, tomatoes like volleyballs.

See, in New York, they get the concept of a really good, big, salad as a meal. They are plentiful and chock full of good stuff.  They have countless places where you can build your own, and everyone does it.

For some reason, in San Francisco, we do not get this.

Thankfully, at Blue Barn, they do.  There is a menu board of Chef's Specialties salads for around $9 each, and they come in huge, helmet sized bowls.   They are heavy from the ingredients and tossed just right - not too much dressing, evenly distributed.  You can also build your own salad from your choice of greens, dressing and 6 fixings.  I tried the Beets & Greens, and the Tostada Salad and both were great.  Big enough to share.

They also have a menu of tasty-sounding sandwiches - the Rooster has my name on it.  And, my favorite...a separate board for JUST GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICHES.  How great is that?  I had the Cheddar - black forest ham, white cheddar, and honey mustard on sourdough and it was perfect.  

Seating is tight.  Very tight.  It was packed at 1pm on a weekday, so you can probably forget about weekends.  We managed to get 2 stools at the communal table.  Ryan from the Chicago season of Top Chef came and sat next to me, so that was pretty cool.  

Big salads.  A grilled cheese menu.  Decent prices.  Generous portions.  Potential quasi-celebrity sighting.  Good stuff happening at the Barn.
author: Liz S.

description:
Danielle I think we were there on the same day.  That girl must have been going through something.  

I ordered a sandwich and soup - great food btw, but the service brings the review way down.  We sat outside and they naturally bring your food out to you when you do that.  Anyway, the girl behind the counter brought my food to me but there was no spoon for the soup.  I saw that there was still a plate that needed to be brought out so she'd be making another trip, and  I politely asked if she could bring me a spoon.  I was told, "Oh you can get it yourself.  They're right next to the water jars."  

What?  You'll bring me the food but I have to get the utensils myself?  Doesn't seem to make much sense.  When she came back she was overly nice to my friends which makes me think it was something I'd done, even though I was only one of two of us in the group to leave a tip (you pay before you get the food).  I love Blue Barn's food and the girls behind the counter are usually so nice, but this time sucked for sure.  Not going back for a while.  

Moral: grab your own damn spoon before sitting down next time.
author: Greg S.

description:
I am a hard core Mixt Greens loyalist, and I take my custom salads pretty seriously. Whoever said vegetables are gross and salads are boring, was too afraid to admit that a prissy leafy concoction could kick any burger's butt. 

Blue barn may just be a new fave of mine. It's so cute, and tiny as can be. The staff will mix up a salad loaded with 6 toppings for $8.50 and toss it into cute take-away containers that resemble Chinese take-out boxes. Fortunately  there's a stamp reminding you of your fresh salad from Blue Barn on the outside. 

Blue Barn deff. mixes up some of the best salads in the city. With a variety of greens, many cheeses, caramelized onions, beets, almonds, walnuts, meats, tofu, etc you cannot go wrong. 

Nice to have another great salad place (I can't eat at Mixt Greens for every meal, or can I?). They also do sammies and b-fast (have not tried).
author: Theresa T.

description: This place is so good! Perfect spot for lunch. I've been to Blue Barn in Marin too, equally delicious but that one has a lot more seating! Nonetheless, Blue Barn has the BEST build your own salad in the city. Everything is fresh and super high quality- it's totally worth the $12! I've only ever gotten salad here because it's so good, but I have once tried the tomato soup which is delicious and flavorful. Just wish they had more seating! Friendly staff.
author: Gabi F.

description: Serisouly, best salad ever. Filling and very fresh ingredients. Obsessed, but thank goodness I do not live closer, cause i'd be broke at salads running upwards of $20 a pop!
author: Elle S.

description: this place totally kicks pluto's a$$! i love the blue barn theme with decor that is authentic to the jam bottle water glasses to the milk can water dispenser.  the make your own salad comes with 6 toppings just like plutos..but the paninis and sandwiches are definitely the heart of this place..lots of choices from heirloom tomatoes to portabella mushrooms to gruyere and goat cheese flavoured and to the simple ham n cheese..every palate qould be satisfied.  The tortilla soup was well made and a little spicy for my taste but good.  a great spot for a a quick bite and chill but a little small for a long dining experience..love the food. awesome job blue! you get my unequivical 5/5 judochops !
author: Dustin G.

description: Sandwich was really good. The salad was lacking some dressing though.
author: Javier R.

description: Great Sandwiches, salads and coffee! Lived the Hen SW.. Be prepared for lot of rush...at least for brunch
author: Avi S.

description:
Since my initial review Blue Barn has added seating - there are now seats for approx 15 people inside and another 6 or so outside. Considering the lack of seating cost them a star in my first review I'll gladly bump them up to 5 stars.

Oh yeah, my sandwich was as good as before. So there.
author: phil h.

description:
[Green Zebra Coupon: 10% off or a baked treat (yummy cookie)]

The salad and fries were great, but I was expecting good food from what the rest of you yelpers had said. Other than that, it was a really average place.

 If I could, I'd give them 3.5 stars, but I just can't spring for that fourth star. "A-OK" sums it up pretty well while "Yay! I'm a Fan" is beyond how I felt.
author: Elena C.

description:
Blue barn can be a tasty treat if you're on the run in the Marina and need a bite.  But, to be perfectly honest, I prefer the Pluto's a few blocks over.  Here's why:
*Even though I work in the neighborhood and have introduced myself to the staff on several occasions, they still fail to remember me, and are often aloof and unhelpful.
*In my humble opinion, the food is overpriced and underloved.  My grilled sandwiches are often cold in the middle, and the salads are usually either under- or overdressed.

So Blue Barn, if you guys really do have your act together (and I really want you to!) Please have a staff meeting, work on customer service, and lets get the quality in the kitchen hiked up a notch or two!  And I will absolutely update my review when these changes are implemented.  Bonus points if you reply to this review!
author: caitlin c.

description:
YUM. It is a little pricey for sandwiches ($10 or so for sammy or salad) but oh they are good. Fresh, unique, and on good bread! Plus, lots of good veggie options and BIIIIIIIGGGG salads. Mmm big stuffed up salads. 
And I love the barn rustic style inside. 
There is some outdoor seating available, but you have to deal with a different view...
author: Kristen L.

description: i could eat at blue barn everyday for lunch and dinner. their salads are incredible and very generous in size. the beet salad is the best and the dressing is not over the top and depending on what protein you order, they will give you a generous amount. there can definitely be a line out the door so if you're in a hurry, i would recommend calling ahead and picking up! absolutely adore this place and it's great for men and women.
author: Danielle G.

description:
4 stars for the grilled cheeses/paninis I've had
2.5 stars for the service

So I've only tried the sandwiches here and they are pretty tasty. My favorite by far is the provo. It's an ewwy gooey mess that's perfectly toasted and paired with arugula, tomatoes, turkey, and some kind of delicious aioli. The fries are amazing!

The venue itself I don't care for much - it's cramped and small and they try to make it look like a 'blue barn' but I'd say they failed miserably. 

My least favorite part is the service - a good sandwich takes time to make so that I won't complain about. A smile would be nice - I've never gotten it. I don't need small talk - I get it - you're busy. But I'd at least like to feel welcomed or something?! 

Last time we asked about the bathroom and a girl stated that they didn't have one. I said really - then where do you go? She then clarified a public one with such attitude. Okay smartass! She then went on to say since they are considered a take out place they don't have to provide a restroom. Starbucks is across the street she said.

There is seating outdoors and inside. Yeah you can't seat a lot of people, but can't really call yourselves "to go" when you have people eating there and you ask them for here or to go.

Regardless, their stuff is good. Maybe next time I'll try a salad. I'll just remember to pee at Starbucks before hand and have my Ipod to distract myself from the mean girls!
author: Zeke A.

description:
Indeed, this is "Slow food on the go" at its best! Make sure you stop to have lunch here during your stroll down Chestnut Street. They specialize in local cheeses and meats from Sonoma's Oak Hill Farm, so everything is super fresh!

I've had the Rooster sandwich, which has chicken, bacon, cheddar and avocado, and the Chinese Chicken Salad. Portions are ginormous, and are about $10, so you might want to split something if you're not a hearty eater. The 3 Miss Yelps could have just ordered one beet and greens salad and had some left over! Jessica and I ended up loving Nicole's beet salad way more than our Chinese Chicken salads and practically finished her salad for her. The strawberries and goat cheese made for an amazing combination.

This is truly slow food, so don't come here if you're in a hurry (phone your order in ahead of time if you are). Just sit back, relax and eat!
author: Connie C.

description: I come here 1-3 times a week and pick up dinner. BB has always had great salads, but over the last few months the quality has changed. What used to be hearty and deliciously packed salads are now 90% lettuce mix--not cool. I thought it might only be an issue with my regular Fattoush, so I tried 3 others and noticed the same issue. Bring back the old lettuce to filling ratio, plsssssss.
author: Meg C.

description: I went back to Blue Barn with a friend to grab a salad on our way back to my place. This time, I ordered the Spicy Ahi Tuna Salad...little did I know what I was in for! The salad was INCREDIBLE! Probably one of the best salads I have ever had. The tuna was perfect and the rest of the ingredients including mango, avocado, soba noodles, cucumbers, and dressing were fresh and a perfect combination. I will absolutely be back for this salad!
author: Holly G.

description:
My sis Natalie G designed Blue Barn's website (shameless plug, I know), and I've been meaning to visit for ages. I'm not in the Marina too often, but today was beautiful and we were out promoting and sweating and needed an infusion of freshness and light.

We got there a little early for lunch, and thank god! The moment we sat down we looked behind us and there was a line out the door and lots of pregnant women clamoring for any available seat, taking out any stroller in their way. 

I'm not surprised this place inspired cravings of the pickles and peanut butter variety. I ordered the beet salad and with greens, strawberries, candied walnuts, rich goat cheese and a balsalmic dressing, and it was like a rush of a needle to the vein of a deprived addict.

The strawberries in particular were noteworthy for their sweetness, and prompted me to study the menu more closely and notice that all of their ingredients are seasonal and brought in from local farms. Mooooo. I'm getting in line.
author: Nicole G.

description:
I had The Rooster, which was a chicken, bacon, and avocado, diet-obliterating monstrosity.  At near $10 price tag, it wasn't economical, but it sure was tasty!

I ate it in the Presidio Theater while watching Kung-Fu Panda with a combination of pre-teen children with overly permissive parents and a small crowd of drunk, aging, Greek house alums.  

Needless to say, the sandwich made the situation far more tolerable.
author: Kristina R.

description: This place was an amazingly lucky find. The spicy tuna salad was the best salad I've had in 10 years, my wife loved her ceasar, and even my 3yr old ate his entire PBJ! The staff was lovely, the sidewalk seating was comfortable, and even the weather was perfect. How did they do that?!
author: Rishi H.

description:
Blue Barn Gourmet is simply great.  I love their casual and rustic feel--they serve water in mason jars and carry Blue Bottle coffee as well if you're into that.

I've never been a fan of salads because they're usually not filling, but I'm never dissatisfied--in fact I can never finish an order--with their generous portions.  I love the cobb and spinach salads--heaping amounts of bacon and/or chicken and avocado.

Just note that they do get quite busy, especially since seating is limited.  It's definitely a nice place to enjoy good food while catching up with a good friend.
author: Ashley S.

description: This place is poppin'. They always have quite the line. If you are getting an order to go I suggest calling your order in ahead of time so that you can grab it and go! It's a tiny space with a bunch of hungry Marina folk, I try and get out of there as soon as I possibly can. The sandwiches I have had in the past are ok, in my opinion they are severely lacking on the veggie options. Salads are fabulous! They have the perfect amount of mix-ins and crunch to satisfy all cravings. My favorites are the fattoush and the tostada. Remember to call it in!!
author: Jackie B.

description: I love the fact that the restaurant gets their produce from a local sustainable farm!  The food is incredibly and I appreciate the call ahead option.  I just wish there were more of the restaurants around town.
author: Thalia F.

description:
De-frickin-licious.

I never knew about this place until I worked at a place on Sutter, from which I was later laid off.  Sometimes, on fun Fridays, we would order from Blue Barn, with the requisite sheet going 'round to fill our your order.

It's hard to order like that from Blue Barn because of their myriad choices, salad-wise. BUT, I chose wisely and got the Mediterranian salad, which is obviously a Mediterrian salad, with pita chips. The thing is, it's tossed perfectly. The dressing coats each and every piece of lettuce yummily (a real word, I just know it!) and the croutons are crisp and crunchy. It all comes in a Chinese-food-esqe box and it's all delish.

Once, I was on the pick-up crew and got to leave the boring office for a run down to the Marina. Never before was I happy going to the Marina but when I got to leave work, yay! And the shop itself is AWESOME! Cute little Blue Barn, just like they advertise. Check it out~
author: kelly m.

description: I just went here for the first time and got the falafel because the girl at the counter recommended it since it is made in house. Well, maybe they should buy it from somewhere else. It is SO DRY I cannot eat it. I'm not sure what I will do for lunch now. I also think falafel on wheat bread is a bad idea in general so I am partially to blame for thinking that they knew something I did not by putting that option on the menu.
author: mazzy s.

description:
30 minutes for a grilled cheese and ham?   Seriously?  

A long wait and service with attitude is quite a pair; well done Blue Barn.
author: Patrick A.

description:
LOVE their beets and greens salad. Nothing gets better for lunch in my mind!

They serve big portions (enough to share one salad with two people) and healthy choices. YUM!

Only downside is they have a small seating area, so not great for big groups unless you take to go or it's not too crowded.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Question: Can heaven be purchased for less than $10?

Answer: If your idea of heaven is a perfectly grilled sandwich with organic ingredients that takes your tastebuds to new heights of--.... Well, there's your answer. 

Blue Barn is one of the establishments I miss most now that I'm down in Los Angeles for the rest of the school year. Blue Barn gets the recipe for good food right: simple, fresh ingredients assembled with thought and care, nothing terribly fancy. Yum.
author: Cleo B.

description:
I've only had the sandwiches, and I must say, not bad. Tasty fillings, and plenty of them. They're flavorful, and creative. Seemingly healthy. 
I've been twice, and it looks like the salads are more popular than sandwiches. They look fresh and HUGE. 
However, they are a bit pricey, and the space - though unique - is tiny. If you are getting a sandwich/salad to go, there's no space to wait (awkward to be standing next to a couple eating their lunch, feeling like you are trying to listen to their conversation) - and very few seats, considering how crowded and popular this place is.
author: Joyti J.

description: I am in love with this place! It's SO CUTE and the food is amazing. I did a make your own salad, but it ended up adding to be $17, which is a bit outrageous. I should have gotten a salad that was already on the menu! That is the only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5. As long as you order off the menu instead of making your own salad its PERFECT! And right in the heart of Chestnut Street near the best shopping :)
author: Julia M.

description:
After a little drinking at the Union Street fair I wanted to grab a bite before heading back to Berkeley.  I'm not really familiar with the Marina area but Blue Barn sparked my curiosity enough to go inside and check out the menu.

The menu not only made my mouth water, but made it really hard to decide between all of the many well-coordinated choices of salads and sandwiches.
 
I ended up with the brie panini with prosciutto and roasted garlic on ciabatta.  One bite in and the prosciutto, which was so tough I couldn't get my teeth through it, slid out in one big chunk and slapped me in the chin!  I should have asked for something else but the wait for the sandwich was long and I didn't want to wait for another.

Reading some of the other reviews I must have just gone on a bad day, or picked the one bad thing on the menu, so I'll give it another shot sometime.
author: Madame X.

description:
I checked out Blue Barn last night and I have to say it was very impressive! The space is kinda of small and this is a grab and go place, but if you want a tasty sandwich, this is your place! I had the pastrami grill and it was very good. My husband had the HUGE turkey sandwich and we could not believe how much meat they put on it.
We also got a side of the potato salad (good) and the Chinese noodle salad (very Good). I can't wait to come back and try the entree salads and some of the baked goods! A very nice addition to the 
neighborhood!
* Been back several times and I love this place. The make your own salad is huge and the sandwiches have all been great.*
author: Lisa A.

description: Good food but consistently one of the slowest places. Call ahead recommended (if they pick up..).
author: William A.

description:
The Marina/Cow Hollow needed a super fresh and quick place like this.  It's not like Italian sandos at Lucca.  It's way better quality than Pluto's.  Most of their ingredients come from their Oak Hill farm.

Their sandwich & salad combos all sound amazing, and they have six kinds of grilled cheeses.  Six!  Half of them have meat, ie prosciutto, ham or pastrami, but still.  cheddar, swiss, goat, sheep, brie d'affinois or burrata with all sorts of other gourmet accompaniments.

I actually got the toasted Buddha sandwich though, which was one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've had: nice bread, hummus, roasted portabellos, watercress, feta, roasted red pepper, caramelized onions and cucumbers.  Omg, delicious!

My friend got the skirt steak sandwich (grilled to order) with Pt. Reyes bleu, caramelized onions, arugula and horseradish dijon.  Tasted awesome but the ciabatta was soggy after being wrapped up for just 10 mins... Bummer.

They also have tasty looking prepared dishes in a small deli case and nice cheese selection.

And the design is adorable farm-housy, even the facade in the front.  Very nicely done!
author: Melanie C.

description: I was so excited to try Blue Barn after more than one person told me it was worth trying out. They have outdoor seating and we were with our dog so we gave it a shot. I found it expensive for two grilled cheese sandwiches (no meat) and a cup of soup. It was 30 sum dollars. Anyway, we both had the burrata grilled cheese and my hubby had a cup of potato soup. Well, I found the sandwich disappointing. It wasn't hot, and the cheese was so watery it was more the consistency of melted mayonnaise than cheese. Maybe burrata isn't good for melting? I thought it was like mozzarella, though...there wasn't a lot of it either. My husband liked it more than me but maybe that's because he was dipping it in the soup? After finishing the panini and heading down chestnut street, I ended up having to order some more food elsewhere as the sandwich was not filling at all. Too bad. Anyway, although this was a disappointing experience I plan to return for a salad. The salads looked really fresh, delicious and filling. Hopefully this will nullify any harsh feelings I was left with.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
I dig this place. The girls who work up front definitely have a bit of an attitude, but how many of you work food service in the Marina. Maybe one or two people reading.

To be fare, they are a bit pricey, but I have never had a problem at Blue Barn. I just wish I didn't have to fork over so much money.
author: Melvin T.

description: I love Blue Barn!!!  All food can be summed up like this:  "Fresh and Delicious!"
author: Graham D.

description: Love, love, love this place! Their salads are always fresh and amazing. It's the perfect place to stop after some shopping on Chestnut or a great place to stop in and grab a to-go meal on your way home.
author: Lauren W.

description:
UPDATE: 1.9.08
____________________________________________________

Just wanted to say that this place now has the lights on! 

Annd, they've added more goodies that make it hard not to come here at least once a week. They've added all sorts of little deli salads that all look amazing.. one with quinoa and another with edamame! Oo and they also are now making Blue Bottle Coffee, which I have been dying to try ever since I read their rave reviews.

'Cuz of all the above, I'm now boosting them to 4 stars. Keep up the good work Blue Barn!
____________________________________________________


3 1/2 Stars

Holy smokes this place was packed!
Blue Barn definitely isn't having a hard time bringing in customers despite being their first week open. Pretty impressive.

However, you can tell that they don't yet have the manpower to cater to such a big demand. We had to wait quite awhile for our sandwiches while doing the mamba with incoming/outgoing customers in their cramped space.

The employees there are very amicable, with great attitudes and lots of smiles. The inside actually feels a little barn-like, but not necessarily in a good way. It was dark & drafty, which could be remedied by... turning on the lights! Maybe this is a kink they still need to work out, but I swear I saw lights installed, just not on.

I tried their Hen sandwich which is citrus-herb-roasted chicken, crispy prosciutto, sharp provolone, tomatoes, arugula, avocado, thyme aioli, & honey mustard on sourdough bread. (*phew* That was a mouthful.) It's a little pricey at $8.50 a pop, but it has "Gourmet" in its name, so it's expected. It was savory, but the mustard was a little overpowering. The pressed sourdough bread was a nice touch though. Oh and they included a piece of old style bubble gum in my friend's sandwich. What a cute idea! But hey! Where was mine?

Overall, the place is a pretty Marina, frou frou kinda place with high end drinks, salads, cheeses, crackers, and sandwiches. Their create-your-own salads sound veeery tempting. You get to select 6 toppings, which includes a variety of gourmet fixings like sun-dried tomatoes, candied pecans, pomegranates, ricotta salata cheese, soba noodles, etc. Even the dressing choices are fancy: chipotle agave, lemongrass nuoc cham, champagne-saffron vinaigrette, roasted red pepper caesar. YUM-O. I'll be swingin' by again to get a fancy pants salad and maybe a side of their tantalizing Rustic Potato Salad. I just hope I don't have to wait too long.

Sidenotes:

-This place really isn't designed for you to eat at, seeing as how they have only 2 little tables. It's more of a grab & go kinda place.
-I like their cute Blue Barn stickers that help lock up the sandwich.
author: Tiffany M.

description: $9.50 for a paltry sandwich that takes too long to make? Your money is better spent at The Grove, Marina Submarine (on Union St.) or even Plant. The sandwiches don't taste half as good as those at other places, cost a ton, take a long time to come and there isn't a lot space to eat it. The only thing I like about this place is its name, which is what conned me into going in.
author: S G.

description:
The Hen sandwich is awesome. Yummy aioli and honey mustard dressing.  Some of the other sandwiches I've tried, like the turkey, are just ok.  But the Hen keeps bringing me back.

Also good huge fresh salads.  

Bad part is that there's very little seating so during peak time you'll have to eat else where.
author: Gloria J.

description:
Have only been here twice so far but one word sums it up. Tasty!

Get the Rooster sandwich (an awesome mix of hot grilled chicken and melted cheddar goodness). A little pricey for a sandwich at ~$10 but it is a healthy serving. 

Anyway, Ive added this place to my usual rotation and look fwd to checking out their other offerings soon.
author: Allen X.

description:
This place lives up to it's reputation.  I had a Rooster and my girlfriend had one of the many grilled cheeses they offer, and both were out of this world. 

The staff was also friendly and courteous (I don't know why some people have been dinging them... maybe I went there on a good day, or they went there on a bad day).

The only drawback is that it's very small and crowded. Seating is hard to come by, so I'd advise going in with the goal of having take out.
author: Andrew L.

description: Love the new menu with amazing gourmet grilled cheeses! I could eat here everyday.
author: F D.

description: I could happily eat here every night of the week. I always make my own salad, and they are huge, amazing creations. I love the vibe of the place and miss it whenever I'm not in SF!
author: Heather K.

description: Spicy Ahi Tuna Salad was great! I went there after I read a bunch of yelp reviews.  I really enjoyed it and would definitely recommend anyone to try it.  I'm looking forward to try more salads and sandwiches.  yay for blue barn!
author: Sarah C.

description: If this was near my house I would never cook.  I love being given a salad that looks like I will never finish it. Problem is that the beet salad is so good I never order anything else. Service is decent, and the place is small. But like I said. I love salad.
author: J W.

description: Longest waits every time, even when the place is empty. Great salads... If you have time.
author: Elle R.

description:
Oh yes ladies and gentleman, we have a winner! The sista's and I are always looking for beet salad this season and while the Marina is bustling with lovely little cliche type bar and trendy cafes, this little gem with the lack of bright lights, advertisement and patio seating called out to me and lured me in on a whim.
The dining room is tiny!! The seating area is almost nil, but there is a bar to eat at and two little tables outside. Also there's no restroom to wash your hands and no coffee served so better be a Starbucks fan. 
The beet salad with their vinaigrette, strawberries and pecans were a lovely twist to what I've been accustomed to and the Spinach salad was so yummy. They give you the option of adding protein although the Spinach Salad already comes with salami, eggs, onions, wheat croutons and bread. 
They also serve sandwiches and grilled cheese sandwiches-I mean sandwiches as in plural. If you don't want to eat what they've got on the board, opt for your own salad, but be warned-portions are huge!! 
The lady behind the counter was super nice, brought the giant bowls of salad out to us and even set up our silverware. Great service but the place fills quickly. Split a salad with a friend 'cause it's just too much food.
author: Jessica K.

description: Like many other yelpers, I'm officially obsessed with Blue Barn. Although it is on the pricey side for make your own salad / sandwich places, you get what you pay for...the quality of the ingredients is much higher than their competitors. The make your own salad ingredients are always very fresh and tasting and they don't skimp. The falafel sandwich is really good and all of the grilled cheeses are ah-maz-ing. Expect to wait at 10 - 20 minutes to order and receive your food (it's always pretty crowded). They also accept orders via phone which is awesome! I can't get enough of this place!
author: Gina C.

description:
After SERIOUSLY sampling every kind of chocolate in sight at the SF Chocolate Salon we needed something savory with a little substance to settle our stomachs (alliteration... I kind of like it :)).

We were going to try Greens in Fort Mason, but the 1hr 15 min wait was more than we were willing to take.  Thankfully Blue Barn is a short, pleasant walk away along a cozy section of Chestnut, perfect for a quick bite during a day of shopping (or a day of hogging out on chocolate).  They had a good-sized salad and sandwich menu and the tiny restaurant was packed with diners and taker-outers.  We ordered, snagged a table just as someone was leaving and waited a few minutes for our salds and sammies.  The beet salad seems to be very popular.  I had the Rooster (chix sandwich) and it was yummy.  I'd like to come back and order a salad with my choice of toppings because the salads are 1. HUGE and 2. they had a veritable smorgasboard of incredible-looking fresh veggies and mix-ins.  Hooray.

Granted, I wouldn't call the food "out of this world", but maybe it's because my taste buds were fried from too much chocolate.
author: Laura B.

description:
I will have to admit that I am a sucker for $12 salads. But these salads  have to be AMAZING and really deliver quality for the price in order to satisfy me. Blue Barn has an amazing salad. 

Cute atmosphere and everything is packaged in adorable, oversized chinese take out boxes. I think it is a great casual place to stop in for lunch amid running errands on Chestnut street.
author: lindsey l.

description:
Ughhhh! There has been so much wasted time without Blue Barn in my life!  

I had heard all sorts of good things about Blue Barn but had never made my way to the Marina to try it, until last week. I've definitely been missing out! Everything on the menu looked absolutely delicious so I had a really hard time choosing. I finally decided upon a chicken sandwich with some sort of bbq sauce and slaw and it was so so so good! I can't wait to go back and try more of their sandwiches and salads!

Service was very friendly and the interior is beyond cute but the limited seating puts a damper on things and the prices are a little high for sandwiches/salads - hence four stars instead of five. I'll definitely be back and if their other food wows me as much as the first sandwich did I will definitely bump them up to five stars!
author: Amanda R.

description: This is definitely five stars, and I do not give these out easily.  The staff is polite and wecoming and it appears that the other customers follow suit (all the people sitting near me or in line have always been courteous and polite although, obviously, this might not be everyone's experience).  The most important thing, though, is the salads are absolutely wonderful. They have great ideas or you can create your own.  The salad comes in a  big bowl and if you want, it is already tossed with the salad dressing.  In so many other restuarants, I am often tossing a salad on a  plate with the ingredients falling all over the table (I don't get it....why some basic things other restuarants don't seem to see?).  The atmosphere is very comfortable.  This is the best!!
author: mike s.

description: Oh this place is serious about their salads and sandwiches! I've been here a few times now - the Burrata grilled cheese sandwich (with heirloom tomatoes and pesto aioli) and the tostada salad with chicken are my favorites so far. I recommend splitting a salad and a sandwich with a friend because either one alone can feel like a little much. Something just feels right about this, and guaranteed if you feel like eating a hearty but healthy meal, Blue Barn will do the trick.
author: Joanne S.

description:
Here's what I loved about the Blue Barn:

1. Teresa, the manager and joint-owner, is charming, warm, full of life and makes every customer feel like a friend.
2. The tostada salad is delicious - filling, fresh and spicy!
3. Great location if you're already in the Marina and when I went on a weekday afternoon there was plenty of room to sit.

Coupla cons (there are always cons even in the best of places):

1. The woman who took my order was a bit snappish (actually downright surly) and wouldn't break a smile even when I made a joke. Now that could have something to do with my joke - but all the same, not the energy I was looking for on my first visit! 
2. My salad with a small Pelegrino came to nearly $18. That's pretty zesty in this economy. Not sure I'd add steak next time...though my salad really needed that protein on top of the leaves and veggies.

Net net: definitely worth checking out if for no other reason than to say "hello" to Teresa and try a pretty delish dish.
author: Carrie S.

description: I ate there Saturday night, 8/6/11, and the french fries sucked massive wang. They were overcooked, crunchy, brittle, bad.  The love affair is over. I still like Blue Barn, the employees are great and it's a cute little space; I just can't recommend the french fries anymore.
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description:
continuing the blue barn love here.

since my original post, i've tried several other items on the menu and am happy to report everything has been amazing.  their tostada salad - o...m...g...  i've had several sandwiches and the french fries - nothing has disappointed.  the staff is super friendly and welcoming, the environment is cozy (although a bit cramped at times).  i love the big bar/table with seating for about a dozen people.  it's nice to spark up a conversation with a stranger sitting across from you or just sit amongst a group of people and read on your ipad.  always comfortable, even when it's cramped.
author: Anjanette M.

description:
A little slow getting everything together but the salads are huge and tasty. I got the fiesta salad and added some steak to spice it up. I have been back a couple times and really cant stay away from the salad BUT an dying to try one of their many choices of grilled chesse sandwiches.

I love food.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Love it, love it, love it.
The chef from Mamacita and Umami has done it again. 
Delicious salads, and a wide range of GRILLED CHEESE to choose from.  Who can beat that?  The beet salad and the prosciutto/manchego/fig grilled cheese are my faves.  Their new extended bar seating makes the place more comfortable to dine in than before.  Highly recommend for lunch or a light dinner!
author: S B.

description:
I give the people who run Blue Barn credit for changing things up when they weren't running smoothly. My wife and I went in there shortly after it opened last year. We waited an extremely long time for our food and felt increasingly crowded as more and more people entered the tiny shop to order. We wanted to sit down and eat but there were only 4 seats in the whole place so we got the food to go and were generally unhappy with the experience (though the sandwiches we got were fine if a little pricey). 

We recently returned about a week ago to try it again and noticed that BB had made some improvements. They had removed a huge display case that took up about 30-40 square feet of the interior space, replacing it with a long bar with 8 stools that effectively tripled the indoor seating capacity. Our sandwich and salad still took a few more minutes than we would prefer to get but not the 20 minutes we waited the first time.

A note on the food: I've eaten the tuna sandwich there both times and it was good. My wife did not like the turkey sandwich she had the first time but really liked the Chicken salad she got the 2nd time. As for prices, the food is a little pricey (if I remember right I think the tuna sandwich was $8-9 and the salad about the same). If you want salad it's a much better deal at Pluto's on Scott st nearby.
