I should also note that the woman who ran the register on our recent trip (who I think may also be the owner) was extremely friendly.
author: Dylan S.

description: Love this place! We were craving sandwiches and heard constantly this was the place we had to go to, even with 5 other sandwich shops right near by. I ordered the rooster, which was chicken, avocado, cheese, and a chipotle sauce on their fresh ciabatta bread. Seriously. That bread was to die for. Can't wait to go back when I'm in the city again. One thing; it is a little pricey for a sandwich (~$11), but with quality ingredients like they provide, a few extra dollars is definitely worth it!
author: Nicole P.

description:
Grabbed lunch here last friday with some friends visiting from out of town.

Split the rooster (?) sandwich (with chicken, avocado, and some other toppings), The bbq chicken sandwich, and an order of fries with my girlfriend. 

The BBQ chicken sandwich stole the show. It was really really tasty. 

The other sandwich would have been fine by itself, but i had the BBQ chicken sandwich first and found myself wanting to grab it from my girlfriend's hand and finish it instead of finishing my half of the rooster.

The fries were really good, nothing fancy, just straight up, traditional and tasty french fries. 

My only complaints are that seating is pretty limited and the prices are a little steep. Charging $9 for just a sandwich with no sides in a little casual, order at the counter place like this seems  a bit excessive, but i guess they have to pay rent in the marina. 

Really tasty sandwiches though.
author: Travis D.

description: So. I've basically only had their Caesar salad. (I've tried other things but I always want the caesar) And I'm such a huge fan.  I mean, the caesar dressing is hella good. But, it also comes with tomatoes and avocado too??? Legit. I've also just had their burrata sandwich and wow, it's gonna be a tough choice next time I grab lunch here. Especially since they have a whole menu of delicious sounding items...
author: Deanna L.

description:
This is not a food related review the food is great I have been visiting this place regularly and love the salads and sandwiches, they make a great beet salad

...But after today's experience with the staff, I am never ever going back here again

Pity as this is not New York or anywhere in the East Coast where good sandwich places are dime a dozen! :(

************Update
   I guess they have changed the service and people are so extremely nice now and the food still tastes good so I thought I will update and give them a 4
author: Amit S.

description:
OK heres the handle on this place.  It has bomb-ass sandwiches and salads all made from the freshest ingredients you can find in the city. They all have great flavor, unique style, and healthy appeal.  If youve been to Pluto's before, this place is like Pluto's on the most pure uncut yayo you've ever sniffed.  Seriously worth whatever price you pay.

If this rating was just based on quality, I'd give them seven stars.  However, there is a woman at the register, I get a feeling she may be manager too, who is cold as ice.  Honestly, I am uncomfortably nippily when she takes my order, even on a warm summer's eve.  I tried making small talk once (me: "Hey I like your shirt", her: "Youre carrots were grown in Hell"), and once was enough.

In summary, if you crave a hearty fresh salad, or a creatively built sandwich, give Blue Barn a try.  If youre looking for a friendly vibe or a cheery smile, I'd stay far away.
author: Brian H.

description:
This is my first review on yelp. I am pretty easy to please but one place has crossed the line and that place is Blue Barn. I live in the neighborhood and LOVE their salads (my bf and i go 1-2 times a week) but recently it has really gone downhill and no one there seems to care.  It's like when your parents say they are "disappointed" (instead of "mad"). I want them to improve so badly. Don't make me go to pluto's.

Issues:
1) their online menu is so old. They need to update the seasonal salad and also they need to update other stuff like for example the beets and greens salad currently has pomegranate seeds in it instead of blueberries (which is on the menu). If I am ordering on the phone how the heck do I know that it changed? We are in SF, I am sure you can find someone to update your absolutely bare bones website for you
2) a piece of cardboard (a little bigger than a silver dollar) was in my to-go salad about a month ago. nuff said
3) did not include a main ingredient in my standard, off the menu to-go salad this past weekend and when I called they apologized and offered to refund (just) the price of that particular ingredient the next time I come to the store. this is not a billing issue. And if i wanted just a bunch of lettuce i would grab some at safeway. I wanted the salad I ordered. Nothing more nothing less.
4) stop taking advantage of us, blue barn! we love your salads and will probably come back either way BUT.... Hire a few more people and stop making us wait so long! you know when it's busy. Come on... please! 

It's hard when you get a to-go salad and you are all the way home when you realize the problem. Big picture I have a great life, not much to complain about... but this is not big picture this is a review of one business that sells salads and on a purely transactional basis I just want the salad that I ordered! Why is that so hard? They put together a great list of salads and I choose one and pay (a lot) for it. Just give me what I asked for, PLEASE!
author: Katie L.

description: I love this place. The sandwiches are delicious. I especially love the kickin chicken. The salads are tasty. The staff is nice. The asparagus soup was great. I can't get enough Blue Barn. The only downside is that everyone loves this place and it's hard to get a seat.
author: Cody L.

description: i used to love this place for their salads, but i've grown tired of their bad service. today at a time when it wasn't very busy, i ordered a salad to go. 10-15 minutes later i'm still waiting then i hear them call the name of the person who ordered AFTER me. i ask if they have my salad and the lady asks me what my name is. then she asks what i ordered. clearly there was no tag for my order yet she claims they are making it in the back but i see the guy in front start to make it. meanwhile while he is making my salad she hides in the back. no apology or anything! the guy making my salad then hands me my salad since she is nowhere to be found. i think i'll be taking my business elsewhere for lunch.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I am so disappointed by Blue Barn and hate to give them such a bad review!

I used to love this place so much (in fact, I went twice a week). Not sure what happened but they have been failing over the last 6 months. Not only do they skimp when I build my own salad but the chicken is bad, sometimes even under cooked. They also forget to put stuff on orders. It seems like they are rushing to make orders even when I am the only one there. 

The kicker is, they have ridiculously high prices.  This was fine when they provided an exceptional product. Now it just seems like a waste of money. 

Going back to Plutos.
author: C G.

description:
I've been here twice now, and I will return, but maybe when I get paid next.  Yes, it's pricey, but I think worth it.

Visit #1: Thoroughly enjoyed the  Grilled Burrata Panini with heirloom tomatoes ($9).  Very tasty.  And I can't recall having had too many opportunities to eat grilled burrata, so points for originality.  

Visit #2: Inhaled my Beets & Greens Salad ($9).  I had to do a lot of inhaling because the salads here are hefty.  And it tasted very fresh.

If you're concerned about the price, you might try another neighborhood.  Plus, you can see how much everything is before you buy your food (the prices are listed alongside the items on the menu as you stand in line), so it's hard to justify complaining about how expensive it is.  I think it's reasonable, and I am by no means a baller.  Quite the opposite, in fact!

The only problem I have with this place is that it's teeny-tiny, and you'd be better off sitting outside on a nearby bench or in a shoebox somewhere else.  Hence 4 stars.
author: Kira K.

description:
Awesome Sandwich/Salad to go spot on Chestnut street.

Love the Rooster, Hen, Skirt, Grilled Cheese menu and huge salads. Add fresh fries or a side salad for $2. This place is perfect for after work nights when you don't feel like cooking or going out. Also great for lunch and takeaway.

I also have a soft spot in my heart for there gigantic chocolate chip cookies.
author: Ed B.

description:
Best new addition to the Marina.  

I tried this place when they first opened and loved everything about it.  The selection, the layout, the staff all top notch.  I came in a couple times and thought maybe they were just friendly since it had just opened.  Much to my surprise after coming back from a month out of the country they treated me just as they did in their first couple of days.

I've had almost every sandwich at this point and  you really can't go wrong.  When I'm having trouble deciding I can count on Theresa to make a great suggestion.  She knows a lot about the food they serve and where it comes from plus she's pretty easy on the eyes.

6 grilled cheese panini's, 9 gourmet sandwiches and a laundry list of salad fixings means that it will be a very long time before you run out of options.  Add the Blue Bottle coffee and wine selection coming soon and this place can't be beat.
author: Josh H.

description:
This is what the Marina does not need. Over priced, over rated and staff who don't give a sh*t about their customers.

I had the "turkey" sandwich. A total rip off for $8. It was smaller than my hand. I assume there was turkey on it. But it was slathered in so much pesto cream spread I couldn't tell. They said there were sun dried tomatoes on it. But, again, with this pesto nightmare, who could tell.  If you like pesto spread, I encourage you to order this sandwich.

When I entered, the women behind the counter (dark hair chick) was stamping some take out boxes. She saw me, and then continued to stamp. I waited. When my order was done (which I had to wait for after those who ordered after me got their food), she quickly said "Here it is." What a lovely way of thanking your customers.

I will not go back to the Rip Off Barn. There's enough over priced/over rated places in the Marina, and this one just adds to the list.
author: Dont Call It Frisco D.

description: Fresh, tasty salads. A great place when looking for a healthy salad with top ingredients.
author: Lulu d.

description:
We stumbled upon this place by chance and it has now become the falafel that I hold all other Mediterranean food up to.  
They are veg friendly and support local and organic with a CSA program affiliation.  

Post with photos here: http://www.hungryhungryhippie.com/the%C2%A0i-5/
author: Elise C.

description: I love this little place!!! My emphasis on little, but I always loved coming here on my lunch break when I worked across the street. I sometimes still go out of my way to get take out here. Even though the place is small and the lines can get pretty long, the food is definitely worth it.
author: Andy M.

description:
I stopped in here hungry on a whim after exploring the area for a bit and I'm so glad I did. I ordered a "Rooster" sandwich and it was absolutely wonderful. Lots of freshness, great bread, lots of taste and lots of quality ingredients. The prices are not low, which in itself might warrant 4 stars instead of 5, but the girl working behind the counter was so friendly I can't help give it 5 between the great service and cozy decor. She was probably the most smiling "happy with life" person I ran into at a restaurant/shop during my trip to San Fran. 

I'd definitely stop in again and I already mentioned it to some folks while I was there. Good job Blue Barn.
author: David G.

description:
I am utterly addicted! I love the fattoush salad (a twist on a  Middle Eastern salad) with feta, romaine lettuce, kalamata olives, cucumbers,red onion, crisped pita, lemon and olive oil dressing and I usually get chicken breast. Love it!! Sometimes I do have to tell them to tone the onion down but the great thing is it's made to order so you get it exactly as you want it!

Since I saw the Fattoush I haven't been able to order anything else. But I do see they make their own rice krispie treats.....my weakness!
author: Mariangela S.

description:
My opinion still stands. I went here for lunch today, and yes still as tasty as ever!!! I need to mention that they make amazing chocolate chip cookies there, fresh everyday. 
I had a strategically thought out organic salad, and a cookie that almost cost as much, but it was worth it!!

Blue Barn Salads make Plutos' look like a soup kitchen. You may never be able to have less.
author: Michelle K.

description:
The experience with ice princesses behind the counter totally left a sour taste in my mouth.  I felt like I was back in high school and they were the phony cheerleaders, or something.  

Too bad, because those sandwiches are crazy good.  A bit pricey, but good.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Ok, I love the PROVO sandwitch and the beet salad. BUT, I have to wait forever when I place orders here. Its like 20-30 minutes for a take out and there is like 3-5 people who placed orders in front of me. 

I found the service lacking.....a bit.

Unfortunately they are yummy so I still go. But really BB...I would give you five stars if I didn't have to wait until I pass out to get my sandwitch.
author: Kristina A.

description:
FINALLY a decent salad place in SF!!! I love salads and "build your own" salad bars and I was SO happy when I stumble upon Blue Barn. For some reason, salad bars are everywhere in NYC, but no where to be found in SF (other than Pluto's, which I hate).

Blue Barn was out the door this past weekend, but I decided to wait anyway. The menu is great! They have large salads, sandwiches, and a special menu of grill cheese sandwiches. They also have a small little corner where you can create your own salad. I decided to try the Beets and Greens salad. It came with tons of beets, strawberries, candied pecans, caramelized onions and goat cheese. Although they "forgot" my goat cheese, it was still good. 

I'm definitely coming back to try the grill cheeses and other sandwiches... Yeah Blue Barn. 

Note: you can call in your order if you don't want to wait in line..
author: Denise L.

description:
This is my favorite spot to grab a salad. Adorable little sandwich shop on Chestnut in rustic decor. The beet salad is my absolute favorite and I find it hard to stray from goat cheese, beets, balsamic, caramelized onions and pecans....could you really ask for more? 

The only drawback is the limited seating, but I get over that after the first bite :)
author: Jennifer W.

description:
The salad was pretty big (for 2), and the veggie sandwich we got was really good.

But we did seem to wait a long time, and the seating is limited for how busy it seems to get. The long table seating made it feel like we were on a double date with these strangers - who probably thought we were nuts by the way.

I would come here again but I'd probably have someone grab the outside table while I stand in line...
author: tyler g.

description: WOW, great salads and sandwiches. Trust me its  something special. I tried their skirt steak sandwich and substituted the the cranberry with chipotle aioli, honestly, its just phenomenal.
author: Sulaiman B.

description: This is my favorite weekend spot for a delicious salad.  The chicken caesar is off the charts!  The dressing is super light and the avocado is the perfect addition.
author: Leanne B.

description:
Amazingly Yummy. Came over to Chestnut street to go to the Apple Store and there was the Blue Barn. I was like that looks new. Walked in and was blown away by the salad fixings and sandwiches. I ordered the Hen...Yum
Chicken, provolone on sour dough with fresh veggies and some honey mustard aioli
Looking forward to going back. Good job guys.
author: Michael M.

description:
I love this place for lunch when I'm out running errands on Chestnut st. It has a super cute ambiance that sort of reminds me of a mountain chalet you'd find in my home state of Colorado, and the food is pretty darn delicious!

I just ordered my first grilled cheese - the "Cheddar" - last Sunday, and loved it. I've also had another sandwich here before (I think the muffalatta, but it was a few months ago, so I can't be sure), and it was also good. Though, I think I'm now hooked on their signature grilled cheeses!

The salads also look delicious and they deserve brownie points for selling Martinelli's apple juice - my favourite!
author: Sally M.

description: Before heading to a movie, we stopped in at Blue Barn for a quick bit to eat.  One of the people we were with had been before and said it was ok so my expectations weren't too high.  But I ended up really liking the sandwich I got.   Everyone else enjoyed theirs as well.  The ingredients were a little different than a normal sandwich shop but they worked together very well.
author: Blake B.

description:
Dear Blue Barn,

Please open another location in the Financial District.  I need that kind of motivation to get me out of my office for lunch.

I would like to eat your beautiful salads and tasty grilled cheese for lunch every day.

Sincerely,
Miss Lyss
author: Alyssa W.

description: I would call myself an expert of the "make your own salad" phenomenon and would definitely say Blue Barn is the leader among the pack. Their ingredients are awesome and while the salads can be pricy, it's definitely the best bang for your buck. And did i mention their shrimp? I had to come back two days in a row because it was just so tasty.
author: Ellie W.

description:
This place R-O-C-K-S.  A great and very welcome addition to the Nut.  Delicious sandwiches, fresh ingredients, very friendly (and cute!) workers.

I had the smoked salmon sandwich with avocado and goat cheese on ciabatta and it was de-lish.  The friends got make-your-own salads, which all turned out great.

Prices are reasonable, I just wish they had more seating!

also, a HUGE draw for me is that they serve crack-in-a-cup aka Blue Bottle Coffee.
author: Vijay N.

description:
I dont want to like a place with dried flower wreaths, its just not right, but...

I do catch myself suggesting this place, damnit.

Heres the thing, I love cheese, and they offer something like 6 different varieties of Grilled Cheese Sandwiches... so can you really blame me?

They have a great variety of salads and sandwiches as well. They even have choose your topping salad bar, if you are feeling creative or if you are a control freak... although if I am going out to eat I expect someone else to do all the work for me.

I would probably give this place 4 stars but its a bit pricey and again... dried flower wreaths...
author: Sara Ann S.

description: Alright so this place is sort of expensive for a college student's budget but I can not resist. Their salads, sandwiches, soups, cookies everything are scrumptious. I generally like to take my food to go because of the limited space to eat there. The food is very fresh and healthy tasting and also satisfying. Their to go containers are adorable. I'm not sure why all the women working there at the register are in a bad mood even when you try and talk with them but hey the foods good so I could care less.
author: Sadie L.

description: LOVE their PB&J sandwich. Simple but ooey-gooey goodness! And I mentioned the fries last time but I will say it again: to die for! I heart Blue Barn! :)
author: Mel P.

description:
I've had my fair share of salads and this one tops the list as far as taste and quality. I always build my own-goat cheese, seasonal fruit, almonds and walnuts...it's basically a dessert- the toppings are always fresh and given generously.  From the bites I've take of other people's sandwiches- the Kickin Chicken seems to be the way to go.

Minus one star for lack of seating- the 3 large tables make it feel like a "barn" but aren't very functional.
author: Rachael W.

description:
So these guys did what I've fantasied about...opening a locally grown foods cafe....I'm jealous but very happy it was their investing, so I'll live vicariously through their success...

Part of this fantasy is a super "build your own" salad bar, and they did that too.  I mean, really nice offerings...and TONS of them too choose from.  Great dressing selection too.  I got a couple to sample.  sweet n' sour went well with the fusion salad that I created.  Topped with crunchy soba noodles.  The place is clean and options all looked tasty.  From sandwiches to more salads, side and grilled cheese paninis....I can't wait for the Blue Bottle coffee to come (to outdo the corporate coffee competitors across the street)

I'll have to study the menu some, there's a lot to try.  I can see the line forming out the door already.....they are going to do really well!
author: ERICA E.

description:
BBG is great. I used them the first time to cater a lunch for 12 executives and the food was wonderful. 

I called them last minute and they were able to get these together for me very quickly.  I'll definitely use them again and try to make it down there sometime for lunch!
author: Joanne D.

description:
I really really really want blue barn to open a location in the FiDi. I would eat lunch here everyday if I could. My goal is to try everything on the menu. seriously.

The inside of this place is now on its third transition. Livin and learning I guess. They opened and had cheeses and picnic snacks, that's gone. Then they continued with some sides to go and minimeals like mac n cheese. that's gone now too. Each time they have changed those things they've also reformatted the inside to fit more people waiting for food. now with counterspace to sit, thank you! it's just soups, salads, sandos and grilled cheeses now and that's A-OK with me. 

The grilled cheese menu is genius! and they have Blue Bottle coffee. LOVE IT! 

The wait can get long, sometimes they mix up orders and apparently forget to put the cheese in salads a bit (HELLO the goat cheese is the best part of the beats n greens salad). Quality of service directly connected to who is taking your order. Light brown hair girl is the owner I think, super friendly and competent. Not so much for other people who have taken my order. 

The growing pains and wait are worth it tho for the really fresh and delicious food. see you next saturday blue barn! 

ps. and please, really think about the FiDi location. do you see how well mixt greens does? you would rock it even more than them! your salads blow theirs away.
author: Sarah G.

description:
I like.

I have had the beet salad and the Southwest Salad [or whatever they call it] with chicken.  Both were very good.  Loved the pecans and the goat cheese in the one with the beets; the chicken was a little dry but it had some heat to it, which pleased me.

All in all, a great salad joint.  Don't let me hear you bitch about the prices because they're on Chestnut Street - Jiminy Cricket.  Yea, you're gonna pay $9 for one of these and you're gonna like it.  And don't let me hear you bitch about the wait, that means it's good.

Sit down, have a glass of Pinot Grigio, relax, and soak it in.  You're eating a salad.  If you want to beef about your salad, order a steak.  Don't hate because too many people love 'em.  Join 'em.

Auf.
author: Dave K.

description: It's a small place and it takes along time for  the food to get on your table. One of my friends recommended, so we ordered Skirt sandwich and rooster chicken sandwich. Sadly, my rooster chicken sandwich was awful! The chicken was so thick, hard and salty that I drank 3 bottles of water to get down. Even though, it had mayo, cheese, and bacon/tomato. Before ordering I asked for whole wheat bread and no mayo! But my sandwich had everything on it. Overall, I would not recommend rooster chicken;( poor service....
author: Jessica F.

description: Had to drop you to two stars.  Everything has shrunk in quantity and the prices have gone up.  Could you be any cheaper with the fries?
author: M P.

description:
I hate to hate on a small business, but I will have to say that I had 2 bad experiences here. 

I love salads and used to go here all the time and even told all my friends about it. One time, I found a living creature in my salad. I mentioned someone there and they did nothing about. I felt so bad that I just left without complaining. 

I tried to forget about it. Since there is not too many places in the neighborhood that offer good salads, I went back. And I ended up having the same experience again. This time there was a fly on my salad; that sucks! They gave me a new salad, but that was it for me. 

I gave them 3 stars because they really do have good salads and sandwiches. I just had a bad experience there.
author: Shirley S.

description:
So I wasn't completely impressed with this place. Inside and out it's super cute and inviting, but that doesn't really make it a frequent lunch worthy spot. I had the tuna salad sandwich which was supposed to be albacore. I only eat albacore 'cause the other stuff tastes like sea trash. Their tuna was bland, super mayonaisey, and still had the fishy, sea trash taste. Also, the bread seemed like a thicker roman meal whole wheat. Again, nothing special. With all the amazing bakeries we have in this town, they could have done better with the bread. I think an $9 sandwich should deliver and this one just didn't. 

I am still giving it three stars because I'll go back to try the salads (both fresh and pre-made sounded good) and I like the piece of Bazooka gum included with the sandwich. Nice touch.
author: Lisa G.

description:
So. Many. Grilled. Cheese. Sandwiches. I've had the manchego grilled cheese twice now and sort of lust after it. It has fig jam and parma ham, which I actually don't care for too much so I leave a little bit on my sandwich and throw the nice big hunk of meat in my friend's salad because that's the kind of friends we are. The service is really friendly and it's a little pricey but I think it's worth it. They have other sandwiches besides grilled cheese and they sound delicious but there's no way I'm not getting the manchego and fig every time I go there.

They've also added a few tables outside and a few seats at the little bar, so that's a little better than before when they only had two tables. But it's still probably more of a grab-and-go place. And...they also have Blue Bottle Coffee - the best ever!
author: Kate S.

description:
Great place, pretty incredible food and the staff rocks. While the salads aren't necessarily my favorites, their sandwiches and grilled cheese are some of the best in town. 

Yes, it's a bit pricey, but the biggest complaint is simply their lack of space for eating in. Other from that, it's really a nice addition to the Marina.
author: Lucky L.

description:
I ate at Blue Barn for the first time last night and I was so very impressed.  When I walked in the staff was immediately attentive and very nice.  They gladly gave me change for my parking meter.

My sandwich came fairly quickly.  It tasted great, and it held together really, really well which is more than I can say for the sandwiches I get at most other places.  Oh and the piece of Bazooka bubble gum they included on the plate is a classic.

When I was finished eating one of the girls came by and took my plate, making sure everything was to my satisfaction.  After a few minutes I got up to leave and the same girl said goodbye, and wished me a good night, and then as I was walking out the other girl working there, the one who had taken my order, said goodbye and called me by name.  She remembered my frickin' name, and it was the first time I had been there.

I throughly enjoyed the staff, food, and the atmosphere.  I'll definitely be going back.
author: Scott M.

description:
I love this place!

The grilled cheese sandwiches are absolutely delicious!  Definitely not like the ones Mom used to make (no offense Mom, I LOVE your grilled cheese sandwiches.. esp. when you put tomatoes in them), but I digress.  These grilled cheeses are filled with all kinds of gourmet cheeses, and yummy additions like figs and proscuitto.  They use a really high quality bread, and grill it up reallll nice.

The regular sandwiches are awesome too, and despite the high price tag, you'd be happy to know that the sandwich is quite huge.  For the great quality of the ingredients, and the size, I think it's worth the price.

It's really small in here, but recently I noticed they had added additional seating.  The original girl who used to always be working the register is incredibly sweet and helpful.  Also love the rustic, New England style quaint decor.. makes me feel like I'm in Vermont, and said incredibly sweet and helpful girl, informed me that the wood beams on the ceiling are indeed... from Vermont!

Oh, and they serve Blue Bottle Coffee.. always a plus.
author: Chrissy S.

description:
I came across this place while walking to Pacific Catch for dinner and it caught my eye because of its cuteness, tasty menu w/ sandwiches & salads, and the line out the door.  I've been here twice and the bbq chicken sandwich was delicious w/ good and healthy flavors.  The 2nd time, I tried the tostada and it was pretty spicy which I liked but too oily.  
It is pricey for what it is but if you want to switch it up between Pluto's & Lettus this is a good alternative.
author: Meredith K.

description:
My friends and I decided to get salads for dinner on a Tuesday night. I ordered the Beets and Greens, since it is highly recommended by several Yelpers. My friends ordered grilled shrimps Tostado and a customized salad. It took about 30 minutes for the entire order. The service was slow and minimal. 
As for the salads, they were delicious. The shrimps were fresh and grilled! Beets and Greens was a bit soggy, but all the ingredients were fresh.
author: Angela Y.

description:
Like an upscale Plutos.  

Mainly for the poor SOBs that dont want to walk to the west side of Chestnut.  

Yep, that'd be me.

To be real honest, I haven't ventured outside of the spinach salad yet.  After 3 tries, it still steals my heart.  It starts with a monster load of spinach, cran, pine nuts, red onions, and other delights.  Most importantly, the BACON.  

The only set back?  A $10 price tag.  If you want to break it down, it's about $1 a block to Plutos if I wasn't so lazy.  The only thing with Plutos is that it takes the same time to travel to the planet Pluto as it is to for Plutos to make a salad.

I'll yelp more about the rest of the menu when I get there.
author: Isaac L.

description: I came here with a friend on Sunday during Memorial Day weekend and we managed to grab a table pretty easily.  It is really small inside so be prepared to wait for a table if you come at a peak time.  I ordered the Detox Salad which sounded delicious based on the description on the menu.  I got my salad pretty quickly and right as I was about to take a bite out of a few slices of apple I noticed a bunch of fuzzy mold on them.  I took my salad back to the counter and politely asked if I could get a new salad because there was mold on the apples.  The girl at the counter had a bit of an attitude as she inspected the apples for the mold but they did make me a new salad pretty quickly.  The apples looked mold free so I dug in only to get a huge mouthful of mint!  Maybe I'm in the minority here but I loathe mint, like seriously hate it.  Had mint been listed as one of the ingredients in this salad, I would have asked for no mint or simply not ordered it.  Please advertise your ingredients in the salad!!  Since I had already returned the salad once for my moldy apples, I couldn't bear to ask them to make me a new one without the mint so I sucked it up and ate because I was starving.  The salad overall was lacking flavor and the dressing didn't do much to help it so I probably wouldn't order it again.  My friend's salad looked really yummy and so did her grilled cheese.  We also had french fries that were pretty tasty.  I'll probably come back if I'm in the area and try something new ... they did have several things on their menu that sounded tasty, I'll just stay away from the Detox Salad.
author: Ali K.

description: Can't speak for the food because although it looks sooo good... there's no place to sit! So we walked by, and said, lets come back... and 20 mins later, it's twice as packed. so IM SURE it's good but how can one try if you're going to be forced to eat...uh... standing??!
author: Kim D.

description:
Truth be told, there was a cute girl sitting in the joint... so I had to see what it was about. Being that it was cold and cloudy, I ordered the Tomato Basil and Mixed Greens Salad. The soup was good and the salad was equally as good. The thing is, for a place to rate four star or above, it's gotta do something that I couldn't do myself. Don't get me wrong, Blue Barn was good, but I never had a "huh, that's different (good different)". 

But if you're cruising the 'Nut, and you've gotta stop in a place to eat. This joint is quick, easy, and won't let you down.
author: Douglas L.

description:
This place is great! A bit on the expensive side, but fresh ingredients and more choices than Plutos. I can add seaweed to my salad?! Add the grilled shrimp to your salad...it's delicious. 

One little problem...the seating. On weekends there's never enough during the lunch rush, so you end up awkwardly hovering over the one big table giving people the evil eye until they pound down their food and get up. Not fun.
author: L B.

description: I have given Blue Barn three chances now and they have disappointed me each time. Not the best place to get a sandwich or salad. Plan to spend nine to ten dollars for a mediocre meal! Save your money and try Marina Deli or Lucca's across the street. Blue barn also needs to improve upon their customer service. The girl at the counter was stone cold. Did not crack a smile once! Half way through taking my order she picked up the phone without excusing herself and helped another customer while I stood awkwardly waiting to finish my order. Indeed, plan to wait 20 minutes for your meal. Even though the kitchen may have already made it in 5 minutes, your sandwich or salad will wait on the counter for those additional minutes until the girl takes a break from going through her cash tips to see the sandwich or salad. I will not return . . .
author: Brittney J.

description:
Awful salad -full of olive pit fragments so I  thew it out. $10. of a Box of tasteless wet garbage, with No consideration to food craft-  or even leaving out the bitter white stalk of the cheap ice burg lettuce.
More like the stuff you expect to find in the drain trap after preparing a  decent salad. Andrew
author: Andrew C.

description:
4.5 stars

Blue Barn is to Plutos what the exciting new man/woman from the big city is in the small town.  Imagine you grew up in a small town where the dating pool was similarly small.  However, luckily for you, there was a fun, cute girl/guy.  That's Plutos.  Plutos is good, reliable, and may not be the flashiest, but you like it and are comfortable with it.  You date off and on for years.  Imagine then that one day a new girl/guy moves to town, from the big city.  She reminds you of Plutos, but she/he is fancier, dresses better, and is more exciting.  That's Blue Barn.  You got out with Blue Barn once, and next thing you know you're spending more time with her/him than with Plutos.  Blue Barn's tastes are more expensive than Plutos, but it's definitely worth it. 

In other words, Blue Barns salads are better than Plutos.  They have far more ingredients and they are tastier ingredients too.  They have better dressings.  Their sandwiches are better too (I like the "rooster" and the "hen" a lot...just talking about sandwiches) and they have a lot of those, as opposed to the few offered by Plutos.  They don't offer some of the sides that Plutos does, but that's ok.  It is more expensive, and perhaps a bit too much for a sandwich or salad, but so far this hasn't kept me away because they are tasty.  The people that work there are nice.  Besides the prices, my biggest complaint is the lack of seating.  I only get takeout, but would be more likely to come here with friends if there were more than two tables.

All in all, Blue Barn has come into a street with Plutos and Lettus, and seems to be doing as well if not better than both of them.

Who knows how it will be 6 months from now.
author: Brett J.

description:
Great sandwich menu - my favorites are the Kickin' Chicken (not on the online menu for some reason, but it's bbq chicken with bacon and cole slaw on), the Rooster and the Skirt. All very tasty, and their toasted ciabatta or country levain breads are superb.

I haven't tried the you-pick salads yet (I'm lazy), but I'm a big fan of their standard salads. I normally don't go for caesar salads, but theirs has avocado and cherry tomatoes - makes it so much better. The Tostada and Fattoush salads are also pretty damn tasty.

Definitely more expensive than Pluto's, but worth it.
author: Ranjit S.

description:
ONE STAR: for service. Sometimes I find the people behind the counter nice. Unfortunately, more times than not the service is a little on the rude side. There is absolutely no need for that kind of attitude. I'm sorry if you think you are too cool to work on Chestnut, but you work in the Marina. Suck it up. (I'm a little peeved at them today, since I had such a horrible experience this afternoon)

FOUR STARS: for food. It's yummy. Perhaps a little pricey.

I'm sure I'll be back since I think the food is good and I have to be in the area more than I'd like to admit. Plus, there isn't too much competition when I need something delicious to eat at 3:30 in the afternoon.

PS They are no longer offering espresso drinks. Just drip coffee á la Blue Bottle. They also do not serve milk, just half and half.
author: J B.

description:
Man do I love the Blue Barn!  What a great addition to the neighborhood.  The salads are frickin' huge with a great selection of very high quality toppings.  The sandwiches are delicious as well, and my biggest regret is I rarely eat them since I always drawn to the greens first.

Yes, the service is a bit slow, but these guys win huge kudos from me for continuously changing how they do things and it has definitely made a huge improvement.  Plus, they went from a measly 4 seats when they first opened to about 20, which is the max this little place could hold.  Good for them to actually listening to their customers and throwing out stuff that doesn't work.  (Paying attention Plutos?)

The staff is as cute and charming as they come, too!
author: Mitchel H.

description: My girlfriend and I are addicted.  Delicious, healthy salads at a reasonable price, Blue Bottle coffee, and quick service.  I think that I would literally stay in my neighborhood to be close to Blue Barn.  Try the Tostada salad, its delicious!
author: Kevin H.

description:
Dear Blue Barn,

Could you please make your salads cheaper so I can eat here more? I hate salads, but you make me want to become a better man. And baby I stopped callin' 3 weeks ago because I got a new cell phone...you didn't get my email?
author: Rainer P.

description:
Working very close to the Blue Barn Gourmet, today was my first time actually trying it out and WOW was it good. 
With all of the selections, it was really hard for me to choose, but I heard the girl behind the counter taking an order for Nicoise Salad over the phone and that's when I decided to go with it and I ordered the same. Ordering it to go, with dressing on the side, I eagerly ran home to try to it out (seating is pretty limited). OHMYGOSH... it was so good, even after sitting in my bag for probably 15 minutes, it was so fresh and delicious. Rather than using the dressing that they provide I just added some balsamic vinegar and pepper and it was amazing!.
I do have to agree that the prices are a bit steep but it's clearly due to the freshness and quality of the ingredients. 
The girl behind the cash register was super nice and friendly as well, always a plus in my book. There will definitely be a return visit to try out their various other salads and sandwiches as well as their enormous rice krispy treats... YUM!
author: Emily S.

description: Great salads...even better than Pluto's!
author: Louis C.

description: it's mostly just sandwiches and salads. I got an heirloom tomato BLT with goat cheese and it was incredible. I don't normally get BLT's and I would order this sandwich again in a heartbeat. In fact, the more I think about it, the more I want to run back and get one right now... My friend got a Chinese chicken salad. I didn't taste it but the portion was huge and he seemed pretty happy with it.
author: Nicole L.

description: Fresh make your salads. I really like the master cleanse dressing.
author: Jenny J.

description: Oh now I love this place, let me count the ways. Its a soup and sandwich shop for foodies! Its comfort food with wholesome ingredients, and did I mention that they have an entire menu of GRILLED CHEESE!?! On a chilly SF day (lets face it, any day) wouldn't you love to pick up an apple and manchego panini and dunk it into a big bowl of heirloom tomato soup with crispy leeks? You would! Its delicious!!! The fact that there is an amazing cake shop next door only increases its like ability. SO GOOD!!!
author: Sarah B.

description: The vegetables are fresh, and they create a make to order salads and their paninis are so flavorful!  I just wish they had more tables to sit and eat there.
author: Nadine T.

description: This place is five stars all the way--the service is super-friendly and fast. I had a salad with shrimp--amazing! Try the champagne saffron dressing. My friend had the tomato basil which was served really hot, which was fantastic. I had a bite of his sandwich--very good. I love the community table vibe and rustic look. We will definitely be back!
author: Jaynel G.

description:
I cannot wait to go back to Blue Barn to try more of their delicious sandwiches and salads. I had the Swiss grilled cheese and my boyfriend had the Brie. We ended up swapping halves we liked eachother's sandwiches so much. The sandwiches were both fresh and delicious and had a really good mixture of flavors.

My complaints about Blue Barn are the price and the size of the restaurant. $9 for a sandwich is a bit much. How about a side of potato chips? The inside of the restaurant is really small. We managed to get two bar seats by hovering. However, the quality of the food makes up for both of these complaints and I will definitely be going back.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Ate at the barn for the first time today for lunch.  Tiny place, which is unfortunate as it's a nice, well-lit place and pleasant to sit and eat if you can get a sit.  Luckily we did.

I had The Rooster, a grilled chicken on ciabatta with avocado, tomato, and aioli.  And you know what...  it might have been a flawless sandwich.  The ciabatta was fresh and toasted just right.  The chicken appeared to be freshly grilled and had a nice, subtle char flavor.  But there was plenty of avocado so that flavor didn't get lost.  

The gals working were both very sweet, too.  Tough job as they have to manage a cramped space and a decent line of people waiting to order or find a spot to sit.
author: Jeff T.

description:
We were stealthy and snuck a few of these into the theater to eat them while enjoying our flick. It was well worth the subterfuge.


 I had a sandwich called The Rooster which was made of grilled chicken, bacon, avocado, and a slightly spicy slaw. It was delicious. The muffaletta sandwich was also quite tasty.


 The salads are also quite good, and large enough to share with another person. We tried the cesar and the beet.


 I would skip the steak, however. It was chewy and fatty enough to be unpleasant.


 Aside from the pricesone sandwich will put you back at least $10.00the service, although a tad on the slow side, was friendly and personable.


 I would definitely sneak one of these sandwiches into the movie theater down the street againexcept they wrapped them in really loud paper. People gave me dirty looks.


 Jealous!
author: sfKristina

description: What an amazing little place - I've walked past it so many times, but never knew it was so good.  They use high-end ingredients like heirloom tomatoes and pt reyes blue cheese, so I'd say $10 for a sandwich is a fair price.  The salads looked great, too.  I'll definitely be coming here more often.  Menu is on their website.
author: Mike R.

description: yummy! absolute sandwich gem of the marina. I die for the turkey sandwich! everything is so fresh, so organic. just incredible. sometimes i switch it up and order the beet salad or rooster sandwich....lol or all 3:) the bread is a lil too hard but not hard enough to loose a star. Hands down best place for sandwiches and beer on chestnut.
author: Cima K.

description:
Blue Barn offers the part of a NYC bistro (except with fresher food!) where they either create a make to order salad, or one of their set options. Two of three salads I have tried I have greatly enjoyed, so it doesn't quite get 5-stars. In addition, if you get a drink it starts to feel a little spendy for lunch... though they do have a water jug and cute little jars out making just having water very easy and not at all awkward.

The first time I ate here I had the Beets & Greens salad and was very impressed. I went back with a friend last week and I ordered the Spinach Salad and she ordered one of the special salads, similar to the Spinach but with mixed greens and blue cheese crumbles and balsamic dressing instead of spinach greens with blue cheese dressing. I make this distinction because while I LOVED the beets and greens salad, the Spinach salad was lacking, specifically b/c the blue cheese dressing tasted like watered down yogurt, and blue cheese crumbles and balsamic dressing would have been better (in fact, I confiscated some of my friend's dressing and was MUCH happier). 

ANYWAY, with 2/3 salads being very good (and the option to tweek and/or create my own) I will definitely be back here to work my way through the menu!
author: Hanna L.

description:
This is the place to grab a great salad, but they make "THE BEST" BLT sandwich in the city! 

It's always packed during lunch, but it's definitely worth the wait. The staff is very efficient in getting orders out ASAP. This is a great place to grab lunch to-go, if you're looking for something quick and easy.
author: Scott C.

description: Hard to beat their grilled spicy chicken sandwich - The Rooster! Their fries are nice and light as well, always fried to the right level of crisp.
author: Marshall K.

description: Good lunch place. Basics - salads and sandwiches, but lots of good options and done well. Great location right on Chestnut.
author: Lina L.

description:
THE BIG CHEESE!! It is self explanatory! It comes out oozing of cheesy goodness! The sourdough is perfect and tomatoes are a must inside! The grilled cheese are perfect to warm up your tummy!

The spicy tuna salad is beautiful and has a perfect balance of flavors. What else is better than a HUGE bowl of leafy green, tons of avocado, mango, and of course tuna!
author: stephanie c.

description: It really looks like a barn, without any of that hay smell. I've walked by numerous times and seen people chowing down on delicious and huge salads. The inside is pretty small and there is one long table and two smaller tables. They also have a few tables outside on Chestnut. You can order salads or sandwiches and they of course have soups. You can also make your own salad. I like the to-go little cartons, they are super cute. Since this was my first time, I ordered the beet salad, which was amazingly delicious when I had it at home awhile later. It had beets, strawberries, candied walnuts, sauteed onions, feta and who knows what else, but all I can say is that it was delicious! Of course with that much cheese it was probably slightly unhealthy, so next time I'm going to ask for less cheese. They give pluto's a good run for their money.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Salads are top notch.
Takes forever though, and expensive.
Order ahead, and come when they are quiet or be prepared to wait 45 minutes for lunch.
author: Chris M.

description:
are you kidding me? I walked in with my buddy for lunch and the girl at the counter seem "thrilled" to serve us. Not to worry, she didn't stop chewing her gum. Her face expression was of someone thinking "oh my god, i mean, like, come on, i so don't want to be here, i mean, c'mon, it's like, whatever". After the delightful gal took our order, it took good 10 minutes for the food to arrive. The food itself isn't bad just super expensive if you compare to much much friendlier Pluto's. The salad is $9 and that's before any "add-ons". Why are yelpers excited about the Heirlooms? I don't see how adding a few heirlooms justifies a dollar charge. My buddy ordered a sandwich which was good but pretty small overall. We also shared fries and got two sodas - total was $30. 
My biggest issue again is really with professionalism not the food. The workers in the back all had baggy pants, hats that are worn turned backwards etc. I understand they want to be relaxed but when the girl taking the order and the salad maker are both chewing gum like there's no tomorrow it just doesn't feel right.
author: Jennifer And Uri W.

description: The sandwhiches are great but they take way too long to make and they are always screwing up my order. Come on guys its not that hard!!
author: Justin C.

description:
I had actually not heard of this place until last night when my friends were coming over and decided to pick it up.  I got the Rooster as it sounded like the best over the phone.

I can't rate on the style or size of this place or even the service but I gotta say the sando was very good.  And I love that they called them sandos :)
A little expensive is what knocks off the 1 star.
author: Ed F.

description:
Heaven? Blue heaven? I think so. Sure, there's a line out the door every time you walk by and not much standing room-- but people, call-in, pick-up, enjoy at home. Seriously. 

Panini this: Fresh ingredients and creative pairings make for mouth-watering temptations. Sure it's 8-11 bucks but you can drop that on some skimpy meal down the street or at a bargain deli that makes your mouth hate you. 

Salad a go-go: Go, go get one. The generously portioned salads are truly scrum-deli-umptous. If you are hungry after devouring one of the many choices (or making your own), I suggest not eating out. Or eating. Ever. 

Yum, yum in my tum, tum: You're cute. Thanks for adding the bazooka gum in the packaged sandwich to make me smile. It made it that much better.

In all seriousness, this puts Pluto's to shame. Sorry. 

Oh and the staff-- hilarious and accommodating, socializing and knowledgeable they got their shiz together.
author: Sara W.

description:
I work in the Marina, which is why I have learned to love the area in a  kind of kitschy-brilliant way. So, I have now gone through the entire menu at this place, salads included and am pretty impressed. First and foremost, the girls who work here are sooooo friendly, super cute and helpful that the place just lights up because of them, unlike Lucca's across the street which has gone out of their way to hire the grumpiest human beings on Earth! The place itself is killer, big open windows, you can sit at the bar counter (no alcohol, but if Brandt or Zack are working next door at the California Wine Merchant they'll let you eat the sandwich at the bar over a glass of vino, but shhhhh, the owner forbids outside food). 

The salads are incredible and very well portioned, and it comes in a snazzy lil' tote box. The paninis are all grubbin', I love the pesto grilled cheese, the meat is high quality and everything is well made. There are a couple of duds on the regular sandwich menu, but its not like a deli really has to be 100% brilliant, I just don't like eggplant and a couple other things. Just to be a snitty shit, I wish they threw in a bag of chips for a ten dollar sandwich, but whatever, if I can afford a ten dollar sandwich, then I probably shouldn't be bitching about a one dollar bag of chips right? 

Anyway, great addition to the 'hood, we lost Andale, but gained Blue Barn!!
author: Steve l.

description:
Ok, so this place takes the sandwich to another level....AWESOME!

I've eaten here a few times and I have to say they know what they are doing!
The food is a little on the pricey side, but that's to be expected in the Marina.  Even though its pricey I still think its worth it.
I recommend getting in early or late, cause if you try to go at peak lunch time....you're screwed!
Can be very busy, and it takes them a little while to put your order together.  Which is ok for me cause that means they aren't just throwing pre-cooked ingredients together.  Everything is fresh!
Enjoy!~
author: Matt P.

description:
I would pay $8 anyday to build my own salad with quality ingredients. Blue barn has super fresh toppings from all food groups.   

I would give this place 5 stars; however, I do not believe in waiting over 20 minutes for a to-go salad especially when the toppings are chopped and ready to go and there were 2 people ahead of me in the salad line.  My cheese panini was ready before my salad.   I learned that they give phone-in orders priority.  The cashier even interrupted my order when someone called in a take-out order.

Next time, I will just call in my order like everyone else.
author: BlissChic W.

description:
Yummmmyyyyy.

Well worth the price and the wait. The portions are huge and the ingredients are quality. 


On my way to get my daily fix.....................
author: Jen H.

description:
If I didn't work in the area I would have never gone in as I try to avoid the Marina altogether.  The blonde highlights and fake tans usually send me running in the opposite direction but I had heard that they had great salads and sold Blue Bottle coffee from co-workers.  So I have tried the salads and ..meh.  They have a 'create your own' but only offers 5 toppings and is $10--better off going to Pluto's down the street.  
But today I had their turkey sandwich and it was DELICIOUS.  So much so that a woman commented on how good it looked and went in to buy one!  
Food: three and a quarter stars
Ambiance: two stars
author: Nicole T.

description:
Terrific sandwiches.  Salads look good too.. very large.  But, I'm a meat guy, so I haven't tried them.  Back to the sandwiches.  I've had most of them (meat related), and have yet to encounter a dud.  Very satisfying, especially with a side of fries.
It's a little pricey, but I'm happy to sacrifice for their sandwich.  Oh, and it's pretty small in there, so seating is at a premium.   Good service too.
For you Giants fans, I've seen Burrell and Wilson eating there a few times.
author: tom s.

description: Damn you Blue Barn... I tried to stay away, but that Beet salad has me hooked. I failed at boycotting you. Shame, shame on me.
author: Danielle K.

description:
I've been to Blue Barn several times before, but yesterday's experience really tipped the scales to make me want to write a review.  I'd summarize my experiences there with the following:

- Horrible service from people who are very short with customer questions
- Over-priced for very basic menu items 
- Mis-communication between the front and back of the house (messed up my order almost half the time)

All in all, I think I've had my full dose of Blue Barn.  I'd go for Lucca Deli or Plutos or Plant Cafe over these guys.
author: Megan M.

description: Amazing Food! The buddah sandwich and the rooster sandwich was amazing!!! Totally worth the wait!
author: Corinne L.

description:
kickin' chicken!!!!!!! yes that sandwich is pretty amazing. 

however, I still can't really get into paying 10 bucks for a premade salad I can totally make myself at home. It's hard to pay someone 10 bucks for mixing veggies, and dressing together and put it in a togo box. Like seriously? But to each your own right? Anyhow, the sandwiches are great, like their grilled cheese concoctions!! they have so many different versions of grilled cheese, and if you get a bowl of their tomato basil soup!! delicious!!! :)
author: Nina M.

description: Beautiful Saturday afternoon.  Scored a table outside where we enjoyed a deliciously big bowl of mixed greens with roasted beets, goat cheese, strawberries, pecans, croutons and caramelized onions.  I would come back if I'm ever in the area again and craving a lovely salad.
author: Lynda N.

description: Walked around the neighborhood after my botox and came here for salad.  Great staff and I love the fact I can pick out what I want in my salad.  Getting ready for my reunion and will be coming here when in the neighborhood!
author: Roc W.

description: My favorite place to grab a quick bite in the Marina. I love Blue Barn because it's so healthy and fresh and I always leave feeling like a million bucks. The Chinese Chicken salad is perfection. The falafel, "you pick" salads and french fries are also favorites of mine. My friend is vegetarian and a regular. Her favorite sandwich to order is the "sheep panini" without the chorizo, which is manchego cheese and fig jam on country levain and she adds carmelized onions and arugula. Great combo!
author: Katie L.

description:
Hex-yess to an awesome sandwich, but gosh darn it I hate having to wait outside of a restaurant for my food because it's too crowded and claustrophobic to do so inside. Back to the food: 

I ventured to this place with my boyfriend and a few others for lunch over the weekend. We intended on eating there, but after running into the lunch hour rush we decided to take it to the Marina Green and enjoy the sunshine. Soon after ordering, we realized that all 4 of us zoned in on one item: The Rooster sandwich, but of course! 

Essentially, it comes with chili-lime grilled chicken, bacon, avocado, tomatoes, cheddar cheese, and chipotle sauce on a ciabatta roll -- doesn't that sound amazing?!?! I'm a sucker for chipotle sauce :-) I was a little concerned about the ciabatta bread being too chewy and thick, but it was surprisingly manageable and the contents of the sandwich didn't go squirting out the other end when taking a bite! 

In any event, the ingredients seemed to be fresh and I think we all enjoyed our choice of sammy that day. The only things I would recommend are try to go on an off hour and plan on enjoying your food elsewhere. Even if we had found a table there (inside or outside), I would have been annoyed with the line trailing out the door.
author: Ali H.

description:
It's SO PAINFUL to hand over $12 for salad. But, then when you dig into that adorable bundle of lettuce and carrots and cucumbers and tomatoes and edamame and avocado...and suddenly you forget how much of your hard earned cash you just sacrificed. 

This place is gooooooood. There can be a wait & they certainly don't have the space to accommodate all their hungry customers...

PS. I cried a little when I found out they took away my sushi ginger dressing. Why, Blue Barn, why?
author: Z L.

description:
Overpriced. Rude employees. We waited OVER 20 mins for a grilled cheese sandwich. 
I am not from San Francisco and this is my first review but I felt like I should because of my experience. I would not visit this place again.
author: tate s.

description: Delicious sandwiches and the grilled cheese is the best! I dont eat salad but my friends love them too. Adorable barn like decor and high top tables - lovesit!  Super fresh food that I am always in the mood for :)
author: Veronica P.

description: While the options are healthy, and the food good, I have been three times and have experience inefficiency each time.  It is always a surprise how slow it is (and I wonder what the guys in the back are doing).  The flow is odd, the salad process is slow, and to top it off, they forgot the noodles on my chinese chicken salad (discovered at home!).  While marina rents are pricey, to add protein to a salad making it $14, I expect service, or expediency or something more than a slow inefficient process.  Even though it wasn't crowded, for cafeteria style salad, it should not take more than 10 minutes (and it does).  They could take a lesson from Pluto's.
author: Rita G.

description:
It really is sad that I have been here more times to get coffee than to actually sit down for a meal. Why is a sandwich place the best place for coffee in the Marina? Something is really wrong with that picture. Sure we have Peets, Starbucks, the Roasting Company way down West Chestnut, but Blue Barn has Blue Bottle Coffee served fresh and using single cup brewing.

The sandwiches are good too and everyone has been friendly even to the times where I use the place as a coffee shop.
author: Patrick C.

description: BIG hearty salads! I'm a fan of the fattoush w/ chicken and beets & greens salads.  This spot is pretty small so sometimes it's tough to grab a seat to eat around lunch time.  They staff is friendly & try to move the line quickly which is appreciated.  It's also great for take-out!
author: Mel A.

description: Awesome salads and sandwiches (and I see from my previous review fries also?). Only downside is that it's always super busy so then takes awhile. It also means that if you plan to eat there, you may or may not actually get a seat, so getting it to go is a good option - calling ahead is even better. I hear they are opening a second and larger location on polk st!
author: Caitlin B.

description: Blue Barn, inspired by the seasonal harvests from Oak Hill Farm in Sonoma, serves up a consistently good mix of sandwiches and salads.  Having one of the better tuna sandwiches and the odd but tasty Falafel sandwich, you can expect not to be disappointed.  Grilled Cheese fans will appreciate the 7 different choices on the menu from chedder to sheep.  The sandwiches are panini'ed and "thank God" aren't soggy.  Add the $2 for their fries and you're set.  Oh BTW, Blue Bottle Coffee is served here.
author: Jason A.

description: When I used to work in the Marina I would treat myself on rainy days and get their grilled cheese; it has  4 different kinds of cheeses on artisan bread, grilled to crunchy perfection.  The interior stays true to the name, resembling a barn with a communal table.  It's a small space, but the food is served quickly and if you get it to go it comes in a cute little bag.  I haven't been back since I stopped working in the neighborhood, but Blue Barn the only reason I'd sojourn to the Marina.
author: Kasia P.

description: I have tried Blue Barn over and over and hope for a better experience each time. While the food is good, the staff here are so rude. I can't figure it out. They seem pissed off, ignore you and seem bothered when it's time to order. They huff and puff at you when they deliver your food to the table. It's a shame because I really do like the food, I just hate going to a place where I feel like I am bothering them by simply being there.
author: Jill S.

description:
Bread can make or break a sandwich, and the ciabatta at Blue Barn so makes it.  The bread is crusty to begin with, and then it gets an extra toasty crispness in the sandwich press.  Sandwiches are sizable, no need for a side, but they'd be great to share along with some chips or a salad.  Caramelized onions on the Kickin' Chicken were sweet as could be, and the bbq sauce just the right side of piquant.  They forgot the avocado on my Rooster, but it was delicious even so.

I order ahead and then walk over to pick up -- saves the wait in line.  Yes, $9 is a bit much for a sandwich, but every once in a while it's so worth it.
author: Jess Z.

description: We order Blue Barn at least 2 times a week at my office.  They have a great menu and always consistantly delicious.  Had the Rooster sandwich today and it was excellent!!
author: K C.

description:
Slow service.  

BLT gave me heart burn and then major nausea...  The sandwich was expensive which was exacerbated by the parking ticket I got WAITING for a simple sandwich which would later make me run to the BR because I feel TERRIBLE- so take this with a grain of salt because I'm annoyed that slow service = $70 parking ticket. heart burn AND nausea.
author: Molly R.

description: Get the beets & greens, and sub pita chips for croutons. Everything's a little pricier than say, McDonalds, but it's worth the extra $3 to me to get something totally delicious that can even pass for healthy. Also worth noting, I actually think everyone who works there is always pretty lovely, and the rice crispy treats are delish.
author: Mandy Z.

description: I eat here regularly and Blue Barn consistently delivers a fresh salad with tasty, fresh toppings.  Their sandwiches are also good but its the quality of the salads that is really Blue Barn's sweet spot.  It's a busy spot but they do a solid job of getting you what you want in a quick and orderly way.
author: Glen R.

description: Blue Barn is one of my go-to lunch spots in the Marina area.  The menu is primarily soups, salads, and sandwiches, and everything I've ordered has always been fresh and delicious.  My staples are the Fattoush salad and the Muffalata sandwich.  This is a hot spot, so when I'm in a rush I'll call in my order to avoid the wait.
author: Stephan H.

description:
Naysayers be gone!    

I've read both the positive and (sadly) negative reviews for BBG and have to say that the folks at Blue Barn have paid attention.  While still an intimate setting, the quaint little takeout deli now sports five new bar seats  and seating for 4-6 on the sidewalk. As for the price?  The high-quality ingredients (many locally sourced) are worth paying for. 

The generously portioned salads are my favorite, offering unique combinations of fresh greens, produce and other delicious offerings.  And if you find their collective palate differs from yours, you can stray from the menu and make your own combination, including freshly grilled shrimp, chicken, beef and a variety of other tossed-to-order ingredients.

The sandwiches (6 different grilled cheeses alone) are inventive and... well.. delicious and they offer several soups and other tasty sides as well.  

Of course who can forget that they serve Blue Bottle Coffee?  I could just end there.

The best part is that all of this is served up by a polite, professional and ebullient staff.  I would go just for Teresa's contagious smile.  :-)

So for those who have not been... go.  And for those who were so quick to write it off?  Give it one more try.  Chances are it will be worth your while.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
Excellent variety of salads, including a build your own option. I took that route, and had a hard time choosing what to top my spinach with, a list that includes corn, black beans, tomatoes, strawberries, tangerines, apples, edamame, carrots and cucumbers. There are definitely plenty of healthy options. 

For all the goodwill generated by the versatility and friendly service, I thought it  was a little overpriced, as any protein was extra.

BTW, watch out for the house BBQ sauce, it's a bit on the spicy side.
author: Jason B.

description: Aside from being a zoo because it is very small and always crowded, I really enjoy this place.  The food is high end, unique and fresh.  The salads can be shared between two people so long as you aren't starving.  I would recommend calling ahead and picking up if you are considering take out.  Overall, bc the quality of food is really good, I give it 4 stars.
author: Chris C.

description: I think these are the best sandwiches in the whole city.  Burrata grilled cheese is probably very likely my favorite.  I don't think you could go wrong unless you are absolutely unbelievably not hungry.  The salads have always been good and I still have yet to make it to the soup since the sandwiches are so perfect.  And the line is not an hour or two, nor do you need to call ahead.
author: Today Y.

description: Amazing salads!  Love love love the one with greens/ricotta/tomatoes/pumpkin and mustard dressing?  Protein options are okay quality.  Staff is happy, friendly, informative, and helpful.  Those huge chocolate chip cookies by the register are delicious!
author: Ali G.

description: This place serves great sandwiches and salads for a quick take-out meal. The old-fashioned roasted turkey sandwich with goat cheese, sun dried tomatoes, watercress and pesto aioli on ciabatta was a great choice with a side of french fries. The line to order can be quite long, but usually moves quite quickly.
author: Lisa C.

description:
my new favorite lunch spot.

amazing salads.
my pick:
Beets & Greens: mixed greens, pomegranates, goat cheese, roasted beets, strawberries, caramelized onions, candied pecans, garlic croutons & balsamic vinaigrette

grilled cheese when i'm hungover.
my pick:
Burrata: roma tomatoes, roasted red peppers, fresh mozzarella burrata, arugula & pesto aioli on ciabatta

check the cute boys working in the kitchen, tattooed & talented!

it's perfect.... eh, minus one star for making me pay $9 for a salad.
author: tiff f.

description:
So. So. Good. 

Salads, sandwiches, super friendly staff. The outdoor eating is also nice when you can get it, and even though it's little they haven't tried to cram in more tables than the place can really hold. Good portion sizes, great ingredients, just all around such a good lunch place.
author: Sarah M.

description: Disappointed no expresso despite being a blue bottle outlet. Drip coffee $4 expensive. Food ok. Service rather slow but staff pleasant.
author: Colin C.

description: Good Burrata sandwich, just enough bread/cheese/tomato/greens combo to make my mouth happy. The quality ingredients make this especially delicious.  Why 4 stars? Too spendy for the product. Give us a small salad on the side, greens aren't that expensive.
author: Libby T.

description:
Really love this place for a chill-out kind of lazy lunch.  Best when not crowded... which is not often!  They have an interesting selection of sandwiches and salads, but by far, my favorite thing to get here is the "U Pick" salad with spinach, pine nuts, tortilla strips, bleu cheese, sun dried tomato, garlic-grilled prawns and chipotle dressing.  Definitely more pricey than a custom salad from Plutos, but their selection of add-ins has substantially more depth.

I like the diverse crowd that this place draws.  You get a lot of the typical Marina crowd, but you also get the retired folks, moms with baby strollers, and hipsters from different neighborhoods.

Everything is made-to-order, so its always fresh... and the service is impeccable!  Not well-suited for groups of more than 3 or 4.  Probably best done solo or with 1 other person.  Smallish eating area, but great Chestnut Street real estate, which easily accommodates a few tiny tables.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
My boyfriend I got take out during half-time of the Redskins game.  We got the rooster and the buratta to split.  For some reason the bread today was a little too hard and I had trouble biting into it -it wasn't stale but maybe baked a little too long. 

Rooster: very delicious but I wouldn't get again for the $$.

Buratta: It was tasty but not enough buratta, it seemed like it was all bread. 

I"ll prob come back here occasionally for the smoke, but too expensive to frequent often.
author: Katie S.

description: Great sandwich and friendly service. We missed the rush on Sunday morning, and that was a good thing. My little guy loved the fries. It was absolutely tasty, and the staff was nice and kind to an out-of-towner who had no clue how the order/pickup process works.
author: Chris E.

description: I stopped into this lovely little place post-work out, and I was starving. I read down the sandwich menu and thought - YUM - muffalata! I made my purchase and was on my way. Now, I've had a lot of medicore sandwiches in the city, and was expecting more of the same. I was wrong! This sandwich was delicious! The meat tasted fabulous and was not mystery meat. The combination of the meats and cheese, with the tapenade made me want more. Even the bread was excellent - fresh, crunchy, and of course, the sandwich was served warm. YUM!!!! I went back a couple of days later, and tried the burrata. Again, totally delicious! Melty cheese, pesto, tomatoes, and amazing bread. I will definitely go back for more.
author: Kath v.

description:
disappointed is the word.

i had high expections for this place:
-conveniently located around the corner from my gym
-blue barn = blue bottle coffee?  yes!!
-cute storefront and selection of side items
-panini selection looked mouth watering.

alas what i found was:
-slow to open which leaves me milling around the door at 11:10am like a desperate fool muttering "open!open!open"
-blue barn = NO bottle coffee?!  "we dont have our espresso machine yet and we still have to get trained"
-cute store front = TINY with two measly tables and 4 barstools to fight over.
-panini was way salty, leaving my mouth watering for water, and my wallet crying for the $9 i just spent on a smallish soggy sandwich.

sad.
author: Josie M.

description: Came here on a weekend trip to San Francisco and absolutely loved it! Got the Clubber sandwich and the jalapeño-bacon aioli was fantastic. My friends got the Rooster and a couple of the salads and loved all of them as well. Definitely want to come back next time I'm in the city
author: Leah B.

description: I truly think the reason the people who work here are a bit bitchy sometimes is because Marina clientele doesn't always consist of the most pleasant of folks. I came in here the other night and the woman who was ordering her you-pick salad was so rude to the lady behind the counter that I literally wanted to hit her upside the head with my bottle of coke (Mexican by the way, the best Coke in the world)....Who knew it was a cardinal offense to put beets instead of peas maybe if you weren't so self obsessed with you iphone she could have understood you.... The way this beezy was talking to the lady was out right appalling.... Let me step off my soap-box and on to say you pick salads here are soooooo good. Albeit a smidge expensive, and parkings a complete bitch, but sooooo worth it when you are craving something healthy.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
3.5

My lunch for 11/26/07... Read my review after Pres a Vi (next review) if you wanna do something cultural, indeed, my HIGHLIGHT of my TOIKEY DAY WEEKEND.

***

What is UP with the Marina opening or RE opening new places? It must be me bringing in some luck with these stores ... hehheh... Pretty darn impressive for a place that JUST opened ... everytime i pass by BB, there's always a line out the door ... 

Another deli on Chestnut, woo hoo... A combination of Lucca & Plutos. +1

Lucca // Pluto is still on the tops for me. Way better, well I haven't tried the salads yet, so.

This cute lil wooden shack looking deli is a new spot that seemed to have opened recently. Staff is friendly, willing to give you a sample or two, but you can't beat Lucca on endless and a wide variety of samples...BB's sample consists of their side salad which wasn't all that spectacular, but i give +1for trying.

Have varieties from salad (available from mixed or dry) for $7.50 to Chef specialty salads($8-15) to sandwiches and paninis... you get to pick and choose your own salad in the back, kinda like the Pluto concept or they already a few for you to pick and choose from.

I decided to go for their BUDDDHA, sandos from the kitchen, and for $8.. lemme give you some useful pointers, my friend ... I have to say

1. $8 was so not worth it. basically, a normal looking sandwich for $8. woohoo. Note the sarcasm, thanks! -1 
2. AND Yes, you are prolly paying a portion of their rent...
3. Repeat #1 & #2. 

What is Buddha? Imagine a glop of hummus, red pepper, onions, cucumbers, watercress, roasted portbellos and feta on toasted whole wheat... didn't taste no hummus. AT ALL! -1 well, I did, but I expected some huge chunk, and hummus goes better with pita, not toasted wheat. Perhaps if they had more cucumbers, and in big pieces, like the ones you put over your eyes for an eyepack ... they were diced up into eety bity quarter sizes ... again, that's just me.

Limited seatings, you can only fit 6 people, which faces the infamous Chestnut street. Uh... you either have a cafe style concept seating at least 15 or keep it small and cozy.. iono... sry folks, im in the mood of  "this and that" 


ill say it again, and again, but it was just too tiny. yea, its worth another look, but not anytime soon.


TIP: Closed Tuesdays, but opened other days 'til 9pm. +1
author: Jennifer S.

description: Amazing sandwiches, especially The Rooster. One of my favorite quick bites in SF. Salads here are pretty good as well. It's a little pricey, considering you're basically buying a chicken sandwich most of the time, but such is life in SF. Their fries are great, too.
author: PM M.

description:
Lousy, s---l---o---w service and just okay food.  Seems like there are 10 people "working" there.  None of them are tasked with customer service.  The airhead who eventually took my order today seemed more concerned with catching up on gossip in the kitchen than helping customers out front.  

How hard is it to make a salad?  Waitress Spacey & Co. made it seem like the Manhattan Project.  Got back to work and lunch was not what I ordered.  Last time I was there, two p.o.'d take-out customers returned to get items that were either wrong or left out of their orders.  Please, whoever owns this place -- and I hope it's not the owner of the great Blue Bottle Coffee Co. -- you can do better than these giggling nimrods.  They're costing you money.
author: Lawrence S.

description: Okay, so I love the food here, but learn some manners. The girl who answers the phone always acts like I'm such a terrible person for calling in my order. This past time she actually hung up on me before I was finished ordering. For the price, I'm just not sure it's totally worth it anymore. Yes, it's good, but I can't deal with jerks being this way when I want to order my dinner. That, and the fact that they've started totally gypping on the protein. Blah. I'll resort to them once in a while because I do love the salads and it's super close - but I'm still very upset with the witchy witch who treats customers like rap.
author: Monika M.

description: Their sandwiches are awesome but sometimes the line makes it not worth it. I wish they would be able to cut that down on weekends.
author: Cristin M.

description: This place is great.  My coworkers and I come here from the Explo for lunch and love the salads and sandwiches.  The ingredients are so fresh and delicious.  I love the exterior and the staff is always so friendly and helpful.  Oh also, the fries are perfectly salted and I recommend them to anyone!  Yum yum!
author: Shannon P.
