description: I love, love Blue Barn's salads. They are delicious, and big. They use all organic, local food which is a big plus. My only complaint is that there isn't enough seating and it's always busy.
author: Lynn M.

description: Bumping up to four stars. I'm addicted to the caesar there. I have a weak mind and get sucked in easily.
author: Mike C.

description:
Quaint surroundings. Simple service. Gourmet food.

You can build your own salad or opt for a specialty salad from the menu.  The moment I saw the 'beets and greens' salad on the menu, I was excited. The salad was a fresh mix of greens complimented with generous amounts of beets, goat cheese, caramelized onions, candied pecans, croutons, and to add a sweet touch... strawberries!

The sandwiches are equally delicious.  When I tasted the 'sheep' grilled cheese sandwich, all I could say is that is "one grown up grilled cheese".  The sandwiches come with a piece of Bazooka gum for the kid in you.
author: Ashley Q.

description:
salads here are so, so good. love how they chop up the vegetables into little cubes.. cubed beets, cubed roasted bell peppers... the ingredients are gourmet, and they don't charge extra for getting the "premium" ingredients either unlike other salad places (e.g., mixt greens).

wish i could give it 5 stars, but the service is not only slow, and less forgivably, frankly sometimes rude. i've stood in front of the salad bar waiting to customize a salad and the guy making pre-ordered salads didn't even look up for 2-3 minutes until i was like, "umm hey. i ordered a salad." only then was he like, "it'll be about 10 minutes."
author: Jessica W.

description: I am obsessed with Blue Barn and eat here at least once a week.  It is one of the few places where you can order only  a salad and really have it be a meal.  They move extremely quickly and is great to order dinner for pick-up during he week!
author: Lisa B.

description: What's with all the Blues...Blue Bottle, Blue Fog, Blue Jeans, and now Blue Barn? A bit overwhelmed by the sandwich and salad descriptions (who writes these things?), I opted for the grilled cheese and ham sandwich (admittedly pedestrian) - which was a creative spin on the panini with a tangy mustard sauce. I think they've perfected the perfect sandwich. How about including a side of blue chips?
author: Leah B.

description: Gotta give an additional big thumbs up to the Grilled Cheese sandwich selection. The turkey argula can't be beat. Oh, and they took the gourmet cheese section out,  to I assume make room for more dining-in options. And they do serve wine and beer now :)
author: a p.

description:
yum, this is one of my new favorite places! and how convenient that it's just around the corner from where i take barmethod, and it's pretty 'healthy.' i love the tostada salad and the rooster. full of flavor and i love how they both have just a hint of spice but isn't over powering. the tostada salad is so yummy and has a great blend of textures with crunch and crisp! plus, it's perfectly tossed...so hard to find. most places i ask for lightly tossed and they clearly ignore my request or whatever, but still comes drenched in dressing, so i'm left eating either soggy lettuce or having to ask for dressing on the side, which is fine, but i prefer a salad that's already tossed. but here, i didn't even ask for light dressing and it came perfectly tossed anyways!! they have a bunch of other salads to choose from or you can build your own :)

the rooster was also really good. chicken with avocado and bacon...yum. plus, i loved the chipotle aioli. again they get it right, without totally smothering the bread, there's just a light spread of aioli. you can always ask for more on the side if you want, but having to take it off is a little more cumbersome. blue barn does it right with fresh tasting ingredients that aren't smothered with sauces and dressings.
author: Angela W.

description: Number 1 in my sf sandwich triumverante. Amazingly delicious goodness and fresh ingredients.
author: sean o.

description: Definitely a great place to grab a large and pretty loaded salad.  The food is great and the service is super friendly.  Its a little pricey but the portions (at least on the salads - I havent had anything else) are huge and can easily be two meals - at least for me.
author: Carla R.

description: My Saturday morning ritual is as follows: Bar Method followed by Blue Barn. I am obsessed with both. I've had just about everything on the menu, but a few of my particular favorites: the tostada salad, the Sheep, Goat cheese, and Burrata sandwiches, and the Skirt Steak sandwich. Heaven. The mac and cheese isn't the best, but I do consider myself an expert of all things mac and cheese related and am hard to please.
author: Noelle Q.

description: I had a turkey sandwich with aioli and cheese, it was toasted warm and i ate it so fast as to not let my friend ask for a bite. really quite good. Not the healthiest one i have had but a nice indulgence. The salads they were bringing out looked amazing. Will have to go back and try that next time. i highly recommend.
author: Erin R.

description:
A great new gourmet sandwich/salad shop in the Marina for your lunch/brunch needs!   A great selection of fancy and healthy-looking salads and sandwiches with some addictive-looking cheese to boot.  I have had the "Hen" which was a very tasty chicken sandwich, and the Beet salad which was also fantastic.  But only go there after 2PM (that way I can make sure there is no line when I make my order... :) ). 


Watch out Lucca!
author: Charlie G.

description: Cute place with good food. Coke with real sugar, rice crispy treats bigger than your fist. Grilled cheese is good.
author: Neil S.

description: They make really simple sandwiches and salads here, and what makes them pop are their super-fresh ingredients. I've been here a couple of times with my sister and have enjoyed it each time. The prices are ridiculous (that's why I always hesitate to get the grilled cheese-- I have trouble shelling out ten bucks for something I'm good at making myself), but it's the Marina so you kind of expect that. Simple as it is, the flavors are nicely balanced and the carbonated drinks they have are appropriately snooty (Izze and San Pellegrino? What is this, A.G. Ferrari?). They should have more seating, given how crowded it gets inside with the line, but all in all it's got a good menu and good ambience.
author: Bianca C.

description:
Ok....Yes I was in the Marina, but for good reason....to get a tasty salad...;)
My gf and I decided to take our bar review studying to a different locale...hopped on the bus and headed West....jumped off at Chestnut and ventured over to the Grove and then Blue Barn.  We are talking a damn good salad!  I went with the Fattoush and she got the Beet Salad.  Perfectly dressed with a liberal amount of ingredients.  These are not run of the mill either....you'll see things like sushi ginger, seaweed, pita chips and chicory greens!  
Anywho...they serve sandwiches and paninis here as well, which look downright awesome, but for someone who is sitting on their butt for at least eight hours a day, I will stick with salads thank you very much.
Fyi.  This is definitely a grab and go or quick sit down place....don't think you will come and gab the afternoon away...take your talk down the street to the Grove...much more conducive for that kind of thing...;)
author: Sheila Y.

description:
this place to grab a sandwich or salad when I have no clue what I want to eat for dinner.  there is never anywhere to sit so I always have to take it to go!

I usually get the cheddar-- it is a great mix of toasty cheese and ham and spicy mustard.

the only downside is that the sandwich is a bit greasy. if you do takeout, don't forget the napkins.
author: Che P.

description: I'll be honest...I don't know why so many people give this place such great reviews. And I want so badly to like it--I keep coming back hoping that my next meal will be better than what I ordered last time. Don't get me wrong--this is about the food. The staff is always incredibly nice and efficient. The food is fresh...but it's nothing special. Especially given how much they charge! I've also had their sandwiches--the kickin' chicken was disappointing. Tonight was the last night I'll come back--I ordered a make your own salad and they messed up my order and put the wrong things in--of course since it's to-go I didn't have the opportunity to have them correct this. The worst part--I didn't order by telling the cashier, it was written down on their order form and they still got it wrong...paid for an expensive salad that wasn't even what I ordered...ugh! I'm done.
author: Claire J.

description: Solid Spot. Nothing spactacular. I had the Skirt Sandwich and my girlfriend had the Rooster. Both were good, not great. I will probably go back eventually, but not anytime soon.
author: Blake W.

description:
Great sandwiches, fantastic salads and friendly service. I love this place - I'm there at least 3 times a week and the girls behind the counter are super nice and remember my name every time I come in. 

Yeah it takes a little while for the food to arrive and everything is expensive but you're paying for quality ingredients, and, you're on Chestnut, so everything is crowded and spendy.

Can't miss if you're in the mood for a sandy or salad.
author: Dan W.

description: I wasn't sure about having salad or sandwiches for dinner but after having it here, I am a convert.  Yes, it's kind of pricey, but you can't beat the ingredients or the quality.  We shared the Beets & Greens salad and the Rooster - chili-lime grilled chicken with Niman bacon and avocado, which were awesome.
author: Pelle Y.

description: Please do not come here, otherwise I will be forced to wait in line longer than I already have to.  If you do come here, then be sure to get an espresso drink, as they serve blue bottle coffee - yum!  Everything I've had on the menu so far has been very good.  Free wiki courtesy of the apple store a few doors down.
author: Chris N.

description: Really dig the food...however, for $8 a sandwhich I would at least hope for small pile of salad on the side...alas I will prob be back.
author: Mark L.

description: omg, this place is amazing. i finished my who order, salad just the way you want it, protein seperate. i heard that lines were long though, i happen to get there during a time when there was no line.
author: Tiff W.

description: Eh.  This is really a 3.5 review, but since some of my friends are addicted to this place I'll round up instead of down.  You can build your own salad here, which is nice.  We shared some sandwiches the other day, and they were just OK.  The smoked salmon would probably have been great had we eaten it there instead of taking it home.  Unfortunately, the bread got sort of soggy and bleh on the walk.  I'll try it again and keep you updated.
author: Amanda B.

description:
fantastic salads. fresh ingredients. friendly service.  i am glad it is small.

celebrity you won't see here: woody allen
author: Angela N.

description: Love this place and their salads! Detox salad is the way to go if you are looking for something super healthy, delicious and to help you shed the pounds. Little pricy but so worth the organic, healthy deliciousness.
author: Anna R.

description:
The only people leaving 5 star reviews here are the ones for which money is no object.

I paid $11.35 (that was no typo) for a Hummus and Red Pepper Sandwich + a Root Beer.  No sides were included.  The sandwich was small, and included no meat.  That is outrageously expensive.

The only reason I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 1 or 2 is because the sandwich was, admittedly, delicious, and the staff was professional and very friendly.  But still ... Come on ...  $11.35!!

In the future, my hard-earned money is going across the street to Lucca's to get a tasty sandwich for half the price.  Sure, it's not made of hoity toity local organic holistic spiritual leaf lettuce, but it's still delicious.
author: Chris F.

description: Definitely 3.5 stars but not 4.  This place offers very fresh salads and sandwiches.  The salads either come make it yourself or several menu selections.  Don't get me wrong, the salads are well portioned, the ingredients are fresh and different from a typical salad place (blood oranges, portabello  etc)  and taste very good.  My severe problem with this place is the prices.  All the salads come and cost around $10.  Add meat and your looking at an additional $3-$5 and the meats are nothing crazy, although the steak is great but $5 extra.  If this place made their salads slightly more reasonably priced, I would give it some more credit but when I spend $30 for two salads I question its true value.
author: Eli Z.

description: They are unable to handle their own success.  I had been a regular customer since they opened and they simply cannot handle the volume of orders.  On more than one occasion the employees have been downright rude and blame their inability to get out food on how busy they are.  It should not take 30 minutes to get a grilled cheese!!!  Even better, they screw up a grilled cheese and then your other food that was supposed to be "hot" sits while they redo the grilled cheese and they get cold - no apologies just excuses on that they are just so busy.  I guess they will be out $50 or so bucks a week we used to spend there and I am know I am not the only one who has felt this way.
author: Dan G.

description: Delicious salads.....I always end up ordering the same thing because it's so perfect...the nicoise salad!   I need to go there more often so I can try new things!  Great food and a perfect lunch spot!
author: Leslie B.

description: This place is good...kind of expensive but it's ORGANIC.  The portions aren't huge but the quality is great. The staff is young, friendly and has always had a smile.
author: F B.

description: The salads are good, but I wish they had competition because I'd definitely go somewhere else - the counter staff is rude. Terrible customer service. Too bad Pluto's isn't organic...they're so nice!
author: CMF l.

description: Excellent! A perfect place to go for a casual lunch. The bread was delicious, and the ingredients were very fresh and well prepared. I'll have to indulge in a salad next time...
author: Matt D.

description: This place is amazing! I have never been disappointed by the food and have always been impressed with their flavor combinations. My only complaint is that it closes too early....
author: Beth H.

description: I love the Blue Barn.  Been coming here for awhile now.  The staff is extremely nice and the sandwiches and salads are the best around.  Tasty and very healthy.  A great lunch option in the area.
author: Frank K.

description: My friend told me how great their food was especially the grilled cheese so I decided to go in there after work yesterday. I decided to get the tosdada salad because it sounded amazing...and it was! I was impressed, to say the least. My salad was about the size of my head (which is pretty big) although slightly pricey it was wayyy worth it. The place is small with a few bar seats and a couple tables. I will be going back...probably today...I need to try the grilled cheese!
author: Nikki O.

description: My total go-to.  Huge creative yummy salads served in a huge bowl.  Gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches and delicious soups.  Perfect any time.
author: Danielle B.

description: i love this place! i have only ordered sandwiches and the "create your own salad", soooooo good! my fave is the "rooster". i usually order it for pick up and the barn ladies know you by name. so sweet! the ingredients in the salad are super fresh and delicious. be back again. and again. and again... you get the point :)
author: Oyo S.

description: I so wanted to love this place and had high, high anticipation - and I was not let down! The sandwiches are absolutely fabulous and I am dying to try the rest. You want to buy everything there, seriously - the chips, the meats, it all looks delicious. I can't wait to go back and try more of the yummy goodness!
author: Sarah R.

description: The bbq chicken sandwich is quite tasty, with the perfect amount of chicken/cheese/onions/sauce/veggies inside. However, I'm knocking off a star for not having an available restroom for customers and also for the high prices. It's quite high for the sandwiches.
author: Glaciala A.

description:
cute little place, they've got a large selection of salads and sandwiches,,,  i had the chinese chicken salad which was soo huge which is great!  think about sharing the items cause they're certainly big enough,,  a little on pricey side tho...

try to grab a seat by the windows to people watch..  with the sun streaming in it's a relaxing place to chill...

only drawback, no bathroom?  or maybe it was just out of order when i was there...  the staff recommended that we go to starbucks or pottery barn for the restroom.

I'd go back  after a day strolling around the marina.
author: Vickie Y.

description: I wrote a review for them with four stars before. I have to admit that I still like their salad. But the problem I have recently is that I got my boss's boss hooked on their Chinese chicken salad minus the chicken. She had asked me to picked it up for her four times now.Two of those time they forgot the dressing. I know the first time I went in was a bit busy and hectic so I don't blame them and neither does my boss's boss. But the second time I made sure I went in early and I made sure I ordered everything correctly. Well they forgot it again and I am embarrass to say that if you can not remember easiest thing like salad dressing then what  else will you forget next time? My boss's boss just got so pissed off at them and at me on the same wagon. Why is it my job to have to remind them to check on salad dressing?Well sorry to say that they just lost their biggest client they could of have cuz they were talking about having this place cater their next staff luncheon.
author: S F.

description: Finding a good salad place can be quite difficult. But I think I found one! This place has such great variety to pick and choose from. These folks don't skimp on their salads and if you are the kind (the picky kind) then make your own and trust me you wont be disappointed!
author: sandhya ..

description:
My friends and I went to this place after hearing about it from a classmate. The place is small and is located in a very busy street, parking was stressful. Their menu choice is pretty decent. You can either choose the menu salads they have or make your own for $9. They have a wide selection of salads, dressings and toppings to add to your salad. If you want a fast lunch on the go don't come here unless you call ahead. My friends and I waited for about 30 minutes for our salads the first time but once we called ahead for the order it was quicker. I recommend the hearts of romaine with the garlic caesar dressing. 
The first time I went my salad was ruined because instead of white cheddar cheese they added blue cheese which I find disgusting. But the second time I got exactly everything I asked for and the salad tasted great. They also have options of adding sirloin steak, chicken or grilled shrimp to your salad. I recommend this place for those of you who love salads and like to make your own.
author: Shirley E.

description: Ohh Blue Barn, how I love you so... Blue Barn is the best thing that I've stumbled across in the Marina. The sandwiches, salads, and grilled cheeses are BOMB!! I think my favorite is the turkey sandwich, which has goat cheese- my fav. The other thing I love is that they, like Lettus, support organic sustainable farming and fresh ingredients. The one problem I have is the amount of space for seating. It's always hard to try to get a seat to eat here, especially if you are in a group of three.
author: Sarah T.

description: This place is fantastic! A friend and I came on a lovely Saturday afternoon and got great, friendly, and fast service. The sandwiches are a bit pricey but man oh man are they good! We got the turkey sandwich which was great and also the "Sheep" grilled cheese sandwich with manchgo cheese and figs which was to die for. I highly recommend this place for a great gourmet picnic at Crissy field. Also, I dont know if they cater but I'm thinking about finding out for my company's next function.
author: Sofia S.

description: I stubled on this place yesterday by actually scoring a spot right in front of it... I went and got a cup of coffee as it was super early and trolled around the shops until it was time to open. When I arrived at 11am, there were already 3 people in line ahead of me WTF?! This must be serious....true to the subliminal message of the pack, it was. I had the rooster and it was kickin' I'll be back again real soon to try out everything else; including the homemade mac & cheese and the chicken potpie Yum!
author: Season F.

description:
I dropped in for a turkey sandwich, chips, and a coffee yesterday.  The sandwich was heavy on the turkey and light on the lettuce and tomato.  You've also got to love cheese with your sandwiches, which I don't.  $8 was a bit steep for a veggie depraved sandwich in my opinion, though the Blue Bottle coffee was good and strong.  
I liked the way they designed the space to be barn-like.  I also liked the long high table on the left as you enter.  It appeared conducive to conversation with neighborhood folk while one waits for their sandwich to be produced.  There was a bit of a wait for this, and my friend's sandwich was even later in coming.  I thought they has forgotten his order, actually.  It did eventually appear.
This spot is definitely geared toward take-out, as people point out here.  The staff were sociable, attractive, and friendly.  I liked that they called your order out by name.  Also, the bazooka gum packed inside of the sandwich wrapping was an unexpected and nostalgic touch.
author: Roland C.

description: I love the Blue Barn! Their single best sandwich is the Rooster...trust me on this one. Get it and it will be the only thing you order from this place. The ladies that work in the front are beautiful, friendly, and bad ass. I love the ambiance, people, and food...so what are you waiting for?!?!!? I've been eating here since I moved and I'm still in love.
author: Mike G.

description: This place is not that good. They are extremely stuck up and they serve you old lettuce. I was not impressed or pleased with my lunch. Will NOT go there again.
author: C C.

description: hmm...this place gets a lot of hype.  i think salad is salad.  keep it meaty and keep the price down.  thank you.  i say that without ever having a sandwich...and i hear they're good so keep in mind i'm talking just salad here.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: Great place!! I try to stop by and pick up my lunch at least twice a week. Try their Chinese chicken salad! The only bad thing is there is always a line so if your always in a hurry this may not be the place for you.
author: K. D.

description: I love this place, and I give it 5 stars even though it is a little pricey and always crowded. I will happily shell out $8 - $12 for one of their fabulous sandwiches or salads! Their food is so fresh and delicious. My only complaint is the price, but hey its SF - everything is expensive.
author: Ang H.

description:
ahh, the marina. the capitol of the more/now mentality. 

how about appreciating what you have? this place is great. at least once i week, i breeze in before work to enjoy a little delicious. i am almost always greeted with a big smile and a hello. (perhaps, you would be too if you offered the same in kind. i'm just sayin'.)

the rooster (i like to add a hard boiled egg) is a fantastic sandwich treat. and on the days that i feel bad for consuming vegetables only in the form of incidental lettuce on my sandwiches, i have the fantastic chinese chicken salad, sos...

in short, i've never experienced the sort of 'life ruining' drama that some fellow yelpers have. go to blue barn. support them. be nice and they'll love you long time.
author: Johnny R.

description: Bad food and abusive service  with snob appeal.  If you are stupid enough to spend your money here, the emperor has a new gown you might want to try on....
author: joanne g.

description:
Pretty good sandwiches.  But $22.50 for two sandwiches and a bag of chips?  Really?  Add the wait, even for to-go orders and it's just okay. 

If you're going to visit, don't go near lunch-time.
author: Reed G.

description: i wish there was a blue barn in mill valley! i would pick up a salad every day!
author: Courtney M.

description:
at first i wasn't impressed.  they place is tiny with two tables and no restroom.  but then i took one bite of my grilled ham and cheese and whoa!  that was one of the best sandwiches i've had in a long time!  some kinda sharp cheddar cheese and ample amounts of ham (the way it should be).  it was great.  we complimented the chef and took our grub to go...

i'll go back anytime....
author: dave g.

description: This is a great little take-out spot. I had one of the best sandwiches here, it was stuffed with so many delicious things; advocado, grilled veggies, caramelized onions, hummus, etc. It is a little pricey (my veggie sandwich was $8.50) but worth it. The ingredients are so fresh and full of flavor. I can't wait to come back and try another one of their amazing sandwiches or salads. Great spot to pick up lunch for a picnic on Crissy Field.
author: Laura Gardner S.

description: Loved this place! We stopped by for a quick dinner before heading to the Exploratorium. Great selection of really fresh and quick food. I had the beets and greens salad; husband had a "sheep" grilled cheese panini. Both were very good, and overall we were really happy with this place. My only (minor) complaint is that I wish they'd do a half salad/sandwich/soup type deal.
author: S M.

description: want a bomb, mouth watering sando or a huge bottomless salad.....this is ur place. So good, healthy, and refreshing to have here in the city.
author: Britt B.

description: This place is freaking delicious.  I've gone here three times now and it has always been amazing.  Highly recommend the tostada salad w/ skirt steak or the chinese chicken.  The portions are HUGE and fitting for the price.  The service is good and honest, not FAKE.  Definitely recommended for take-out, as the place is quite small.  One more thing- i walked in and ordered my salad today and was out in 3 minutes! Super speedy!
author: kiki W.

description:
Definitely overpriced for what you get. My friend built her own salad and got the tri-tip on it. Tri-tip was good, but there were only 4 slices. I had the Nicoise salad which had way too much dressing on it--plus I found a long hair in my salad--what a way to kill the appetite. I would rather go to Pluto's and get a salad there for less than half the price.
Also, it gets crowded and the staff is snooty.
author: Vyl C.

description: blue barn is that guy in college that you know is not right for you, but you keep going out anyways because he's attractive on paper and you're bored. it will never be the gia pronto salad i love from philly, but i'm a fan of low-cal goodness and here's what i recommend: fattoush (w/ extra dressing...you're getting a salad -not a philly-cheese steak - don't be ashamed of the need for flavorlicious sauce )-- Or the tostada--but  watch out! it can get spicy after 5+ bites,....
author: SJ P.

description: This is my favorite place to get salads. The ingredients are fresh and perfectly combined. Their sandwiches are also delicious, but I can never pass up the salads. It's a great spot for lunch or an early dinner.
author: Kristin N.

description: The best yet on Chestnut for those of us who don't cook.  You could go multiple times a week and never be disappointed.  The sandwiches are amazing, not to mention the grilled cheese specialty menu.  The build-your-own-salad is a great antidote to the more indulgent options.  Spendy but somehow worth it every time.  Also fun to watch how they keep reconfiguring a very tight space to fit in more hungry souls.  Wish they were open an hour later and had a restroom.  Oh, well.
author: Kelly J.

description: I'm absolutely addicted to their tostada salad.  The salads are huge and the options are many and fresh.  The tomato and basil soup has a nice flavor as well.
author: Grace R.

description:
If you can get past the bitchy girls running the cash register - the food is good.  But frankly - I swore off this place a few months ago due to the rude service - gave it a go once more and experienced the same thing.  Hellloooo girls taking orders and money - you are friggin cashiers -  get over yourselves.

Oh and did i mention the wait to get your food is also probably also not worth the food itself.
author: J M.

description:
Fantastic!!!  

My sandwich, the Rooster, AMAZING.  This will be my new go-to place for when I want to pick up food for a night in.

The selection is superb!  Next party I throw will definitely have a few platters from Blue Barn.
author: Melind H.

description:
Seriously good...best of it's kind in this neighborhood.  I have been in multiple times, and have been happy each time.  The fattoush salad is great, and the green egg salad sandwich is super delish.  The nicoise is not at all a nicoise, and I wouldn't necessarily recommend it.

It's healthy, gourmet grab and go food.  The salads and sandwiches are much better than Lettus, and they have Blue Bottle coffee!!!
author: Karen H.

description: Food is fantastic, coffee was excellent, but service is extremely slow, took them 25 minutes to make a sandwich and a coffee and there were just 2 people ahead. Staff was very friendly, will return
author: Sandy p.

description:
great tasting sandwiches and salads.  fresh ingredients - turkey sandwich is my favorite.

service is decent, some of the staff has a hipster-"im too cool for you" attitude.  i was once overcharged, but didnt realize until after a few days when i checked my credit card statement.
author: Eddie K.

description:
Food is great but the ridiculous wait for that food, which happens every time I go there, is why they only get 3 stars. I know that "good things come to those who wait," but 20+ minutes for a sandwich, EVERY TIME I GO??  Also, there's like 10 seats inside, so now I call ahead and take it to the beach.  But it's still not ready after I call. 

I bet the snotty Marina girls just love this place.
author: Eric D.

description:
Just finishing my salad from Blue Barn...its an adequate salad (well, the Neiman Ranch steak is outstanding), and the ingredients are top notch quality.  However, it took the kitchen 25 minutes to make it.  25 minutes.  I walked in the shop at 12:25 and walked out at 12:50.  Not 25 minutes to eat the salad--I'm doing that at my desk right now--25 minutes for them to make my salad which I ordered off the menu (Tostada).  

This is the second time of been to Blue Barn and I promise it was my last..I waited forev's the last time too.   I guess the owner wants to offer a pretty face to the public, but those marina girls work at a snails pace.  Oh, and my salad with steak + diet coke was $17.  

I'd rather head down to Pluto's on Steiner.  That place is delicious & cheap!
author: connor o.

description: I used to like Pluto's salads, and now I can't go back.  The ingredients of their salads are fresh, fresh, fresh.  The greens in themselves have a lot of flavor even without the toppings.  Sandwiches are yummy, but I wished it had something on the side for the price that they charge, like a couple of chips or something.
author: sandy s.

description: They finally remodeled and figured out their service situation.  Food is really good, but they still need to train some of their employees how to handle lines.
author: Schuy K.

description: AMAZING! the sandwiches, salads and cookies are great... worth the price....so fresh and so tasty.
author: morgan t.

description: Greasy crunchy bread + chewy tough ham + 9 dollars ala cart= ripoff shit. Don't know for sure but the salad stuff behind the bar looked weak too.  We need a Grilled Cheese like Ludlow NYC but obviously not in the Marina.
author: The I.

description:
I've been going into Blue Barn pretty regularly (I live right around the corner) since they opened.  I've seen some staff come and go but, the regulars who still work there are always friendly and the service and food has always been exemplary.

Until about an hour ago. I got a sub par salad for the first time ever and when I tried to return it the manager (I assume he was the manager) treated me like I was some thief that goes around eating half of a salad and trying to return it to scam restaurants out of the money. 

He starts telling me that he tasted it and theres nothing wrong w/ it as if theres some scientific way to objectively discern that something that tastes bad to someone can be disproven  and he says people come in all the time and return salads to rip them off. So now I'm a liar. This is what I like to do. I go into places that I frequent regularly. I wait until they know me by name and then try to scam them for $11 or whatever it cost and skip the country to live on my stolen salad money.

Then he starts giving me the condescending 'I suppose I have to pretend that I want to give you your money back' act. The bad salad was one thing but, being talked down to and treated like a liar is completely unacceptable. I will never go to Blue Barn again. You can keep the $11
author: Sam C.

description: Good food, not so great with service, very slow and rude. We love the food although you pay very high prices for it, sometimes you just have to have it. Unfortunately even if you call in your order you may still wait well over 20 min. for it once you arrive to pick it up. This is because they are very disorganized at the register and often pretty rude. They have lost my order, and given me the wrong order more than once and they don't hesitate to huff and roll their eyes while speaking  in a very patronizing voice if you ask for it to be amended.  This is a shame because the food is quite good even though the wait is always long and the prices high. And heaven forbid your name is not Matt or Sue because the gals behind the counter will not be able to call out your order when it eventually becomes ready.
author: T P.

description: my sister and i shared two sandwiches: the turkey and the burrata.  the burrata was the winner, although the bread was not grilled (despite being on the "grilled cheese panini" part of the menu). they were generous with the cheese and the tomatoes were sweet.  the salads looked good, and we regretted not sharing one of those instead of the turkey sandwich.  the side of fries at our table were thin and crispy.  overall, i liked this place, especially sitting out front on a beautiful day.
author: micaela r.

description: All right, Yelp-y hipsters, I cannot promise you that parking won't be a nightmare or that there won't be a long line of frat-tasticness and Juicy sweatsuits to contend with, but I can honestly guarantee that you will forget all about how much you loathe the Marina once you take one bite of Blue Barn's burrata grilled cheese. Each and every sandwich at Blue Barn is a home run, chock full of the highest quality local, organic ingredients and executed with care (down to the Bazooka gum and napkins neatly tucked into the paper wrapping). I especially appreciate Blue Barn's approach to sandwich composition -- they riff on classic combinations (turkey and cheese becomes roast turkey with goat cheese and sundried tomatoes) but without getting too fancy pants or overdoing the number of ingredients. Yes, Blue Barn is a little pricey at $7.50-9 per sandwich, but the portions are hearty and you are clearly paying for ingredient quality. Ah yes, and 8 million extra bonus stars for at long last bringing crack, ummm, I mean Blue Bottle coffee, to Chestnut Street.
author: Heather F.

description: The food here is fantastic.  Love the grilled sandwiches and especially love the beet and pomegrantite greens salad!  Try it you'll love it!
author: Debbie M.

description: Really nothing special about this place. What I experienced was an overpriced sandwich and overpriced cup of coffee with bad service. Blue Bottle coffee, as artisan coffee, should be priced at a premium over Starbucks. Blue bottle and other retailers such as Bittersweet and Blue Fog charge $2 for a cup of drip coffee. Why does Blue Barn charge $2.75? Don't they get the same discount from Blue Bottle that Bittersweet and Blue Fog does?
author: Roger R.

description: Great make your own salad bar! I think it's the best around!!! I've also tried a few of thier sandwiches which are served on this amazing thick bread that seems homemade. It's too bad they don't serve their salads with that yummy wheat bread! The Buddha is good and so are their grilled cheeses. Overall, my favorite salad spot in the Marina.
author: Chelsea L.

description: Both the salads and the sandwiches are extremely good! It is one of my favorite places to have lunch! I prefer to grab and go, because it is a small place and always very crowded, but if you want to have a seat, the decoration is really cute!!
author: Joana R.

description: Delish salads and sandwiches!!  I love their huge salads with super fresh ingredients.  My only complaints are that sometimes the wait is long...and also, the salads get pricey if you want to add any proteins or extra items.  But the service is always nice and you feel healthy walking out of there.
author: J O.

description: Order The Rooster sandwich, with fries...dont ask questions
author: Dan V.

description: good food, quality ingredients, but really expensive. Two salads = $27???? A $3 or $4 charge to add meat to salads is pretty steep. Better than plutos, unless you're talking about my bank account.
author: Kay T.

description: I love their food and I'm completely addicted to their blue bottle coffee. But I'm going to have to agree with Lawrence S. comments about their customer service. It STINKS! The first time I went there I waited several minutes at the counter with other customers before the the woman behind the counter even bothered to turn around and greet me. I will never understand how something as simple as a salad or putting meat between two slices of bread can take that long when there are no other customers in sight. I would go here more but the lousy service is a major put off.
author: Marie S.

description: My hubby and I first hit this place shortly after they opened and what we got were a couple of sandwiches. At the time we decided not to review the place b/c we were also hoping to have some Blue Bottle coffee which they couldn't serve yet b/c they didn't have their machine. So, we got our sandwiches (he had tuna and I had manchego and pancetta) and went to Peet's for coffee instead. The sandwiches were okay, my hubby was kinda sad that he didn't get a piece of Bazooka Bubble Gum wrapped along with his sandwich. But with or without the gum, the sandwiches were just okay, too pricey for what we were expecting - they were kinda smallish. Anyhoos, we went back and although this time we didn't get food, we did finally get Blue Bottle coffee. And though it took a while, there was just one girl in the front, and there weren't any fancy leaf designs in my hubby's cappuccino or my latte, it was still a pretty good cup of Blue Bottle coffee. Not screaming hot, perfect temp actually and you still knew it was a fine cup of coffee. So, as far as the food goes, not sure we will try it again, but at least we know there's Blue Bottle in the Marina! Huzzah!
author: cora j.

description: Their food is wonderful! I had a BLT and a tollush? salad. They give you really big portions of their salads which tickled me. I thought the service was decent. Although reading some reviews made me a little weary of this place. The cashier was nice but the salad maker kept glaring at me with the corner of her eye. Perhaps I'm being paranoid now. I love their decor and will definitely go back here again when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: M M.

description: LOVE Blue Barn. Hate their prices... and the marina.
author: Emily S.

description: Friendly service and good fresh and organic food. Theresa is always so sweet and friendly (can you tell I go there a lot!) The people that work there remember my name and are always friendly. The only thing is, yes they do get busy because they are THAT good and reasonable. Hard to find a place to sit as well but I get take out a lot - I love them!
author: Michelle D.

description: my recommendation is the rooster sandwich!! it's a bite pricey for a sandwich but it's worth it.  the portion is large that you can eat some now and save some for later.  next time i'll try the salad menu.
author: rosemarie l.

description: I love this place. I go about once a week for lunch and can honestly say I have never had a bad meal there. The sandwiches always taste great  and the salads are always fresh and made the way i like. Its a little small, but you can always order to go and eat at the marina greens. The people there are super nice which is also a plus.
author: Charlotte P.

description: Fresh and delicious!  I frequently call in my order to avoid the line and it's always accurate, fresh, and ready on time.  If you're not a salad lover I'm sure the prices might surprise you, but the fresh ingredients and over sized bowls are worth it.  You could definitely share a salad or take some to go for later.  I love the sweet taste of the balsamic vinaigrette. The grilled cheese is also yummy.  The people are friendly and I've never had a bad experience at Blue Barn.
author: Katherine D.

description: loved everything i've ever ordered here.  sucks they don't have seating...but take out to a local bar and i am good to go.
author: jessie h.

description: Damn, The Rooster is good -- I think the crack aspect of this sandwich is the smashed avocado combined with the spicy aoli...damn...
author: Tonya M.

description: If you're looking for an amazing salad or sandwich in the Marina, you should stop by Blue Barn!  It's a tad bit overpriced, running at about $10 a sandwich, but that's pretty much how it is at every restaurant in the marina so I don't blame them....rich people love paying a lot of money for things!  I work in retail right down the street, so when I make it in to Blue Barn I usually order their turkey sandwich, which is one of the best I've ever had....they have some special sauce they put on it or something that makes it ridiculously incredible!  Their salads are also a little expensive but super, super delicious....and the portion they give you is so big you can have it for the next 3 meals.  The staff there is also really nice and there is plenty of seating to enjoy the nice Marina sunshine outside...although they do get pretty packed around lunch time during the week.
author: Isaac W.

description: I love the the people who work behind the counter here! genuinely friendly!! Also , they had a great selection of salads and the freshest most delicious cookies ever!!! Not to mention the barn-themed store is cute!
author: fookah h.

description: Salads are amazing here. Their sandwiches are just as great. This is so much better than Pluto's, except their pricing is a little bit on the high side. Staff is much friendlier than Pluto's too, which makes it the ideal neighborhood grub hub. One thing I should mention, they don't have many seats available, so on busy rush hours, better get it To Go.
author: Chanli S.

description: Truly my new favorite place! Everything I have tasted there is amazing! I highly recommend trying this new find in the Marina. Its worth every penny!
author: becca k.

description: had a fantastic salad tonight - the tortilla with grilled shrimp.  too bad it was $15 with a bottled water.  good thing i don't live in the hood anymore or i'd go for broke.  want to come back periodically though and try all the things.
author: e w.

description: i love blue barn salads.  the beets and greens is what i usually get if i'm too overwhelmed with all the choices they have for making your own.  fresh ingredients.  they also have really good grilled cheese sandwiches and are kind enough to make them vegetarian!
author: Jennifer K.

description: ever need a quick place for great soups,salads n sandwich this is the spot for it..no drama,clean n easy..gets busy in the eve for take outs but orders get to u fast..great BLT's...
author: lovetoeat n.

description: This is a wonderful spot to stop for a quick bite to eat. There isn't much seating room here, so my friends and I often take our food to go. I am not a big "meat" eater and this place has so many vegetarian choices! Some of my favorite choices include the burrata sandwich, the buddha sandwich, and the fattoush salad.
author: Sarah R.

description: All i really want in life is a salad bar that has something interesting that I can add to otherwise tasteless leaves. Blue Barn has things like apples, pears, greap fruit, spicy agave chili dressing, and other cool additions that you can put in your salad. It's expensive, but like I said, all i really want in life...
author: R M.

description: Good paninis and salads.  Really fresh ingredients.  I had their wakame salad and added chicken.  It was a big bowl - didn't know how I'd finish it but I managed to!  My friend got the mozarella/tomato panini and it was really good.  We also got a side of fries (kind of defeats the healthy purpose) but they weren't too greasy and very tasty.  They were the "frites" style, thin and crispy.  I definitely want to go back and try their other salads, particularly their chinese chicken.  It's small in there but cozy.  Can't be afraid of other's listening in to your convo!  Oh, and did I mention they serve blue bottle coffee?
author: Ming Y.

description: I'm not a sandwich person (too many working lunches at my desk!), but the one I got here (the Hen) was solid.  Minus two stars for the slow service; I was the only one in the restaurant and it took ten minutes.  They get one star back though for the free bubblegum!
author: Mark F.

description: Love it. Great salads. What this place is missing is more space.
author: Amy H.

description: The salads are great here.  And for $8.50 you get to choose six toppings!  What a deal!  I like the salads here so much better than Mixt Greens downtown or Pluto's.  I can't wait to try some of the other foods like the sandwiches.
author: Brian L.

description: The Rooster sandwich I had was pretty tasty, yes, but the service was VERY slow (20 mins to get a sandwich?) This only exacerbated the problem of being tortured by the sound of schmaltzy Jack Johnson music they had playing--on and on and on--an entire album of this crap? Stick to good service and good food so people aren't waiting in a crammed area. It would also help to ask the mothers to wait outside with their double-wide strollers.
author: Brad T.

description: This is my favorite salad/sandwich place in all of SF. I love the feel when you walk through the doors, I never knew a salad could taste so good, and the people that work there are so friendly! What more could you ask for??
author: Hallie P.

description: The food, although delicious, was tasty because of how greasy and fatty it was.  There were no real alternatives that both tasted good AND were good for you.  I would normally give a place like this 4 stars because it's not like I didn't know it was going to be unhealthy.  I gave it 3 stars instead because of the customers.  The group of people in there when I went are the types of people that give Marina residents a bad reputation.  Unfortunately, the restaurant can't do anything about the customers who come in.
author: Josh C.

description: simply amazing sandwiches! they have a good salad bar too! food was so fresh yummy!
author: Aaron C.

description: such a cute, rustic-y place!  great selection of healthy salads and sandwiches.  love how the take-out salads come in these chinese takeout boxes big enough to fit a small dog.  unfortunately, the fattoush salad was quite bland, and the pita chips had a slight charred flavor to them.  this place has a lot of potential, so i am going to go back and give it another chance.
author: Lily K.

description: the sandwich gets 2nd place behind the sexy ladies taking my order but the speed of service sucked donkey balls...which is the primary reason i don't want to go back here. it took 25 minutes for a turkey sandwhich. last time i waited this long for a sandwich i almost went postal. this time i was chilled out cuz so many bangin' chicks were walking thru the door. in fact, this neighborhoods best import/export is the skanks. thats all i have to say about this shit hole.
author: Jared R.
